reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviewList.review:
The LG C3 OLED is the latest model in LG’s popular C series of OLED TVs, which have consistently delivered excellent picture quality and features for high-end shoppers or for shoppers looking for something closer in price to mid-range TVs while delivering S-tier performance. The C3 OLED boasts a sleek and minimalist design with an ultra-thin panel. The C3 OLED also supports four HDMI 2.1 inputs with various gaming features, such as 4K 120Hz, VRR, ALLM, FreeSync Premium Pro, and Nvidia G-Sync12. For the purposes of my review, we're going to focus on gaming, as that's been my overwhelming, primary use for this TV since it arrived and I got it all setup a little over a month ago. Here are my thoughts for the gamers reading this, and I hope it helps you make a decision -- this is for the 65" model:

The LG C3 OLED is a great TV for gaming on various platforms, and I have connected and used virtually every type of gaming experience, such as PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X, and even my ROG Ally. Here are some details about its gaming performance:

- The LG C3 OLED supports 4K 120Hz gaming on all four HDMI 2.1 ports, which means you can enjoy smooth and detailed gameplay on the PS5 and Xbox Series X. The TV also supports VRR (Variable Refresh Rate), ALLM (Auto Low Latency Mode), FreeSync Premium Pro, and Nvidia G-Sync, which can reduce screen tearing and stuttering and optimize the input lag.

- The LG C3 OLED has a very low input lag of around 10ms, which is ideal for fast-paced games that require quick reactions. The TV also has a near-instant response time of less than 1ms, which means motion blur is minimal and action scenes are clear and crisp.

- The LG C3 OLED has a wide color gamut and a high contrast ratio, which can deliver stunning HDR gaming with vivid colors and deep blacks. The TV supports Dolby Vision IQ, which can adjust the HDR picture based on the ambient light in the room, and HGiG, which can optimize the HDR gaming experience according to the TV's capabilities.

- The LG C3 OLED can also handle lower-resolution gaming well, thanks to its upscaling technology that can enhance the image quality of 1080p or 1440p content. The TV can also play 8- and 16-bit games from the Nintendo Switch without any noticeable banding or artifacts.

- The LG C3 OLED has a new feature called Game Optimizer, which is a dedicated menu that allows you to adjust various gaming settings, such as black stabilizer, white stabilizer, low latency mode, and sound mode. You can also access the Game Optimizer from the Magic Remote by pressing the Game Optimizer button.

Overall, the LG C3 OLED is a versatile and impressive TV for gaming on different platforms, and it can provide a smooth, immersive, and enjoyable gaming experience that won't break the bank.

reviewList.reviewTitle: The best all-around OLED TV for most people
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is my first OLED TV and all I can say is WOW! If you’ve only had LCD TVs in the past, the OLED difference is very noticeable with the infinite contrast and 3D look that it gives to the image. My biggest concern with this TV was that it wouldn’t be bright enough but even during the day with 3 windows shining light into the room I’ve found it’s plenty bright enough, and a lot brighter than the budget LCD TV I had before (Vizio M658-G1). LG supports everything you could want in terms of gaming with 4 HDMI 2.1 ports for 4k/120Hz Dolby Vision gaming, VRR, ALLM, etc. I play Xbox Series X on it and it looks amazing! I also play Nintendo Switch and with a few tweaks like upping sharpness to 15 and turning Super Resolution to high it looks almost 4k! Everything I’ve watched on it looks better than ever before and I can’t say enough good things about it. After considering all my options I decided on this TV over the other options:
- Compared to the LG G3: A lot cheaper but with the same processor for equal upscaling and clarity. The G3 is noticeably brighter but, like I said, I haven’t felt like the C3 wasn’t bright enough and it was brighter than I expected
- Compared to the Samsung S95C: Again, much cheaper and the processor is better than that on the S95C so lower quality content will look cleaner, especially lower bitrate like YouTube TV. The S95C is much brighter and more colorful but Samsung has quality control issues, poor firmware updates, and no Dolby Vision HDR support
- Compared to LG C2: The C3 is very similar to the C2 and it’s hard to justify the price increase of the C3. It was worth it to me since I got a good deal and only paid a few hundred dollars more. The C3 has an improved processor with improved dynamic tone mapping with 20,000 zones instead of 5,000 and is a little bit brighter. It also supports DTS passthrough and QMS unlike the C2. A common complaint about LG OLEDs is their aggressive dimming during prolonged high APL scenes. That issue was fixed on the 2023 models. Lastly, the C3 has a new customizable quick access menu that’s nice for changing settings in a snap
- Compared to Samsung S90C: This is the C3’s biggest competition this year because they are close in price. The S90C has the better QD-OLED panel and is brighter and more colorful. I went with the C3 because of the Samsung issues I mentioned above with the S95C. I just trust LG more than Samsung as a company to support their products for years to come. Also, QD-OLED appears to have more risk of burn-in and I like to keep my TVs for a long time
- Compared to Samsung S95B (2022 model): I wanted a 77” TV and the S95B only comes in 55” and 65”. Also, Samsung issues I mentioned before

Conclusion: The C3 is probably the best all around OLED TV for most people. Everything I’ve watched on this looks incredible and LG is a brand you can trust when it comes to OLED. They’ve been making them longer than anyone else and they’ve figured out how to prevent burn-in for the vast majority of users. If all you do is watch news or sports channels all day long then OLED probably isn’t for you but if you watch a variety of content from movies, TV shows, gaming, etc then I think this might be the best TV you can buy. Unless you can afford the LG G3, of course

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewList.review:
I had an old Vizio 50” for many years, I’d guess about 8 years. While I had the money, I just never wanted to spend it since the TV was fine for me.

Well, I got some Christmas gifts that were money, with the express idea of helping me buy a TV. I chose this 65” LG OLED. It’s enormous, possibly too big for a 1Br apartment tbh, lol. I had to move my couch back a little bit.

The blacks are jet black, and the whites (simultaneously) are bright enough that it looks like glare coming from them. It’s a vast difference from my old TV. The picture is amazing, and it’s 120 Hz. Coupled with a PS5 (or Xbox, or PC) it’s awesome, it even has a substantial amount of gaming settings and a little gaming dashboard. It’s like a whole different experience than my old TV. It also has all of the modern smart TV features, including of course streaming services (I used to have to use my PS5 for HBO Max, but no longer).

I love it tbh. It’s a lot of money for something that honestly would be fine at a lower quality offering, but I’m happy with it.

It was delivered with “chose the room” type of service, which I picked because I live on the second floor, so they carried it up for me. I set it up myself and disposed of the box/garbage.

Make sure if you lift the top of the box off to get to the TV that you pull out the foam insert in the top of it, that’s where the remote and stuff is. Lifting the top off is best in case you want to save the box intact, but the foam piece is basically pressed in there, so you’ll have to carefully pull it out from the very top of the box. At first i thought I was missing stuff because I’m not the brightest.

The sound is like having small PC speakers with a subwoofer, it’s far beyond my old TV. It has very loud bass, not like older TVs.

If you haven’t upgraded in a while, it’s a pretty cool experience. It has a ton of features and settings. I love it, no issues so far and set up was extremely fast (I don’t have cable, I only use streaming stuff, so maybe that’s why). Slowest thing was downloading the LG app and making a profile, then connecting. Otherwise? Very fast and easy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this on a Black Friday special so the price was very good IMO. This TV is a huge improvement over our old 4K TV. The picture is amazing and the sound output is so-so (as expected). We are currently using the apps on the LG TV. So far the LG apps are not bad but we may switch back to ROKU. Again, no surprise there since most reviews slam all of the TV app systems. The remote is really something for those of us who have not had a TV upgrade in a long time. Point it at the TV and a cursor appears to speed up navigation. Also does voice commands. The OK button in the middle of the navigation buttons is a wheel that allows you to scroll. It probably does more stuff that I haven't discovered yet. Nice remote. Great TV.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture quality. Easy setup. Works with every source we've tried.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviewList.review:
Very bright, crisp resolution, good contrast, excellent audio from HDMI-ARC, nice power-save feature, screen casting from laptops works perfectly without any add-on devices.

The only drawback is the balance of the remote control - not intuitive for visitors to use and they tend to adopt a 2-hand hold to get it pointed where they want. Once you learn it, it is fine - or switch to voice control after setting up your favorites and leave the remote in a drawer.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Lacks ability to install TV provider app.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviewList.review:
Pros: Great picture quality (best quality I’ve had yet) easy to set up, decent standard audio.
Cons: Doesn’t have capability to download Dish Network app. I replaced this with a smaller smart Alexa TV thinking I would have the same ability to download the app for my TV provider to avoid paying for another Dish TV box. However when I searched to install the app it was not available, when I called LG customer service they said I need to purchase a Firestick or Roku in order to get the app. LG apparently doesn’t have an agreement with Dish TV to allow the app to be installed. Frustrating since I paid $1,000 for a “smart tv” and it can’t deliver a basic app. Now I have to purchase a Firestick which seems redundant (and a waste) for a brand new smart TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is pure OLED. Nothing better. Every other TV tech over the last 20 years has been a workaround for NOT being OLED. Mini-LED is as close as it gets to OLED and it still pales in comparison to OLED.

OLED is pure, unadulterated picture. Combined with modern processing, 120Hz, 4K+ and modern connectivity and smart features and you have a powerhouse, beastly TV.

Gorgeous frame. 1/4” thin screen is mind bending. Premium OLED branding on back of TV, Stand and more.

The picture is absolutely gorgeous. Infinite contrast down to the single pixel level. Expression enhancer and tone mapping make it look 3D jumping off the screen when viewing certain content. I’m upgrading from a 60” LG 4K LED HDR from 2016 that had some serious internal problems. It’s a world of difference now.

I will say, LG’s picture presets take A LOT of manipulating and adjusting to get your perfect preferred settings for each one. ( it saves it and says “User settings” in parentheses after you adjust it. So you know you’ve changed it. ) If you don’t know what you are doing or what to look for in these settings you will be losing out on precious image quality. I’m not sure why they let these panels ship with such horribly calibrated settings when these are part of their premium OLED line. But it’s not a huge issue. Just takes some time and input. If you don’t have the knowledge do some quick research online and you’ll be good to go.

It’s worth the premium. Don’t go back to LCD tech. Backlights are terrible.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: Outstanding! Great investment in entertainment! You can depend on this television to actually work as advertised, and save your valuable time buying the wrong products and returning them later. In the past, I'd be hesitant to connect other products online, but this one has functioned without interruption. So far, updates serve the system well! It adapts to the content being played. It has plenty of options to adapt settings yourself. It works perfectly with my surround sound system. It adapts well to the programmed content and maximizes broadcast offerings. I love how it can function as both a "still" and "moving art frame" as well, with content that is "always on" in low power and improves the look of your living space. Handles all incoming data from my console seamlessly. Handles all "technological handshakes" like a pro! Plenty of HDMI 2.1 connections! Very thin, sleek and sharp design! Light! Amazing product!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Beautiful picture, difficult settings menus, confusing remote actions.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviewList.review:
Picture is beautiful once set up. Nice inky blacks. Gets more than sufficiently bright except on full screen white. Common OLED issue.

Problems with setup. You basically are signing your life & privacy away to use this TV. Sign up is convoluted & difficult, significantly hampered by the remote constantly switching modes between pointer & digital pad mode.

Out of the box, once you get past all the activation menu's, default settings for filmmaker mode does not have those nice inky blacks, it is about equivolent to a high grade VA panel levels light bleed. Trying to find & use settings to correct this without affecting peak brightness was quite time consuming but I was able to finally accomplish that. Please note that part of my difficulty setting this up is due to my age related shakiness & having had a previous stroke which affected me physically but not intellectually.

Once I finally got this set up the picture was everything I was hoping it would be. Definately brighter than my LG 27" OLED monitor in its most accurate settings.

Once properly set up the picture can at times take on a 3D like appearance without any grayish haze that you get with even they best LCD type TV's or monitors including those with the mini LED type backlights. Granted it is quite subtle but still there on the mini LED type TV's.

Once you get past set up issues this is quite possibly the best TV in it's size class.

If it was just based on picture alone it would get 5 stars but set up issues & remote functionality & ease of use down grade this to 4 stars.

Note; that to experience the best viewing one should be in a darkened room as due to its inky blacks & amount of detail in the dark areas of the screen which is the way movies were meant to be watched anyway.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviewList.review:
Just after I bought it the price on the 77” B3 dropped to 1750$. I would choose b3 over the c3 for the 500-700 difference. But it arrived and looks great not worth sending back to swap once I got it.

Anti glare is pretty good. It’s a glossy tv not Matt finish which I like and the screen reduces glare quite a bit over my last tv. It has a pinkish violet color to the light reflection I think it cuts the white light reflected down by having it be a bit darker it still reflects some light but I can actually watch tv or movies with the lights on and not be annoyed. For serious watching like a movie I turn off the background lights in my room. But daytime viewing is excellent. oled is amazing I have top of the line Sony mini led and it is no competition. At the store I couldn’t tell the difference but at home where it’s not super bright lit room like a store I can see the difference

Add says they ship out in one day but it didn’t ship for 4-5 days but it did arrive on time the date it said it would. So i can’t fault them for that.

Seller had lowest price anywhere. I think I got a special deal by luck but I do want to give them credit for great pricing.

I would purchase from them again.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Doesn't get much better than this!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviewList.review: This TV is absolutely stunning. When it comes to a home TV, OLED panels come out on top in every way and it's not even close. With this TV, LG checks all the boxes too in terms of desirable premium features. 4K, HDR, 120hz, Dolby Vision & Atmos, VRR, ALLM, Nvidia G-Sync AND AMD Freesync Premium. Then the game optimizer mode that brings it all conveniently together in one menu. In my opinion, this is the best TV around right now for gaming. Even aside from gaming, watching any kind of content is a great experience as well. My previous TV was a now 4 year old 50 inch TCL Roku TV, which doesn't even come close to comparing in any way. This is my first time going for a high end more expensive TV like this and I'm very happy with my choice for sure. If you're looking to get a more premium display and you're a gamer as well then this is the one for you!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Cut the cord and WOW, just WOW
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
Play Video
 Pictures and Video are right out of the box shots and taken on a old Samsung Phone so obviously not 4K.

We just last month 'cut the cord' and decided replace our old Plamsa TV w/ our first Smart TV.
After much researching we decided to go w/ the 65" LG C3 OLED.
We watch TV in what is basically a Theater atmosphere so the brighter LG G3 was not needed and much more expensive.
That said, this TV is plenty good in bright room light.
There is also NO drop off as you move around the room like that on a LED.

Out of the box.... and just 41 pounds.... the picture on the C3 AMAZED Us!
Sharp, clear, seamless video w/ gorgeous color on a 4K HDR Fish Tank Video.

I am a photographer and so a fanatic on picture quality.
LG's Picture Wizard does a darn good initial setup!
Researching reviews/settings for the TV recommends turning off Energy Saver.
Also a few tweaks for Contrast, Brightness, Color Saturation, etc. and we were good for watching 4K HDR.

I didn't care greatly for the SDR as I like lifelike not 'punchy' Video.
After some research I found a site (RTINGS) that had recommended settings for watching the C3 in SDR.
THIS tweaking made a world of difference in the quality of the Video.
This was especially noticeable on the Video from our old SDR TiVo Video Recorder.
You can then tell the TV to apply these HDR and SDR settings across All Inputs.

I can't really speak to the Sound Quality as I run all my sound through an Onkyo AVR and Mission Speakers/Sub.

If you are coming from a 'Dumb' TV setup, where everything runs First to your AVR then uphill/out to the TV/Monitor, you will need to do some research on ARC/eARC HDMI.

This and all Smart TV,s run downhill.
Cable Box, Gaming, Blueray, etc go first to your LG TV through HDMI in Ports.
Then an ARC/eARC HDMI transmits signals from the TV to an ARC/eARC Port on your AVR Receiver.
It also, in my and in most cases, turns on and sets the AVR as I turn on the TV or Inputs through the TV.

The LG C series has a GREAT Menu for helping this and ALL setups.

As my old HDMI cables were 10 years old I did buy new 8K HDMI Cable 2.1 cables for ARC, XBOX, TiVo .

The Remote has a Cursor/Pointer Feature that comes on when you shake/pickup the remote.
THIS takes a bit of time to get used to, but is easily turned off.

ALL IN ALL We LOVE this TV and after only a week have just scratched the surface on the user interface.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review:
I use this for 3 different purposes: office work, gaming, and watching tv. Its amazing for all those things.

Office use:
I was worried about text clarity and general size issues but I quickly got used to this giant 42" montitor in place of my dual monitor setup. You can easily snap 4 windows to each corner and be super productive

Gaming:
The game optimizer feature is really nice. VRR works very well, and ofc it looks amazing. It feels super immersive for rpg/adventure games. Probably too big for fps games though.

TV:
Its a quality oled display, cant really go wrong with movies and video in general

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture quality, smooth action for sports and movies, good value for an OLED
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviewList.review: Got the LG OLED C3 to replace an aging LED TV. Huge difference in picture quality and smoothness of action images. Deep blacks, vivid colors. Brightness is good, too. We have had no problems with daytime viewing in a fairly bright room. I wanted to bypass LG’s opening screen and WebOS, which I was able to do with a little work and a SofaBaton U2 Universal Remote. Probably could have also done this with the LG Magic Remote and a little patience. All in all, great picture for a pretty reasonable price for an OLED TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
While this TV is spectacular, I had a small issue with the full-service concierge delivery. Yes, they brought the TV into my home, yes they unpacked and attached the stand to the TV, yes they set the TV in place, and yes they took away all the debris. But after they left, I found two screws and three plastic mystery parts on the counter. Since everything seemed to be working perfectly and since nothing was falling apart, I just tossed these "extra" parts (I'm trying to NOT continue to throw stuff in our "junk drawer".

Then last week I decided to replace our other aging TV with a second one of these great LG TVs. Concierge delivery was no longer an option so I unboxed and set up the TV myself (Youtube has several wonderful videos on this). It was simple and I immediately saw where the two missing screws should have been inserted in the TV stand. Also saw where the three missing plastic mystery pieces should have been attached.

I don't think that these unused screws and cord holder plastic (mystery) pieces are an issue but I am surprised that the delivery guys, who said they set up these TV all the time, would have failed to finish these set-up details.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Outatanding picture. Mindblowing after moving from QLCD.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review: Picture quality is outstanding. Brighter than my old early gen QLCD. There is a higher level LG G-3 supposed to be brighter, if that is your main concern, but no reason to spend 1k more....and G3 tech is new. I have enjoyed this tv like no other I have experienced before. My advice: do some research on Sony and Samsung but keep these important aspects in mind. This TV has better protection against burn in and is brighter.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great TV! terrible bloat and spyware.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviewList.review:
I like LG OLED TVs and this one is no exception to that. Its a great picture and installation experience. I dont like the trend of spyware built into these TVs so they can keep making money off of us even after we spent an arm and a leg on the hardware its self.
DO yourself a favor and disable these to the best you can. At least there are some options to do this that are on by default. Also check after every update cause they like to sneak in and reset these options.
Other than that my experience has been great. Considering all the major manufactures are building in these "smart" features, there's not much you can do about that part.
I use external stream boxes mainly because of this. They aren't really any better though.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Better picture quality than my old Plasma TV
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviewList.review:
Loving this new LG TV. Delivery was great - we left the garage door open and they placed it inside.
Easy to unpack (there are some helpful Ytube videos on this - would suggest you watch). Picture quality is perfect when you use the FILMMAKER MODE setting. Connecting to our home WiFI was super easy also.

PS - pickup a cheap ($20) bluetooth keyboard and mouse pair. Makes using the LG menu's MUCH easier than using their Wand remote (although you still need the Wand handy for some stuff).

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviewList.review: I debated for sometime over whether or not to spend $2500 on this TV. Well, it went on sale for $2149 and I couldn't pass it up. I'm absolutely thrilled with my decision. Going from a 120" screen projected by an Optoma HD28HDR to this is a night and day difference. The vibrancy this tv offers is truly wonderful! Who knew downsizing could be this exciting!! My recommendation, if you're in the market for the best quality TV and can't quite justify spending $5000 on the M3 model, this C3 is 100% the way to go. Best price to quality on the market as of 01/2024

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviewList.review: Me and my husband are senior citizens and have owned many Tvs. We never thought we would see a better picture than from a plasma Tv. Using the settings of the chart I have with this review are outstanding! If you do not get a incredible picture after these settings just return the Tv as you most likely received a Tv with a bad panel. We have the Tv in a dark room 10 x12 with a Vizio sound bar through the earc. The dolby Atmos and digital sound is outstanding. Watching Jack Reacher on prime which is streamed with Dolby Atmos and Dolby Vision is outstanding. Buy it and enjoy!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviewList.review:

For the purposes of my review, we're going to focus on gaming, as that's been my overwhelming, primary use for this TV since it arrived and I got it all setup a little over a month ago. Here are my thoughts for the gamers reading this, and I hope it helps you make a decision -- this is for the 65" model:

The LG C3 OLED is a great TV for gaming on various platforms, and I have connected and used virtually every type of gaming experience, such as PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X, and even my ROG Ally. Here are some details about its gaming performance:

- The LG C3 OLED supports 4K 120Hz gaming on all four HDMI 2.1 ports, which means you can enjoy smooth and detailed gameplay on the PS5 and Xbox Series X. The TV also supports VRR (Variable Refresh Rate), ALLM (Auto Low Latency Mode), FreeSync Premium Pro, and Nvidia G-Sync, which can reduce screen tearing and stuttering and optimize the input lag.

- The LG C3 OLED has a very low input lag of around 10ms, which is ideal for fast-paced games that require quick reactions. The TV also has a near-instant response time of less than 1ms, which means motion blur is minimal and action scenes are clear and crisp.

- The LG C3 OLED has a wide color gamut and a high contrast ratio, which can deliver stunning HDR gaming with vivid colors and deep blacks. The TV supports Dolby Vision IQ, which can adjust the HDR picture based on the ambient light in the room, and HGiG, which can optimize the HDR gaming experience according to the TV's capabilities.

- The LG C3 OLED can also handle lower-resolution gaming well, thanks to its upscaling technology that can enhance the image quality of 1080p or 1440p content. The TV can also play 8- and 16-bit games from the Nintendo Switch without any noticeable banding or artifacts.

- The LG C3 OLED has a new feature called Game Optimizer, which is a dedicated menu that allows you to adjust various gaming settings, such as black stabilizer, white stabilizer, low latency mode, and sound mode. You can also access the Game Optimizer from the Magic Remote by pressing the Game Optimizer button.

Overall, the LG C3 OLED is a versatile and impressive TV for gaming on different platforms, and it can provide a smooth, immersive, and enjoyable gaming experience that won't break the bank.

reviewList.reviewTitle: The best all-around OLED TV for most people
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is my first OLED TV and all I can say is WOW! If you’ve only had LCD TVs in the past, the OLED difference is very noticeable with the infinite contrast and 3D look that it gives to the image. My biggest concern with this TV was that it wouldn’t be bright enough but even during the day with 3 windows shining light into the room I’ve found it’s plenty bright enough, and a lot brighter than the budget LCD TV I had before (Vizio M658-G1). LG supports everything you could want in terms of gaming with 4 HDMI 2.1 ports for 4k/120Hz Dolby Vision gaming, VRR, ALLM, etc. I play Xbox Series X on it and it looks amazing! I also play Nintendo Switch and with a few tweaks like upping sharpness to 15 and turning Super Resolution to high it looks almost 4k! Everything I’ve watched on it looks better than ever before and I can’t say enough good things about it. After considering all my options I decided on this TV over the other options:
- Compared to the LG G3: A lot cheaper but with the same processor for equal upscaling and clarity. The G3 is noticeably brighter but, like I said, I haven’t felt like the C3 wasn’t bright enough and it was brighter than I expected
- Compared to the Samsung S95C: Again, much cheaper and the processor is better than that on the S95C so lower quality content will look cleaner, especially lower bitrate like YouTube TV. The S95C is much brighter and more colorful but Samsung has quality control issues, poor firmware updates, and no Dolby Vision HDR support
- Compared to LG C2: The C3 is very similar to the C2 and it’s hard to justify the price increase of the C3. It was worth it to me since I got a good deal and only paid a few hundred dollars more. The C3 has an improved processor with improved dynamic tone mapping with 20,000 zones instead of 5,000 and is a little bit brighter. It also supports DTS passthrough and QMS unlike the C2. A common complaint about LG OLEDs is their aggressive dimming during prolonged high APL scenes. That issue was fixed on the 2023 models. Lastly, the C3 has a new customizable quick access menu that’s nice for changing settings in a snap
- Compared to Samsung S90C: This is the C3’s biggest competition this year because they are close in price. The S90C has the better QD-OLED panel and is brighter and more colorful. I went with the C3 because of the Samsung issues I mentioned above with the S95C. I just trust LG more than Samsung as a company to support their products for years to come. Also, QD-OLED appears to have more risk of burn-in and I like to keep my TVs for a long time
- Compared to Samsung S95B (2022 model): I wanted a 77” TV and the S95B only comes in 55” and 65”. Also, Samsung issues I mentioned before

Conclusion: The C3 is probably the best all around OLED TV for most people. Everything I’ve watched on this looks incredible and LG is a brand you can trust when it comes to OLED. They’ve been making them longer than anyone else and they’ve figured out how to prevent burn-in for the vast majority of users. If all you do is watch news or sports channels all day long then OLED probably isn’t for you but if you watch a variety of content from movies, TV shows, gaming, etc then I think this might be the best TV you can buy. Unless you can afford the LG G3, of course

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewList.review:
I had an old Vizio 50” for many years, I’d guess about 8 years. While I had the money, I just never wanted to spend it since the TV was fine for me.

Well, I got some Christmas gifts that were money, with the express idea of helping me buy a TV. I chose this 65” LG OLED. It’s enormous, possibly too big for a 1Br apartment tbh, lol. I had to move my couch back a little bit.

The blacks are jet black, and the whites (simultaneously) are bright enough that it looks like glare coming from them. It’s a vast difference from my old TV. The picture is amazing, and it’s 120 Hz. Coupled with a PS5 (or Xbox, or PC) it’s awesome, it even has a substantial amount of gaming settings and a little gaming dashboard. It’s like a whole different experience than my old TV. It also has all of the modern smart TV features, including of course streaming services (I used to have to use my PS5 for HBO Max, but no longer).

I love it tbh. It’s a lot of money for something that honestly would be fine at a lower quality offering, but I’m happy with it.

It was delivered with “chose the room” type of service, which I picked because I live on the second floor, so they carried it up for me. I set it up myself and disposed of the box/garbage.

Make sure if you lift the top of the box off to get to the TV that you pull out the foam insert in the top of it, that’s where the remote and stuff is. Lifting the top off is best in case you want to save the box intact, but the foam piece is basically pressed in there, so you’ll have to carefully pull it out from the very top of the box. At first i thought I was missing stuff because I’m not the brightest.

The sound is like having small PC speakers with a subwoofer, it’s far beyond my old TV. It has very loud bass, not like older TVs.

If you haven’t upgraded in a while, it’s a pretty cool experience. It has a ton of features and settings. I love it, no issues so far and set up was extremely fast (I don’t have cable, I only use streaming stuff, so maybe that’s why). Slowest thing was downloading the LG app and making a profile, then connecting. Otherwise? Very fast and easy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this on a Black Friday special so the price was very good IMO. This TV is a huge improvement over our old 4K TV. The picture is amazing and the sound output is so-so (as expected). We are currently using the apps on the LG TV. So far the LG apps are not bad but we may switch back to ROKU. Again, no surprise there since most reviews slam all of the TV app systems. The remote is really something for those of us who have not had a TV upgrade in a long time. Point it at the TV and a cursor appears to speed up navigation. Also does voice commands. The OK button in the middle of the navigation buttons is a wheel that allows you to scroll. It probably does more stuff that I haven't discovered yet. Nice remote. Great TV.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture quality. Easy setup. Works with every source we've tried.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviewList.review:
Very bright, crisp resolution, good contrast, excellent audio from HDMI-ARC, nice power-save feature, screen casting from laptops works perfectly without any add-on devices.

The only drawback is the balance of the remote control - not intuitive for visitors to use and they tend to adopt a 2-hand hold to get it pointed where they want. Once you learn it, it is fine - or switch to voice control after setting up your favorites and leave the remote in a drawer.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Lacks ability to install TV provider app.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviewList.review:
Pros: Great picture quality (best quality I’ve had yet) easy to set up, decent standard audio.
Cons: Doesn’t have capability to download Dish Network app. I replaced this with a smaller smart Alexa TV thinking I would have the same ability to download the app for my TV provider to avoid paying for another Dish TV box. However when I searched to install the app it was not available, when I called LG customer service they said I need to purchase a Firestick or Roku in order to get the app. LG apparently doesn’t have an agreement with Dish TV to allow the app to be installed. Frustrating since I paid $1,000 for a “smart tv” and it can’t deliver a basic app. Now I have to purchase a Firestick which seems redundant (and a waste) for a brand new smart TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is pure OLED. Nothing better. Every other TV tech over the last 20 years has been a workaround for NOT being OLED. Mini-LED is as close as it gets to OLED and it still pales in comparison to OLED.

OLED is pure, unadulterated picture. Combined with modern processing, 120Hz, 4K+ and modern connectivity and smart features and you have a powerhouse, beastly TV.

Gorgeous frame. 1/4” thin screen is mind bending. Premium OLED branding on back of TV, Stand and more.

The picture is absolutely gorgeous. Infinite contrast down to the single pixel level. Expression enhancer and tone mapping make it look 3D jumping off the screen when viewing certain content. I’m upgrading from a 60” LG 4K LED HDR from 2016 that had some serious internal problems. It’s a world of difference now.

I will say, LG’s picture presets take A LOT of manipulating and adjusting to get your perfect preferred settings for each one. ( it saves it and says “User settings” in parentheses after you adjust it. So you know you’ve changed it. ) If you don’t know what you are doing or what to look for in these settings you will be losing out on precious image quality. I’m not sure why they let these panels ship with such horribly calibrated settings when these are part of their premium OLED line. But it’s not a huge issue. Just takes some time and input. If you don’t have the knowledge do some quick research online and you’ll be good to go.

It’s worth the premium. Don’t go back to LCD tech. Backlights are terrible.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: Outstanding! Great investment in entertainment! You can depend on this television to actually work as advertised, and save your valuable time buying the wrong products and returning them later. In the past, I'd be hesitant to connect other products online, but this one has functioned without interruption. So far, updates serve the system well! It adapts to the content being played. It has plenty of options to adapt settings yourself. It works perfectly with my surround sound system. It adapts well to the programmed content and maximizes broadcast offerings. I love how it can function as both a "still" and "moving art frame" as well, with content that is "always on" in low power and improves the look of your living space. Handles all incoming data from my console seamlessly. Handles all "technological handshakes" like a pro! Plenty of HDMI 2.1 connections! Very thin, sleek and sharp design! Light! Amazing product!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Beautiful picture, difficult settings menus, confusing remote actions.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviewList.review:
Picture is beautiful once set up. Nice inky blacks. Gets more than sufficiently bright except on full screen white. Common OLED issue.

Problems with setup. You basically are signing your life & privacy away to use this TV. Sign up is convoluted & difficult, significantly hampered by the remote constantly switching modes between pointer & digital pad mode.

Out of the box, once you get past all the activation menu's, default settings for filmmaker mode does not have those nice inky blacks, it is about equivolent to a high grade VA panel levels light bleed. Trying to find & use settings to correct this without affecting peak brightness was quite time consuming but I was able to finally accomplish that. Please note that part of my difficulty setting this up is due to my age related shakiness & having had a previous stroke which affected me physically but not intellectually.

Once I finally got this set up the picture was everything I was hoping it would be. Definately brighter than my LG 27" OLED monitor in its most accurate settings.

Once properly set up the picture can at times take on a 3D like appearance without any grayish haze that you get with even they best LCD type TV's or monitors including those with the mini LED type backlights. Granted it is quite subtle but still there on the mini LED type TV's.

Once you get past set up issues this is quite possibly the best TV in it's size class.

If it was just based on picture alone it would get 5 stars but set up issues & remote functionality & ease of use down grade this to 4 stars.

Note; that to experience the best viewing one should be in a darkened room as due to its inky blacks & amount of detail in the dark areas of the screen which is the way movies were meant to be watched anyway.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviewList.review:
Just after I bought it the price on the 77” B3 dropped to 1750$. I would choose b3 over the c3 for the 500-700 difference. But it arrived and looks great not worth sending back to swap once I got it.

Anti glare is pretty good. It’s a glossy tv not Matt finish which I like and the screen reduces glare quite a bit over my last tv. It has a pinkish violet color to the light reflection I think it cuts the white light reflected down by having it be a bit darker it still reflects some light but I can actually watch tv or movies with the lights on and not be annoyed. For serious watching like a movie I turn off the background lights in my room. But daytime viewing is excellent. oled is amazing I have top of the line Sony mini led and it is no competition. At the store I couldn’t tell the difference but at home where it’s not super bright lit room like a store I can see the difference

Add says they ship out in one day but it didn’t ship for 4-5 days but it did arrive on time the date it said it would. So i can’t fault them for that.

Seller had lowest price anywhere. I think I got a special deal by luck but I do want to give them credit for great pricing.

I would purchase from them again.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Doesn't get much better than this!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviewList.review: This TV is absolutely stunning. When it comes to a home TV, OLED panels come out on top in every way and it's not even close. With this TV, LG checks all the boxes too in terms of desirable premium features. 4K, HDR, 120hz, Dolby Vision & Atmos, VRR, ALLM, Nvidia G-Sync AND AMD Freesync Premium. Then the game optimizer mode that brings it all conveniently together in one menu. In my opinion, this is the best TV around right now for gaming. Even aside from gaming, watching any kind of content is a great experience as well. My previous TV was a now 4 year old 50 inch TCL Roku TV, which doesn't even come close to comparing in any way. This is my first time going for a high end more expensive TV like this and I'm very happy with my choice for sure. If you're looking to get a more premium display and you're a gamer as well then this is the one for you!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Cut the cord and WOW, just WOW
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
Play Video
 Pictures and Video are right out of the box shots and taken on a old Samsung Phone so obviously not 4K.

We just last month 'cut the cord' and decided replace our old Plamsa TV w/ our first Smart TV.
After much researching we decided to go w/ the 65" LG C3 OLED.
We watch TV in what is basically a Theater atmosphere so the brighter LG G3 was not needed and much more expensive.
That said, this TV is plenty good in bright room light.
There is also NO drop off as you move around the room like that on a LED.

Out of the box.... and just 41 pounds.... the picture on the C3 AMAZED Us!
Sharp, clear, seamless video w/ gorgeous color on a 4K HDR Fish Tank Video.

I am a photographer and so a fanatic on picture quality.
LG's Picture Wizard does a darn good initial setup!
Researching reviews/settings for the TV recommends turning off Energy Saver.
Also a few tweaks for Contrast, Brightness, Color Saturation, etc. and we were good for watching 4K HDR.

I didn't care greatly for the SDR as I like lifelike not 'punchy' Video.
After some research I found a site (RTINGS) that had recommended settings for watching the C3 in SDR.
THIS tweaking made a world of difference in the quality of the Video.
This was especially noticeable on the Video from our old SDR TiVo Video Recorder.
You can then tell the TV to apply these HDR and SDR settings across All Inputs.

I can't really speak to the Sound Quality as I run all my sound through an Onkyo AVR and Mission Speakers/Sub.

If you are coming from a 'Dumb' TV setup, where everything runs First to your AVR then uphill/out to the TV/Monitor, you will need to do some research on ARC/eARC HDMI.

This and all Smart TV,s run downhill.
Cable Box, Gaming, Blueray, etc go first to your LG TV through HDMI in Ports.
Then an ARC/eARC HDMI transmits signals from the TV to an ARC/eARC Port on your AVR Receiver.
It also, in my and in most cases, turns on and sets the AVR as I turn on the TV or Inputs through the TV.

The LG C series has a GREAT Menu for helping this and ALL setups.

As my old HDMI cables were 10 years old I did buy new 8K HDMI Cable 2.1 cables for ARC, XBOX, TiVo .

The Remote has a Cursor/Pointer Feature that comes on when you shake/pickup the remote.
THIS takes a bit of time to get used to, but is easily turned off.

ALL IN ALL We LOVE this TV and after only a week have just scratched the surface on the user interface.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review:
I use this for 3 different purposes: office work, gaming, and watching tv. Its amazing for all those things.

Office use:
I was worried about text clarity and general size issues but I quickly got used to this giant 42" montitor in place of my dual monitor setup. You can easily snap 4 windows to each corner and be super productive

Gaming:
The game optimizer feature is really nice. VRR works very well, and ofc it looks amazing. It feels super immersive for rpg/adventure games. Probably too big for fps games though.

TV:
Its a quality oled display, cant really go wrong with movies and video in general

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture quality, smooth action for sports and movies, good value for an OLED
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviewList.review: Got the LG OLED C3 to replace an aging LED TV. Huge difference in picture quality and smoothness of action images. Deep blacks, vivid colors. Brightness is good, too. We have had no problems with daytime viewing in a fairly bright room. I wanted to bypass LG’s opening screen and WebOS, which I was able to do with a little work and a SofaBaton U2 Universal Remote. Probably could have also done this with the LG Magic Remote and a little patience. All in all, great picture for a pretty reasonable price for an OLED TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
While this TV is spectacular, I had a small issue with the full-service concierge delivery. Yes, they brought the TV into my home, yes they unpacked and attached the stand to the TV, yes they set the TV in place, and yes they took away all the debris. But after they left, I found two screws and three plastic mystery parts on the counter. Since everything seemed to be working perfectly and since nothing was falling apart, I just tossed these "extra" parts (I'm trying to NOT continue to throw stuff in our "junk drawer".

Then last week I decided to replace our other aging TV with a second one of these great LG TVs. Concierge delivery was no longer an option so I unboxed and set up the TV myself (Youtube has several wonderful videos on this). It was simple and I immediately saw where the two missing screws should have been inserted in the TV stand. Also saw where the three missing plastic mystery pieces should have been attached.

I don't think that these unused screws and cord holder plastic (mystery) pieces are an issue but I am surprised that the delivery guys, who said they set up these TV all the time, would have failed to finish these set-up details.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Outatanding picture. Mindblowing after moving from QLCD.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review: Picture quality is outstanding. Brighter than my old early gen QLCD. There is a higher level LG G-3 supposed to be brighter, if that is your main concern, but no reason to spend 1k more....and G3 tech is new. I have enjoyed this tv like no other I have experienced before. My advice: do some research on Sony and Samsung but keep these important aspects in mind. This TV has better protection against burn in and is brighter.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great TV! terrible bloat and spyware.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviewList.review:
I like LG OLED TVs and this one is no exception to that. Its a great picture and installation experience. I dont like the trend of spyware built into these TVs so they can keep making money off of us even after we spent an arm and a leg on the hardware its self.
DO yourself a favor and disable these to the best you can. At least there are some options to do this that are on by default. Also check after every update cause they like to sneak in and reset these options.
Other than that my experience has been great. Considering all the major manufactures are building in these "smart" features, there's not much you can do about that part.
I use external stream boxes mainly because of this. They aren't really any better though.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Better picture quality than my old Plasma TV
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviewList.review:
Loving this new LG TV. Delivery was great - we left the garage door open and they placed it inside.
Easy to unpack (there are some helpful Ytube videos on this - would suggest you watch). Picture quality is perfect when you use the FILMMAKER MODE setting. Connecting to our home WiFI was super easy also.

PS - pickup a cheap ($20) bluetooth keyboard and mouse pair. Makes using the LG menu's MUCH easier than using their Wand remote (although you still need the Wand handy for some stuff).

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviewList.review: I debated for sometime over whether or not to spend $2500 on this TV. Well, it went on sale for $2149 and I couldn't pass it up. I'm absolutely thrilled with my decision. Going from a 120" screen projected by an Optoma HD28HDR to this is a night and day difference. The vibrancy this tv offers is truly wonderful! Who knew downsizing could be this exciting!! My recommendation, if you're in the market for the best quality TV and can't quite justify spending $5000 on the M3 model, this C3 is 100% the way to go. Best price to quality on the market as of 01/2024

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviewList.review: Me and my husband are senior citizens and have owned many Tvs. We never thought we would see a better picture than from a plasma Tv. Using the settings of the chart I have with this review are outstanding! If you do not get a incredible picture after these settings just return the Tv as you most likely received a Tv with a bad panel. We have the Tv in a dark room 10 x12 with a Vizio sound bar through the earc. The dolby Atmos and digital sound is outstanding. Watching Jack Reacher on prime which is streamed with Dolby Atmos and Dolby Vision is outstanding. Buy it and enjoy!

reviewList.reviewTitle: The brightest and best picture quality I have ever seen!!!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviewList.review:
LG really did an incredible job with this TV! Everything is fully functional and working properly. My only concern is that when I play games on my Nintendo Switch, it turns off without warning me that it's overheating. I'm currently working that out as best I can. Other than that, I really enjoy the picture quality with the MLA layer and 4K HDR content.
I also like that it's Dolby Vision and Atmos compatible for AMAZING picture and sound! The colors are bright and vibrant, the black details are perfectly pitch black instead of a washed out gray, and the sound is loud with my sound bar. It even makes DVDs, for example, look their best. I mainly use this TV for gaming on my PS5, Xbox Series X, and Nintendo Switch, and watching 4K movies via my PS5. I also enjoy live TV, streaming, and I found an Office option that pulls up documents for books I write. It doesn't, however, with the documents, connect to a printer, but that's to be expected, I have a laptop I use anyway.
With this TV, I also can use two set up HDMI devices at the same time with Multi View. In order to access Multi View for two devices, click the settings button once, scroll to Multi View, select Dual PC Monitor, and select the two inputs you want to use. No need for two screens and a matrix like I had before
The Art Gallery is also very neat to look at since it looks like a large picture frame on the wall when you select it. It doesn't let you upload your photos from your phone to LG's Art Gallery app, but if you have LG Thinq on your phone or a flash drive hooked up, it will let you see your photos.
In conclusion, I think it's the best TV ever! It can do so many things. I highly recommend it over any traditional TVs if you're in the market for something high quality

reviewList.reviewTitle: A Masterpiece Unveiled: LG G3 65" TV Review
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
Prepare to be captivated by the LG G3 65" TV, an extraordinary piece of technology that brings the magic of the big screen into the comfort of your living room. Boasting the cutting-edge LG OLED evo G-Series and powered by the a9 AI Processor Gen6, this TV delivers unrivaled picture quality and performance. With its impressive features like Brightness Booster Max, AI technology, and Dolby Vision, the LG G3 takes your viewing experience to new heights. Let's dive into the details and explore why this TV is a true masterpiece.

Stunning Picture Quality:
The LG OLED evo G-Series redefines visual excellence, and the LG G3 is no exception. Thanks to the a9 AI Processor Gen6, this TV produces breathtakingly vivid and lifelike images. The Brightness Booster Max feature enhances the picture quality by adjusting it for up to 70% brighter images, allowing you to enjoy rich colors, remarkable contrast, and astonishing clarity, even in well-lit environments. Every scene comes to life, immersing you in a visual feast that exceeds all expectations.

Intelligent Features:
The LG G3 65" TV is designed to adapt to your preferences seamlessly. The AI technology and deep learning capabilities analyze your viewing habits, enabling the TV to select the optimal picture and sound settings automatically. This means that every show, movie, or sporting event you watch is enhanced to provide an immersive and personalized viewing experience. Say goodbye to the hassle of manual adjustments and let the LG G3 handle it effortlessly.

Sleek One Wall Design:
The LG G3's one wall design is a testament to its elegance and versatility. With the included wall bracket, the TV sits flush against the wall, creating a seamless and clutter-free appearance. When you're not indulging in your favorite entertainment, the LG G3 effortlessly blends into your surroundings, allowing you to display artwork, family photos, or any other content of your choice. The TV becomes an integral part of your home décor, enhancing the aesthetics of your living space.

Intuitive WebOS 23 & LG Channels:
LG continues to push the boundaries of smart TV technology with the WebOS 23 platform. This next-generation AI technology simplifies your streaming experience, making it effortless to access a wide range of content. Quick Cards provide a user-friendly interface, grouping your favorite apps into categories for easy navigation. The Magic Remote makes finding what you're looking for a breeze. Moreover, LG Channels grants you instant access to over 300 free channels, ensuring that there's always something to suit your mood.

Immersive Home Theater Experience:
Prepare to be amazed by the LG G3's home theater capabilities. With Dolby Vision, you'll witness extraordinary colors, impressive contrast, and striking brightness that elevate every frame. Dolby Atmos takes the audio experience to new heights by delivering wrap-around sound, immersing you in a three-dimensional auditory adventure. And with LG's Filmmaker Mode, you can enjoy films exactly as the director intended, with accurate colors and motion settings that preserve the cinematic experience.

Peace of Mind with 5-Year Panel Warranty:
LG stands behind the quality of their OLED evo TVs, and the LG G3 comes with a 5-year panel warranty. This industry-leading warranty ensures that you can enjoy your TV with confidence, knowing that LG has perfected their technology over a decade. You can immerse yourself in endless hours of entertainment, knowing that your investment is protected.

Conclusion:
The LG G3 65" TV is a work of art that will transform your home entertainment experience. Its LG OLED evo G-Series, powered by the a9 AI Processor Gen6, delivers mesmerizing picture quality with enhanced brightness and exceptional color accuracy. The TV seamlessly integrates into your living space with its one wall design, and the intelligent features, such as AI technology and LG Channels, make content discovery effortless. With Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos, the LG G3 brings the magic of the big screen right to your couch, enveloping you in a truly immersive home theater experience. Backed by a 5-year panel warranty, this TV guarantees long-lasting enjoyment. The LG G3 65" TV is a testament to LG's commitment to innovation, craftsmanship, and creating a viewing experience that will leave you spellbound.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Beautiful picture quality, best TV I have ever had.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviewList.review: The picture on this tv is absolutely amazing, so clear, bright, and the color array is spectacular. Watching movies on this is better than being at the movie theater. It was easy to mount on my wall, just make sure you have two to three guys to help because the 77" weighs over a 100 lbs and the size of it makes it challenging when putting it on the wall mount. It looks great on the wall. I highly recommend this TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review: TV was received yesterday and evidently it turned on (unfortunately wasn't home to witness it but my spouse did). Today, it doesn't turn on. We get a red light, but all the power buttons do is turn the light off for a second then turns back on. No screen. Amazon refused to replace and instead offered a 10% partial refund to handle the warranty repair through LG. If LG can't repair it or replace it, I still have the option for a full refund before January. Huge bummer as the TV looks incredible.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviewList.review:
The LG G3 OLED is a superb viewing experience, particularly for those fond of gaming. I am upgrading from a 2020 Sony X950H which is a solid 4K LED tv that punches well above its class, but even without a resolution upgrade, the G3 absolutely stomps on it. Blacks on this TV are pure and inky, and highlight detail just pops like nothing else. Then, when you plug in your PS5 or XSX, you are treated to low input lag and punchy colors. VRR works particularly well and adds new life to games like Flight Simulator. Input delay feels near instantaneous for FPS games, and Dolby Vision hits you in the face like a sledgehammer. There are only 3 very minor complaints I have about this TV:
1. If you’re using toslink to your AV receiver, uncompressed 5.1 signals are sent as PCM instead of bitstream, so you lose multichannel support (at least out of the box, and I haven’t been able to figure out how to change this)
2. 1440p is not supported by default as an EDID resolution, so you won’t be able to get the most out of an mClassic if you don’t spend more on an EDID emulator.
3. This tv does not ship with a stand, and the LG one suffers from instability and a significant lean-back. You have to spend more on a 3rd party one. I have a Sanus stand that works well

Other than those minor gripes, the TV is extremely impressive, and I am proud to show it off to family and friends!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviewList.review: The most beautiful picture quality of any tv I've ever owned. Bright and clear picture, with wonderful color. Apps work very well. Sound, not sure of the tv speakers because mine is playing through a Sonus system, and that works very well. This tv only has a wall mounting bracket included so if you need a stand be sure to order that item separately. LG makes a stand for it but that stand has a peculiar lean that I didn't care for so I mounted it on a Sanus tv stand and its perfectly stable and vertical and I couldn't be happier. Wonderful tv, I would highly recommend it.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Just like being in a movie theater
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviewList.review: I purchased this 55" LG G3 TV to replace a 13-year-old lCD TV. A smaller size would have worked better but 55" is the smallest size made in this model. I bought this TV because of the professional review ratings it received online and I am quite pleased. This is my first smart TV so it took a day or so to sleuth-out it's capabilities. I use a Roku Ultra and a Bluray DVD player connected via high-speed HDMI cable and also an Over-The-Air (OTA) 75-Ohm antenna (which was easy to scan for available channels). The LG Home Hub App (pre-installed) makes it easy to choose which input source I want to view from. I have sampled some really high-definition content as well as some of the low-def OTA broadcasts and I am quite pleased at how good this TV makes all sources look. The reviewers all said that the "Cinema" picture mode was most accurate, but my wife and I both like the "Standard" picture mode best. I have enabled AI Sound Pro and enabled the Bass Boost feature and I find the sound quality quite good and clear at low sound levels. I haven't yet created a DHCP reservation for it in my network router to avoid it disconnecting from my network, but I plan to do that soon (I use hard-wired Ethernet RJ-45 6E cable). The re-run of BattleBots I'm watching right now looks so real it is just like being there in person.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviewList.review:
The G3 is a gorgeous TV!

I bought it to replace a 42" plasma tv that died. I was worried that it might not be as bright in my well lit room. In reality it is notably brighter and fine to view in a fairly bright room.

My one complaint is with WebOS. I find it very unintuitive to use. I'm still struggling to figure out all the option settings. But I have confidence I will eventually figure it out.

I currently have it on a stand. Eventually I would like to wall mount it. I'm still looking for details on how others have hidden all the wires.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Wow! Great Purchase and Excellent Customer Service
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: Spent a good amount of time reviewing this product before purchasing it. Lots of YouTube time. This TV is an upgrade from my four year old LG 65in OLED and it is as advertised in every way. I am simply amazed how good this TV is and with its look on my wall. I had it professionally installed but only because I moved my entire entertainment system to an opposite wall and changed from a 7.1 channel setup to 9.2 with all the wiring behind the walls and running through the attic. Otherwise I could have easily installed it on the wall with the help from a buddy. One issue of note...it DID NOT come with the magic remote! It came with the basic LG remote. I remember reading a review from another customer who had the same issue. Without this remote, there are some important functions that cannot be accessed on the TV (voice, pointer, magic touch to activate screensaver, etc.) Here's why this product still gets FIVE STARS, I contacted Amazon support who credited me the cost of the magic remote and referred me to LG support who promptly sent me the remote. Unbelievable customer service! Overall a great purchase and experience for me. Hope this review was helpful...Happy holidays.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviewList.review: My friend and I unpacked and set this up yesterday. As soon as we got the aftermarket (from Amazon) tabletop mount brackets installed, we slid it on top of my bedroom Armoire and we powered it up, my friend, and I, were both STUNNED by the picture quality that come on that screen. I'm installing my LG S95QR-9.1.5 810 watts home theater surround sound system today. So far, I simply cannot be more impressed, this TV went right into its set up mode, connected it to my WIFI and it began updating and also asked me to connect to a plethora of different apps that I would like. This replaced my 15-year-old Sharp 46-inch LCD flat screen TV. I highly recommend this TV, and as many others have stated, prepare to be blown away! Five full stars. Just amazing!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviewList.review: Most incredible picture I've seen on a TV.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Don’t be scared to order through Amazon.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviewList.review:
I am amazed. We ordered a lg c2 6 months ago . No problem, this was local, no Amazon. Ordered a lg c3 locally, after 3 weeks, they told me it was discontinued. Never mind after two weeks they told me it was shipped. After wasting 3 weeks, I took the chance to order the lg g3 through Amazon. Four days later it was shipped UPS. I was a UPS driver before for years. No problem. I backed the Kubota to the fence. No damage. I was thrilled. No run around. I will never question ordering a a big item again.
I ordered a recliner through Amazon also a year ago. Best experience. The locals could care less about service.
The lg g3 is fantastic. We were blown away by the sharpness and color. The best on the market in 2023.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewList.review: Great picture. The 83” G3 doesn’t have the MLA tech that the 77” has, but my room is dark enough I don’t think that matters. Would maybe reconsider and stick to 77” in a brighter room but this looks amazing otherwise.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviewList.review: It mounts quite flush to the wall. The display is bright and vivid. Love it

reviewList.reviewTitle: Fast reliable service. Tv is magnificent.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviewList.review: Tv is beautiful. Delivered on time. Carefully packaged. Excellent.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviewList.review: Worth every dime!!!!!¡

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
Loving this tv. I simply have no complaints. Flush Wall mount was included. The anchors sucked… I screwed in a 20” wide piece of 1/2” plywood to anchor into. Unfortunately this made my tv float off the wall 1/2”. Aw well… worth it to be secure and centered.

The clarity of this tv is incredible. Such rich colors and DEEP blacks. I never want to turn it off 😆

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviewList.review:
I decided to go with the LG OLED77G3PUA over the OLED77C3PUA largely because of the flush mount. Nearly all of the features are the same and if you don't WANT the feel of the "Gallery Mount" on a wall, the C3 is likely more than good enough.

Frankly, I am not going to do a review beyond, "It is stunning" and WOW. One of the first shows I watched was "Heart of Stone" (Netflix) after sunset and the HDR is amazing. A few scenes went from bright to BLACK and it gave me the chills.

The brightness of the screen when hit with DIRECT sunlight in the AM is watchable. (see the photos)

During the day when some light leakage is seen from the blinds, I can see reflections but they don't bother ME. The anti-glare works well enough and black is still black.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviewList.review: Amazing quality - extremely bright, detailed, with fantastic upscaling and motion. Literally nothing bad to say about this product. Perfection.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Best tv yet. Great picture and 77” screen size are huge upgrades for my theater room setup.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviewList.review: Best tv yet. Great picture and 77” screen size are huge upgrades for my theater room setup.

reviewList.reviewTitle: The brightest and best picture quality I have ever seen!!!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviewList.review:
LG really did an incredible job with this TV! Everything is fully functional and working properly. My only concern is that when I play games on my Nintendo Switch, it turns off without warning me that it's overheating. I'm currently working that out as best I can. Other than that, I really enjoy the picture quality with the MLA layer and 4K HDR content.
I also like that it's Dolby Vision and Atmos compatible for AMAZING picture and sound! The colors are bright and vibrant, the black details are perfectly pitch black instead of a washed out gray, and the sound is loud with my sound bar. It even makes DVDs, for example, look their best. I mainly use this TV for gaming on my PS5, Xbox Series X, and Nintendo Switch, and watching 4K movies via my PS5. I also enjoy live TV, streaming, and I found an Office option that pulls up documents for books I write. It doesn't, however, with the documents, connect to a printer, but that's to be expected, I have a laptop I use anyway.
With this TV, I also can use two set up HDMI devices at the same time with Multi View. In order to access Multi View for two devices, click the settings button once, scroll to Multi View, select Dual PC Monitor, and select the two inputs you want to use. No need for two screens and a matrix like I had before
The Art Gallery is also very neat to look at since it looks like a large picture frame on the wall when you select it. It doesn't let you upload your photos from your phone to LG's Art Gallery app, but if you have LG Thinq on your phone or a flash drive hooked up, it will let you see your photos.
In conclusion, I think it's the best TV ever! It can do so many things. I highly recommend it over any traditional TVs if you're in the market for something high quality

reviewList.reviewTitle: A Masterpiece Unveiled: LG G3 65" TV Review
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
Prepare to be captivated by the LG G3 65" TV, an extraordinary piece of technology that brings the magic of the big screen into the comfort of your living room. Boasting the cutting-edge LG OLED evo G-Series and powered by the a9 AI Processor Gen6, this TV delivers unrivaled picture quality and performance. With its impressive features like Brightness Booster Max, AI technology, and Dolby Vision, the LG G3 takes your viewing experience to new heights. Let's dive into the details and explore why this TV is a true masterpiece.

Stunning Picture Quality:
The LG OLED evo G-Series redefines visual excellence, and the LG G3 is no exception. Thanks to the a9 AI Processor Gen6, this TV produces breathtakingly vivid and lifelike images. The Brightness Booster Max feature enhances the picture quality by adjusting it for up to 70% brighter images, allowing you to enjoy rich colors, remarkable contrast, and astonishing clarity, even in well-lit environments. Every scene comes to life, immersing you in a visual feast that exceeds all expectations.

Intelligent Features:
The LG G3 65" TV is designed to adapt to your preferences seamlessly. The AI technology and deep learning capabilities analyze your viewing habits, enabling the TV to select the optimal picture and sound settings automatically. This means that every show, movie, or sporting event you watch is enhanced to provide an immersive and personalized viewing experience. Say goodbye to the hassle of manual adjustments and let the LG G3 handle it effortlessly.

Sleek One Wall Design:
The LG G3's one wall design is a testament to its elegance and versatility. With the included wall bracket, the TV sits flush against the wall, creating a seamless and clutter-free appearance. When you're not indulging in your favorite entertainment, the LG G3 effortlessly blends into your surroundings, allowing you to display artwork, family photos, or any other content of your choice. The TV becomes an integral part of your home décor, enhancing the aesthetics of your living space.

Intuitive WebOS 23 & LG Channels:
LG continues to push the boundaries of smart TV technology with the WebOS 23 platform. This next-generation AI technology simplifies your streaming experience, making it effortless to access a wide range of content. Quick Cards provide a user-friendly interface, grouping your favorite apps into categories for easy navigation. The Magic Remote makes finding what you're looking for a breeze. Moreover, LG Channels grants you instant access to over 300 free channels, ensuring that there's always something to suit your mood.

Immersive Home Theater Experience:
Prepare to be amazed by the LG G3's home theater capabilities. With Dolby Vision, you'll witness extraordinary colors, impressive contrast, and striking brightness that elevate every frame. Dolby Atmos takes the audio experience to new heights by delivering wrap-around sound, immersing you in a three-dimensional auditory adventure. And with LG's Filmmaker Mode, you can enjoy films exactly as the director intended, with accurate colors and motion settings that preserve the cinematic experience.

Peace of Mind with 5-Year Panel Warranty:
LG stands behind the quality of their OLED evo TVs, and the LG G3 comes with a 5-year panel warranty. This industry-leading warranty ensures that you can enjoy your TV with confidence, knowing that LG has perfected their technology over a decade. You can immerse yourself in endless hours of entertainment, knowing that your investment is protected.

Conclusion:
The LG G3 65" TV is a work of art that will transform your home entertainment experience. Its LG OLED evo G-Series, powered by the a9 AI Processor Gen6, delivers mesmerizing picture quality with enhanced brightness and exceptional color accuracy. The TV seamlessly integrates into your living space with its one wall design, and the intelligent features, such as AI technology and LG Channels, make content discovery effortless. With Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos, the LG G3 brings the magic of the big screen right to your couch, enveloping you in a truly immersive home theater experience. Backed by a 5-year panel warranty, this TV guarantees long-lasting enjoyment. The LG G3 65" TV is a testament to LG's commitment to innovation, craftsmanship, and creating a viewing experience that will leave you spellbound.
