reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviewList.review:
Prior to this, I had a basic 65" LG 4K Smart TV from 2018 that I'd originally thought was the greatest thing I'd ever seen. And it was beautiful and clear, but of course the blacks were never actually black because the light was always on and bleeding through. Last year, the wifi entirely failed and even the ethernet connection started acting funky this year. Some of the apps started getting laggy and didn't want to work at all on the older version/style of webOS on this TV (I couldn't even watch HBOMax on it, I always had to switch to my Xbox's app). Thus, I started thinking of upgrading and a big bonus from work gave me the ability to do so without worrying much about cost.

I'm SO glad I got this TV.

The apps all work smoothly and there's no hiccups with wired or wireless internet. There are SO MANY customization options for picture and sound and you can set them separately for different inputs or apply it across all of them if you find a set up you like. I mean, you can change between modes, brightness settings, AI settings, clarity settings, white and black balances, and even into things like sharpness and noise reduction. Too many options for me to even remember. My main changes have been turning Energy Saving off, Auto Dynamic Contrast to High and LED Local Dimming to High.

My favorite things are (of course) the picture and the sound. The picture is GORGEOUS and the deep blacks are incredibly impressive. There've been times I've caught myself staring at the edges of the screen where a shadow or the black bar on the movie would seamlessly blend into the black bezel to the point where I genuinely couldn't see where the screen ended and the bezel began. It was the first thing I started texting my friend about after I set up the TV! And when the screen is black, it's BLACK. Not dark grey. Not bleeding in around the edges. Solid black.

Now, because of how dimming zones work, there are cases where you might have something bright next to/inside something black, and you will see a bit of a halo around it. The size of this halo will depend upon your TV settings and how large/small the item is. I've attached some photos with examples. On the first, you can see a large halo around the big white box on the screen (which was visible in real life, but not even as drastic as it appeared on camera), but nothing around the magic mouse's cursor at the top of the screen, and the surrounding black screen that takes up most of the screen is still black. In the second, you can see where the darkness at the top of the screen all goes to solid black and the black bar totally disappears, while on the bottom you can still see it due to that edge of the picture being brighter.

Another picture-related thing that has really impressed me is how the screen captures reflective/shiny things like bits of metal or sequins or glass. I was watching a TV show where a character was constantly wearing clothes with chrome studs or holographic sequins, and the way they glittered and caught light was so REAL. In lower quality images, those kind of reflections will get crushed into just looking like a white spot, but no detail was lost in these reflections on this TV.

And for those worried about angles, my couch is off to the side instead of directly in front of the TV and I've noticed no difference in the picture. Even right next to the side of the TV and staring straight across it, the image and colors never fade or look any different.

Then for the sound part I mentioned, it also has a lot of customization options just like the picture and you get to choose between different sound modes and different outputs. Mine's currently on the AI Sound Pro mode and I have it set to output to Optical Out Device + TV Speaker. I had used my LG soundbar with my previous TV and carried it over to this one, and I'd never seen the option to use both before. I love it! It can sound a little strange if you don't balance the volumes correctly, but I've found keeping the soundbar volume 2 clicks higher than the TV speakers works really well. I find having the extra speakers give a lot of the sound effects a more nuanced sound. The deeper sounds really come through my soundbar/subwoofer, while the lighter ones come through the TV. There's this added feeling of sounds moving around without having a better sound set up, thanks to the extra set of speakers beyond my soundbar. Without the soundbar, the built in speakers are great for a TV. They're just not as "deep."

If I had to nitpick and complain about something, it would probably only be the scroll wheel/select button the Magic Remote. It could be that I'm just not used to it yet (my previous LG TV did not come with a Magic Remote) or that my nails having grown out a bit at the moment are getting in the way, but it's not always the most comfortable to click. I often end up trying to press it and I'll press the ring around it at the same time. That or I'm trying to press it to select something and the wheel scrolls and switches to cursor mode instead. I would've preferred the scrolling and selecting being two separate buttons, but honestly it's not a deal breaker and it doesn't behave weirdly often enough that I want to replace it with something else. It's actually a really cool innovation to be able to scroll or use it like a mouse on your TV!

All in all, I really love the TV and I'm incredibly impressed (if you couldn't already tell from the lengthy review). If you want to upgrade and you want to upgrade like I did, then I highly recommend it!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great TV! You can’t go wrong with LG
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review: This TV is really great. It has great clarity. The remote and menus are very is easy to use and it has all the features you could ever want casting from an iPad or iPhone, laptop is very easy and the results are great if I wanted to be super critical, and maybe be a little bit unfair, this is extraordinarily heavy. I think it’s like 130 pounds. I’m fearful to use anything other than the LG special mounts to put this on the wall. I am currently constructing a small build out for a in wall fireplace and a beef up area to put these mounts so I can have it flushed to the wall. There may be people out there better at this than me, but I’m just a little fearful hanging such an expensive TV on the wall. Just my two cents please take this into consideration when purchasing.

reviewList.reviewTitle: This unit has the features I was looking for
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviewList.review: Even though this is a slightly older model and the new LG NanoCell/MiniCell TVs haven't yet hit the market, this one has the features that interest me. I won't get into it, but if you're familiar with the key specs then you know what I mean. This set has a very nice picture and so much so that I purchased two. The second purchase was not because I wanted two, but because I came into the TV room one morning and the lower, right portion of the screen was cracked and half the picture was gone. How? Don't really know, but the general consensus is that my two dogs weighing in at about a hundred pounds each were 'horse-ing' around and made contact with the screen. So be it. The set is now installed about a foot and a half higher on the console cabinet. Hope that helps.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviewList.review: I have never heard the term “VESA,” but apparently the VESA for this TV is ridiculously abnormal. It seems that the only way to really mount this tv is to pony up and buy the special (and expensive) LG wall mount. No normal mount works for this TV, so avoid it unless you do not ever plan to mount it.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Very happy super bright with nice detail and true blacks love the remote
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviewList.review: So far amazed at this tv. Waiting on new head unit and height speakers to complete my upgrade to experience full atmos! I do want to share couple of issue’s I experienced though for the next person. When going from an old none 1080p display upgrade your hdmi’s to 8k@60hz 4k@120hz with 48 Gbps data transfer trust me it makes all the difference also neither my xbox series x or ps5 would let me turn on or use allm or vrr until i did a hard reset on either console and you need to disable the hdmi cec setting on tv and both consoles before doing a reset notice you wont loose your games but you will have to download and update apps and resign in to everything afterwards this finally did get both my xbox series x and ps5 to finally recognize that my new display now supported everything fyi if your like me and carried over your old psvr from ps4 gen to your ps5 your hdmi setup will have to be recongfiged as well it is 1080p not 4k not happy about that but it is what it is just plug it back in when you want it I quess. Once I did all that everything works as it should full specs now as intended 4k@120 hdr dolby vision hdr10 allm vrr hgid it’s nice now can’t wait to finish my audio side now with full dolby atmos and dtsx hope my reveiw helps you next gen upgraders cause I couldn’t find any answers on ytube that helped me it took 2 days of aggravation to get it sorted out. Now go play on! And order an automatic hdmi switch your gonna need it for the 2.1 hdmi’s to run all your new tech Fyi i ordered the llano hdmi 2.1 four in one out 8k auto switcher and 2 rca to hdmi converters to convert and old ps2 and wii system to hdmi just to maintain usability since hdmi hookups is all the inputs the new lg qned85 has good luck

reviewList.reviewTitle: I'd give it 5 stars but ONE GLARING YOUTUBE BUG!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviewList.review:
Besides my one huge problem, I absolutely love this tv. Love love love. Aside from this one issue I find it to be perfection.

My YouTube purchased movie content will not play Above 480p! Utter ridiculousness!!!

I've tried everything from contacting LG support to doing my own Google search. The Google search led me to many Reddit topics that claim the 2022 model has this YouTube bug in the firmware that no one seems to know how to fix.

However, there are several workarounds but none of them include fixing the tv YouTube application itself. To get my desired maximum resolutions especially for my 4K content, I can go through my PS5. I expect it works with my Xbox as well although I have not tested it. I have heard other methods work like Smart View but I have not tested that either. So again, there are definite workarounds that aren't too much of a pain but it's still a huge disappointment that this issue has not been fixed yet.

reviewList.review: I haven't owned a TV set for nearly a decade, since I watch most of my programs via computer. Setup was painless, and I was amazed to discover that under certain settings, it manages to serve as a decent enough computer display that I can just plug the media center directly into it rather than chain it along as a second screen. Well done.

reviewList.reviewTitle: I'd give it 5 stars but ONE GLARING YOUTUBE BUG!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviewList.review:
Besides my one huge problem, I absolutely love this tv. Love love love. Aside from this one issue I find it to be perfection.

My YouTube purchased movie content will not play Above 480p! Utter ridiculousness!!!

I've tried everything from contacting LG support to doing my own Google search. The Google search led me to many Reddit topics that claim the 2022 model has this YouTube bug in the firmware that no one seems to know how to fix.

However, there are several workarounds but none of them include fixing the tv YouTube application itself. To get my desired maximum resolutions especially for my 4K content, I can go through my PS5. I expect it works with my Xbox as well although I have not tested it. I have heard other methods work like Smart View but I have not tested that either. So again, there are definite workarounds that aren't too much of a pain but it's still a huge disappointment that this issue has not been fixed yet.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Excellent picture quality. However, wireless connectivity is unstable and remote is not intuitive.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
The picture quality is very good, and we're very happy with this.

We have many wireless-enabled devices in our household: laptops, tablets, phones, appliances, printers, roku devices, security cameras, and more. The TV seems unable to maintain its wireless network connectivity. On evenings where we watch a show, we have had to always re-connect our wireless network. Once we do so, the TV works just fine. No other device exhibits this behavior, including the roku device located right next to the TV. The TV has been updated to run the latest firmware, which has not helped the problem.

We have mixed views on the remote. On the one hand, the Wii-like pointer makes entering passwords a little faster, though you do have to get used to the sensitivity. It's impressive how it "just works", controlling the TV, sound bar, and Roku devices with no setup required. On the other hand, the layout of the buttons is not intuitive, and does not "flow well" with the TV menu. Compared to other remotes, the buttons are hard to find by feel in a dark room for movie nights where the lights might be low.

If the wireless problem mentioned above could be fixed, I would rate the TV at least one (if not two) stars higher.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Very nice technology upgrade. A beautiful picture.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2022
reviewList.review: I did a lot of research into flatscreen technology before making this purchase. I initially wanted to buy an OLED set. The LG OLED sets have a beautiful picture. Concerns about burn in and burn out led me in the QLED/QNED direction. My new LG QNED/Mini LED set has a beautiful picture. The picture is easily viewable from all seating angles in my living room. The picture is bright and clear. Blacks may not be as perfectly black as an OLED set but they are so black that I don't know if the difference would be noticeable unless the sets were side by side. The audio quality is an unexpected plus. I haven't had time to fish a fiber optic cable through the wall, so I have been using the built-in speakers. Not as much bass as I like but the audio quality is very good.

reviewList.reviewTitle: is this 75QNED "85" UQA WORTH THE EXTRA $500 OVER THE 75QNED "80" -- You bet!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviewList.review:
I researched for months before deciding on a TV and not once did I do this in a store. Of all brands, It came down to this: Did I want a big "name" brand like Sony, Samsung or did I want more technology in the set itself to weatherproof myself against outdated technology in 2-4 yrs. I went with the later. Of all those choices of manufacturers, LG stands out as the most reliable choice with the least problems with awesome upgrades in features vs Sony, Samsung and for a better price.
The QNED line was our # 1 choice for screen techology and my best guess is QNED (similar to Samsung) will be the screen technology most popular going forward. Absolutely awesome picture in 4K Quantum Dot NanoCell Display from LG. Just read about QNED and you'll see why. OLED is too expe nsive and has reports of screen burn in, and a lower lifespan.
So in LG QNED, the choices were between this model 75QNED85UQA vs 75QNED80UQA and the 75QNED90UQA. 80 vs 85 vs 90? 80 is about $500 cheaper than 85 and 85 is less than the 90.
All have the same Wi-Fi standard (802.11ac) and the same connectivity -- HDMI-CDC simplelink (lets you use one remote to control all connected devices), and most important to us, the updated/latest HDMI 2.1 (4K @ 120Hz) on ports 3, 4 (4 total HDMI ports), plus HDCP 2.2 on all, plus HDMI ARC (is port 3), and an ethernet port, digital Audo Out (optical), and RF for Antenna/cable, and others. It does NOT have the older RCA composite or component connections for older devices but we purchased separately an RCA to HDMI converter for $11 for an older Wii.
We eliminated the 90 up front because it was 2021 modle with a older generation processor than either the 80 and 85, and it also had older WebOS Operating System, despite having full array diming pro backlight dimming technology and other features. Plus it was more expensive.

So between the 80 and 85, I chose the 85 because it has these features that the 80 doesn't.
Audio: The 85 has Dolby Atmos The 80 doesn't
Backlight type: Mini-LED vs Edge ****
Backlight Dimming Technology: Precision in the 85 vs local in the 80
100% Color Volume in the 85 not in the 80
Object Brightness Booster in the 85 not in the 85
******HDR: The 85 has Dolby Vision HDR (Cinema HDR Dolby Vision, HDR 10, HLG and Dynamic Tone Maping Pro. The 80 does NOT have Dolby Vision HDR or the pro version of tone maping *

The HDR was a key in choosing between the 80 and 85 but also the sound. It was worth the extra $$ to us as we plan to keep our TV for many years. Overall, the LG just outwitted, outsmarted and outplayed Sony and Samsung. Now set up, our 75QNED85UQA is unbelievably beautiful.

OF course, we upgraded to HIGH END 8K HDMI cables to connect to our 4K Roku because those will transmit 4K @ 120Hz in HDMI ports 3, 4. Couldn't find a 4K cable that would do that but the 8K will. Also don't forget to upgrade your internet signal whomever it comes from -- and ifi you subscribe to Hulu, Netflix, etc . . . you'll need to upgrade your plans to the 4K plans or you're wasting your money on a 4K TV.
We've found that Netflix, so far, carries the most 4K movies and shows -- pages and pages full of them. And you can even see the fleas in the Bonobos beard in the National Geographic specials . . Absolutely awesome.
Last, setup was a breeze. The TV is heavy -- the extra setup (paid for) was worth it. The TV is heavy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviewList.review:
Prior to this, I had a basic 65" LG 4K Smart TV from 2018 that I'd originally thought was the greatest thing I'd ever seen. And it was beautiful and clear, but of course the blacks were never actually black because the light was always on and bleeding through. Last year, the wifi entirely failed and even the ethernet connection started acting funky this year. Some of the apps started getting laggy and didn't want to work at all on the older version/style of webOS on this TV (I couldn't even watch HBOMax on it, I always had to switch to my Xbox's app). Thus, I started thinking of upgrading and a big bonus from work gave me the ability to do so without worrying much about cost.

I'm SO glad I got this TV.

The apps all work smoothly and there's no hiccups with wired or wireless internet. There are SO MANY customization options for picture and sound and you can set them separately for different inputs or apply it across all of them if you find a set up you like. I mean, you can change between modes, brightness settings, AI settings, clarity settings, white and black balances, and even into things like sharpness and noise reduction. Too many options for me to even remember. My main changes have been turning Energy Saving off, Auto Dynamic Contrast to High and LED Local Dimming to High.

My favorite things are (of course) the picture and the sound. The picture is GORGEOUS and the deep blacks are incredibly impressive. There've been times I've caught myself staring at the edges of the screen where a shadow or the black bar on the movie would seamlessly blend into the black bezel to the point where I genuinely couldn't see where the screen ended and the bezel began. It was the first thing I started texting my friend about after I set up the TV! And when the screen is black, it's BLACK. Not dark grey. Not bleeding in around the edges. Solid black.

Now, because of how dimming zones work, there are cases where you might have something bright next to/inside something black, and you will see a bit of a halo around it. The size of this halo will depend upon your TV settings and how large/small the item is. I've attached some photos with examples. On the first, you can see a large halo around the big white box on the screen (which was visible in real life, but not even as drastic as it appeared on camera), but nothing around the magic mouse's cursor at the top of the screen, and the surrounding black screen that takes up most of the screen is still black. In the second, you can see where the darkness at the top of the screen all goes to solid black and the black bar totally disappears, while on the bottom you can still see it due to that edge of the picture being brighter.

Another picture-related thing that has really impressed me is how the screen captures reflective/shiny things like bits of metal or sequins or glass. I was watching a TV show where a character was constantly wearing clothes with chrome studs or holographic sequins, and the way they glittered and caught light was so REAL. In lower quality images, those kind of reflections will get crushed into just looking like a white spot, but no detail was lost in these reflections on this TV.

And for those worried about angles, my couch is off to the side instead of directly in front of the TV and I've noticed no difference in the picture. Even right next to the side of the TV and staring straight across it, the image and colors never fade or look any different.

Then for the sound part I mentioned, it also has a lot of customization options just like the picture and you get to choose between different sound modes and different outputs. Mine's currently on the AI Sound Pro mode and I have it set to output to Optical Out Device + TV Speaker. I had used my LG soundbar with my previous TV and carried it over to this one, and I'd never seen the option to use both before. I love it! It can sound a little strange if you don't balance the volumes correctly, but I've found keeping the soundbar volume 2 clicks higher than the TV speakers works really well. I find having the extra speakers give a lot of the sound effects a more nuanced sound. The deeper sounds really come through my soundbar/subwoofer, while the lighter ones come through the TV. There's this added feeling of sounds moving around without having a better sound set up, thanks to the extra set of speakers beyond my soundbar. Without the soundbar, the built in speakers are great for a TV. They're just not as "deep."

If I had to nitpick and complain about something, it would probably only be the scroll wheel/select button the Magic Remote. It could be that I'm just not used to it yet (my previous LG TV did not come with a Magic Remote) or that my nails having grown out a bit at the moment are getting in the way, but it's not always the most comfortable to click. I often end up trying to press it and I'll press the ring around it at the same time. That or I'm trying to press it to select something and the wheel scrolls and switches to cursor mode instead. I would've preferred the scrolling and selecting being two separate buttons, but honestly it's not a deal breaker and it doesn't behave weirdly often enough that I want to replace it with something else. It's actually a really cool innovation to be able to scroll or use it like a mouse on your TV!

All in all, I really love the TV and I'm incredibly impressed (if you couldn't already tell from the lengthy review). If you want to upgrade and you want to upgrade like I did, then I highly recommend it!

Besides my one huge problem, I absolutely love this tv. Love love love. Aside from this one issue I find it to be perfection.

My YouTube purchased movie content will not play Above 480p! Utter ridiculousness!!!

I've tried everything from contacting LG support to doing my own Google search. The Google search led me to many Reddit topics that claim the 2022 model has this YouTube bug in the firmware that no one seems to know how to fix.

I expect it works with my Xbox as well although I have not tested it. I have heard other methods work like Smart View but I have not tested that either. So again, there are definite workarounds that aren't too much of a pain but it's still a huge disappointment that this issue has not been fixed yet.

reviewList.reviewTitle: The Non-OLED That Comes Close Without The OLED Issues
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviewList.review:
I wanted a very large HDTV. Check. I didn't want to go OLED as I had several plasmas and remember ghost images that were hard to go away due to "slight" burn-in. Check. I had read enough about the new very small nano LCD apertures to believe until individually addressable micro led direct view sets become affordable, LG QNED, and Samsung's similar Quantum Dot panels are the way to go. Check. I wanted brightness without crushing dark black Check. I wanted local dimming with the newer mini-led backlight technology. Check.

So, I took a chance and bought this set sight unseen. I didn't make a mistake I'm happy to say. This set can work in a well lit or dark room no problem. It can make levels of black look black, and with detail so no crushing. It has almost non-existent bloom across the entire screen when displaying white letters on black background for instance. It has a modern set of specs like compatible with HDR-10/Dolby Vision. There are a few things I'm thinking are not great, but certainly not deal-breaking stuff. Things like the remote is impossible to use in a dark space (and in my case without reading glasses). The sound isn't cutting edge stuff like the Sony sets that radiate a bigger and more wide-range soundstage using the entire front of the screen...although sound is adequate for now while I'm waiting to see if I can get the new Nakamichi Dragon surround set. Overall, I'm quite pleased with this TV and I'm writing this only a few weeks after paying about $500 more than the currently offered price. The TV is good enough this doesn't even cause me a case of sour grapes, though if I could I'd return it and order it again which I can't cause I threw away the box and packing materials. But make no mistake, I'd definitely buy it again. I have had several LG HDTV's beginning with their somewhat unusual (the only one ever on the market to my knowledge) rear projected 9" CRT tube first ever HDTV then marketed under the Zenith name (a premium name they owned then). It had a great picture but developed problems with showing 720P (progressive inputs) and after repairing it twice they actually offered, and did, buy it back at over $4.5K. Now that's a stand-up company that cares about what they make and the consumer that shells out hard earned dough for their products. I recommend LG HDTV's now as well!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review:
Had a brief hiccup involving a broken Optical Digital Audio port that came that way out of the box. But a quick replacement was sent within 48 hours. It's been TV viewing heaven ever since.

It's very bright without being overpowering. It has AI picture setup and that allowed me to get the ideal picture for me. That's good because it doesn't involve constant tweaking of the picture. For me it was, quite literally, a "set-it-and-forget-it" type deal.

The apps that come with it are decent to pretty good. The TV audio is decent, but I run the audio via the Optical Digital port to an old LG branded 5.1 home theater system and it sounds excellent! I do plan on upgrading to a sound bar in the not too distant future though.

The Magic Remote is just pure awesomeness! Interesting note: my previous LG TV from 2015 did not come with an actual Magic Remote just the circuitry. I could use my phone as one on that TV. 🤔

I'm loving this TV. I just hope this "love affair" doesn't end any time soon.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
Love the color, the sound quality, the easiness of the set up, the picture quality right out the box! The ergonomic feel of the MAGIC controller, the pointer, the voice control, & how easy it is to connect your other devices! I researched the mini led technology & so glad I chose this TV! LG technology is the best fo
r long term performance. Very, very happy....love, love, love it. Don't hesitate to buy!

reviewList.reviewTitle: 99% as good as OLED without OLED price and issues.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviewList.review:
We upgraded from our 2016 LG 65 inch smart TV. The picture is simply amazing, especially in 4K. The A.I. does remarkable job adjusting the picture and audio. For example, dark scenes are much easier to see than with our previous TV.

The magic remote is very easy to use and gives 1 button access to your most used apps like Netflix.

I can't say enough about this TV, outstanding product and value.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Beautiful image, Easy to set up, Sound could be better
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
For years I’ve had a 49” LG, which I love, so I purchased another LG when I decided to upgrade to a 65”. LG has improved the interface- it’s so much easier to navigate content including the free LG channels than with the older model. The picture is crisp and bright. I docked a star because the sound isn’t up to par with my older LG. Regardless of the sound mode, it sounds distant and a little tinny so I’ll get a soundbar. Setup was super easy: it gives you the option to use your phone to connect the tv to the wifi and adjust the settings, which I found preferable to using the remote to type out passwords. I would say that this tv was worth the black friday sale price but I wouldn’t pay anywhere near retail due to the sound not being great.

Not a huge deal but the cord could be longer. The cord begins toward the right side of the tv, so keep in mind that if your outlet is to the left of the tv, you’ll most likely need an extension cord. If you are getting the deluxe delivery, I recommend having an extension cord ready so that you can make sure the tv works before the delivery people leave.

I used Amazon’s deluxe delivery and that went smoothly. It came on time despite the warning that it might not be delivered today due to the package being delayed in transit. I highly recommend the deluxe delivery option for larger tvs since they unpack it, assemble the stand, place the tv where you want it and take the packaging with them. And if there’s anything wrong with the tv, they’ll take it right back without hassle.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviewList.review: Great picture out of box, but very easy to adjust picture to your liking. Remote a little tricky but I’m used to it now. Love the TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviewList.review: when you first turn it on it doesnt bring up a picture and shows burn areas in screen then when it does finally produce a picture it blurrs out. Not a good TV at all and I returned it after several failed attempts to do so from amazon returns team. You are expected to pack it back into its original box and it gets picked up without a proper inspection to ensure its noted that you have returned it in its original working condition . I felt this puts you at great risk of being held accountable for any damges that can accure in transit of return on a amazon delivery teams truck. At over $1000.00 I paid for it I worry greatly about getting this back in full. Not worth the money in quality and not worth the risk to return it.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: We had an LG TV prior to the tornado. When building our new home, we went with all LG appliances, including our TVs. This one was the perfect size for our space. We mounted in on a wall and it is beautiful. The picture is fantastic, the audio is clear, and we couldn't be more pleased. We would definitely recommend LG products to anyone.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Happy but not sure quality is worth price difference
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviewList.review: I am happy with this TV overall. It is a great picture but Ive had a few vizios and insignias and so far I dont see the extra money I paid for the tech being worth it. The amazon smart tv features are good but i think i like roku format better. and id have to say im least impressed with the remote. its ok but i definitely cant brag about it. the mouse feature has been a little annoying so far and in my opinion every remote should come with a built in keyboard. I cant say its not worth the money but i just dont think spending the extra money for a better picture is worh it unless the difference is found when gaming which i havent done yet. It does support dolby and digital surround sound which im very happy with so far. im using the optical audio input to reciever and hdmi for video outs. sound is all you can hope for. picture is great. In a nutshell you will be happy with the tv just not sure you need to spend the extra money. dont forget to make sure you have the inputs and outputs for all the applications you want to access. this tv does cover all of mine which are more then most people that i know. Also i should mention that the box it shows in is enormous and almost intimidation when you need to get it in the house yourself. but i was able to lift and mount it on my swing arm wall mount by myself. i wouldnt recommend most try to do it alone though.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviewList.review:
Wow! The size of this thing. Coming from a 55" TV This one is big. This is all around a very good TV. The remote is a little bit weird to use at first, but once you see that it can be used as a pointer, or just press around the thumb wheel, and you can press the either left, right, up, or down to make your selections it'll become easier to use.

I'm using it with an antenna, and the picture is great on the 1080p stations, but you may notice a little bit of stutter on the lower quality stations.

The sound is a little bit tinny with the built in speakers. Using the fiber optic cable for the soundbar also came with a slight hiccup, where on some stations there was a 1-2 second delay on the sound, but when using the soundbar with an HDMI cable all is well.

This TV has a nice wide viewing angle. I'm currently using the Expert Night display setting, but I'm going to explore the other settings a little bit more, when I have the time. The Expert Night, Expert Day, Cinema, and Filmmaker settings were very similar in performance, and appear to be the best choices overall.

I chose the expert delivery with set-up, and they were great. They showed up on time, set it up for me, and placed it on the stand, then took away all the trash associated with it, when the job was completed.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is my first 4k led TV I've owned, and I cannot believe the difference in picture quality. The color is stunning!

The TV is lightweight and easy to unbox and install. The setup instructions were very clear and easy to follow as well. I'm not a tech person so I cannot get into all the technical aspects, but I can say that this TV is amazing.

My only issue is getting used to the remote. The remote reminds me of using a mouse with the way it has a pointer. But that will be easy to get used to with time.

All in all, this was a great buy and I highly recommend it!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviewList.review: Bought this tv a few months ago and now there's no picture just sound. Won't buy lg again

reviewList.reviewTitle: The Non-OLED That Comes Close Without The OLED Issues
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviewList.review:
I wanted a very large HDTV. Check. I didn't want to go OLED as I had several plasmas and remember ghost images that were hard to go away due to "slight" burn-in. Check. I had read enough about the new very small nano LCD apertures to believe until individually addressable micro led direct view sets become affordable, LG QNED, and Samsung's similar Quantum Dot panels are the way to go. Check. I wanted brightness without crushing dark black Check. I wanted local dimming with the newer mini-led backlight technology. Check.

So, I took a chance and bought this set sight unseen. I didn't make a mistake I'm happy to say. This set can work in a well lit or dark room no problem. It can make levels of black look black, and with detail so no crushing. It has almost non-existent bloom across the entire screen when displaying white letters on black background for instance. It has a modern set of specs like compatible with HDR-10/Dolby Vision. There are a few things I'm thinking are not great, but certainly not deal-breaking stuff. Things like the remote is impossible to use in a dark space (and in my case without reading glasses). The sound isn't cutting edge stuff like the Sony sets that radiate a bigger and more wide-range soundstage using the entire front of the screen...although sound is adequate for now while I'm waiting to see if I can get the new Nakamichi Dragon surround set. Overall, I'm quite pleased with this TV and I'm writing this only a few weeks after paying about $500 more than the currently offered price. The TV is good enough this doesn't even cause me a case of sour grapes, though if I could I'd return it and order it again which I can't cause I threw away the box and packing materials. But make no mistake, I'd definitely buy it again. I have had several LG HDTV's beginning with their somewhat unusual (the only one ever on the market to my knowledge) rear projected 9" CRT tube first ever HDTV then marketed under the Zenith name (a premium name they owned then). It had a great picture but developed problems with showing 720P (progressive inputs) and after repairing it twice they actually offered, and did, buy it back at over $4.5K. Now that's a stand-up company that cares about what they make and the consumer that shells out hard earned dough for their products. I recommend LG HDTV's now as well!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review:
Had a brief hiccup involving a broken Optical Digital Audio port that came that way out of the box. But a quick replacement was sent within 48 hours. It's been TV viewing heaven ever since.

It's very bright without being overpowering. It has AI picture setup and that allowed me to get the ideal picture for me. That's good because it doesn't involve constant tweaking of the picture. For me it was, quite literally, a "set-it-and-forget-it" type deal.

The apps that come with it are decent to pretty good. The TV audio is decent, but I run the audio via the Optical Digital port to an old LG branded 5.1 home theater system and it sounds excellent! I do plan on upgrading to a sound bar in the not too distant future though.

The Magic Remote is just pure awesomeness! Interesting note: my previous LG TV from 2015 did not come with an actual Magic Remote just the circuitry. I could use my phone as one on that TV. 🤔

I'm loving this TV. I just hope this "love affair" doesn't end any time soon.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
Love the color, the sound quality, the easiness of the set up, the picture quality right out the box! The ergonomic feel of the MAGIC controller, the pointer, the voice control, & how easy it is to connect your other devices! I researched the mini led technology & so glad I chose this TV! LG technology is the best fo
r long term performance. Very, very happy....love, love, love it. Don't hesitate to buy!

reviewList.reviewTitle: 99% as good as OLED without OLED price and issues.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviewList.review:
We upgraded from our 2016 LG 65 inch smart TV. The picture is simply amazing, especially in 4K. The A.I. does remarkable job adjusting the picture and audio. For example, dark scenes are much easier to see than with our previous TV.

The magic remote is very easy to use and gives 1 button access to your most used apps like Netflix.

I can't say enough about this TV, outstanding product and value.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Beautiful image, Easy to set up, Sound could be better
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
For years I’ve had a 49” LG, which I love, so I purchased another LG when I decided to upgrade to a 65”. LG has improved the interface- it’s so much easier to navigate content including the free LG channels than with the older model. The picture is crisp and bright. I docked a star because the sound isn’t up to par with my older LG. Regardless of the sound mode, it sounds distant and a little tinny so I’ll get a soundbar. Setup was super easy: it gives you the option to use your phone to connect the tv to the wifi and adjust the settings, which I found preferable to using the remote to type out passwords. I would say that this tv was worth the black friday sale price but I wouldn’t pay anywhere near retail due to the sound not being great.

Not a huge deal but the cord could be longer. The cord begins toward the right side of the tv, so keep in mind that if your outlet is to the left of the tv, you’ll most likely need an extension cord. If you are getting the deluxe delivery, I recommend having an extension cord ready so that you can make sure the tv works before the delivery people leave.

I used Amazon’s deluxe delivery and that went smoothly. It came on time despite the warning that it might not be delivered today due to the package being delayed in transit. I highly recommend the deluxe delivery option for larger tvs since they unpack it, assemble the stand, place the tv where you want it and take the packaging with them. And if there’s anything wrong with the tv, they’ll take it right back without hassle.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviewList.review: Great picture out of box, but very easy to adjust picture to your liking. Remote a little tricky but I’m used to it now. Love the TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviewList.review: when you first turn it on it doesnt bring up a picture and shows burn areas in screen then when it does finally produce a picture it blurrs out. Not a good TV at all and I returned it after several failed attempts to do so from amazon returns team. You are expected to pack it back into its original box and it gets picked up without a proper inspection to ensure its noted that you have returned it in its original working condition . I felt this puts you at great risk of being held accountable for any damges that can accure in transit of return on a amazon delivery teams truck. At over $1000.00 I paid for it I worry greatly about getting this back in full. Not worth the money in quality and not worth the risk to return it.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: We had an LG TV prior to the tornado. When building our new home, we went with all LG appliances, including our TVs. This one was the perfect size for our space. We mounted in on a wall and it is beautiful. The picture is fantastic, the audio is clear, and we couldn't be more pleased. We would definitely recommend LG products to anyone.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Happy but not sure quality is worth price difference
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviewList.review: I am happy with this TV overall. It is a great picture but Ive had a few vizios and insignias and so far I dont see the extra money I paid for the tech being worth it. The amazon smart tv features are good but i think i like roku format better. and id have to say im least impressed with the remote. its ok but i definitely cant brag about it. the mouse feature has been a little annoying so far and in my opinion every remote should come with a built in keyboard. I cant say its not worth the money but i just dont think spending the extra money for a better picture is worh it unless the difference is found when gaming which i havent done yet. It does support dolby and digital surround sound which im very happy with so far. im using the optical audio input to reciever and hdmi for video outs. sound is all you can hope for. picture is great. In a nutshell you will be happy with the tv just not sure you need to spend the extra money. dont forget to make sure you have the inputs and outputs for all the applications you want to access. this tv does cover all of mine which are more then most people that i know. Also i should mention that the box it shows in is enormous and almost intimidation when you need to get it in the house yourself. but i was able to lift and mount it on my swing arm wall mount by myself. i wouldnt recommend most try to do it alone though.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviewList.review:
Wow! The size of this thing. Coming from a 55" TV This one is big. This is all around a very good TV. The remote is a little bit weird to use at first, but once you see that it can be used as a pointer, or just press around the thumb wheel, and you can press the either left, right, up, or down to make your selections it'll become easier to use.

I'm using it with an antenna, and the picture is great on the 1080p stations, but you may notice a little bit of stutter on the lower quality stations.

The sound is a little bit tinny with the built in speakers. Using the fiber optic cable for the soundbar also came with a slight hiccup, where on some stations there was a 1-2 second delay on the sound, but when using the soundbar with an HDMI cable all is well.

This TV has a nice wide viewing angle. I'm currently using the Expert Night display setting, but I'm going to explore the other settings a little bit more, when I have the time. The Expert Night, Expert Day, Cinema, and Filmmaker settings were very similar in performance, and appear to be the best choices overall.

I chose the expert delivery with set-up, and they were great. They showed up on time, set it up for me, and placed it on the stand, then took away all the trash associated with it, when the job was completed.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is my first 4k led TV I've owned, and I cannot believe the difference in picture quality. The color is stunning!

The TV is lightweight and easy to unbox and install. The setup instructions were very clear and easy to follow as well. I'm not a tech person so I cannot get into all the technical aspects, but I can say that this TV is amazing.

My only issue is getting used to the remote. The remote reminds me of using a mouse with the way it has a pointer. But that will be easy to get used to with time.

All in all, this was a great buy and I highly recommend it!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviewList.review: Bought this tv a few months ago and now there's no picture just sound. Won't buy lg again

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review: First and foremost , the picture really is excellent ! Bright colors and crisp lines are had with the factory default settings . The settings interface is far different than anything I've been used to but once you figure things out , they're fine . The sound is average for a TV , but with a picture this good a sound bar really is in order . My only complaint is the remote . It isn't back-lit and the buttons have little to no tactile feel . I just about need a light on to use it . It does fit my hand nicely . The cursor is somewhat unique but a little hard to use at first . It has a setting to slow it down and that helped a lot . The cursor does make most operations faster than the also included , standard , four position cursor ring . Overall , I just love this TV after using it for the last month .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review:
First off, this TV looks and sounds amazing. I bought the 43" and it is perfect. The sound quality is amazing and the picture is crisp. Obviously a sound bar would enhance the audio, but it works very well without it.

I'll add that I looked up a lot of reviews before purchasing this. Television reviews are wild and people are very nit picky. One thing I read that since this was an IPS panel, it'd look bad or be glaring. I currently have Christmas lights around the ceiling of my room and I can see them on the tv, but it's not going to ruin your viewing experience unless your watching a very dark movie. There is very little/almost no backlight bleeding as well.

The only thing I disliked is installing the legs. But that was my own fault because I was using a screw driver that was ever so slightly too small which made trying to screw the legs in difficult. Other than that this is an amazing TV and I full recommend this to anyone looking for a new television.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviewList.review: Our last 55" TV was an LG smart TV and was so easy to use. After 15 years it had to be replaced, so we thought we'd go with another lg. This unit had very good reviews and was the size we needed. It was very easy to set up and has a good picture, but that's that's where the pros end. As I had read, the magic wand rollerball is overly sensitive at times, them doesn't work at all. The interface is mind numbingly chaotic. The onscreen menus go on forever and there seems to be no easy way to maneuver through the options. LG also seems to have over 900 "LG stations", but they're all useless. Sorting through all the options takes forever, to the point that we're so frustrated we just give up. The basic picture technology is comparable to any other brand, but its the quality of the interface that makes this unit such poor choice.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviewList.review: - Very good tv, good picture quality, nicely packed and shipped. Thank you.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviewList.review: I gave 4 stars because of some issues I had with other items apart of my order that I didn’t receive. My TV it’s great. I enjoy the color and visual accuracy of the picture. I believe I made a great choice with purchasing TVs full Amazon!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviewList.review: This is a smart TV, maybe too smart for me. Wife now thinks she would have been better off with her dumb TV and a firestick or similar. TV starts with its interface, rather than the last place you left it (directtv). BD/DVD player connected easily enough, and it recognized it, but that did not stop it from displaying a banner ever 3 seconds trying to get me to synch it to the BD player - no instructions for that, so the BD player is now unplugged - will have to figure that out. Software interface is not easy/intuitive to maneuver.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review: I don’t know why there’s not more reviews about the sound quality on this tv. It’s sounds like everyone is speaking into a tin can. There are several sound modes but none get rid of the tinny sound. But the picture quality is great. Very clear and vivid. They also should provide a way to disable the annoying curser.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
As a previous geek squad home theatre installer. I was familiar with what i’d be getting buying this. Everyone either loves or hates the LG remote. I personally love it and the out of the box experience you get with LG tv’s. LG’s home menu isn’t the most user friendly but it’s easily usable and isn’t clunky. Things seem to load just fine and have had no issues with it. If you aren’t a fan of the remote or the home menu, which most people aren’t. I would highly suggest going with a similar samsung/sony tv.

Overall, i’d give the tv an 8 out of 10. Picture quality is great and have had no complaints watching older movies, and content that is upscale to 4k. Obviously an OLED will have better image quality but for this price point i think it’s an amazing purchase.

I can’t speak to much on the sound as i’m using this TV with a Sonos surround audio setup. That works great and no issues there.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review: Muy buena calidad, a mi esposo y a mí nos encantó.

reviewList.reviewTitle: The delivery service was excellent. They guys were very friendly and knew just what they were doing
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviewList.review: The tv is great. But I really want to praise the delivery and set up service

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this television because it advertised 2 HDMI 2.1 ports. I wanted that for my 2 game consoles. When I got the TV I found out the expensive way that it most definitely DOES NOT have HDMI 2.1 Its a good TV besides that fact, just don't purchase it if you were wanting a TV with the 2 1 ports.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Lasted 2 whole years. That’s $190 per year.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
Great at first, although the internet was glitchy. Then one day, in the middle of a streaming show, it just quit and refused to connect to the internet. No help at all from LG, who suggested power-cycling my router despite literally every other smart device in my house being connected just fine. I tried power-cycling the TV off and back on, and also re-connecting it to the internet - it then just refused to connect to the internet.
I can’t recommend this pee oh ess TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviewList.review: This Lg smart tv is easy to set up and it’s in 4K, it has clear picture quality and also Alexa built in. It has all the apps built in and it also sounds great!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Easiest TV to set up, very clear picture
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is an amazing TV for this price. First off, it was the easiest TV EVER to set up. Seriously, talk about plug-and-play. You just plug in the power and boom, you have a smart TV. Sign in to any streaming channels you have and you're set. LG has their own smart TV software but it's very easy to figure out. It would be nice if they would get rid of the ads, but sometimes you just have to deal with that. Better than having to buy a separate smart TV player. The remote is a bit odd with the weird scroll button in the middle. I prefer the arrow keys but I'm getting used to this. It does have several buttons to take you right to the most popular streaming channels, but that's subjective as we aren't into Disney and I think Sling is an odd one to choose. I'd add in Max before that. It's a bit different to use than other remotes because you have to point it to the screen and there's a small laser light that works as a cursor when you are selecting something on the screen. This should be fun if I set this up to play streaming games. The volume and everything else work great so you just have the one remote. Still trying to figure out all the buttons but it was easy to use the basic functions right away.

As far as apps go, they had all the ones we subscribe to. I'm sure there are some missing but I haven't found any yet that I want that aren't here.

The picture is the next great thing. At this price, it's really quite good. It's very clear and I didn't have to make any adjustments for it to just look good right out of the box. And just super sharp. Almost too realistic at times, but I grew up with movies being a bit softened so the sharpness of new TVs still gets to me. I haven't noticed any blurring on things like action movies, but I don't tend to notice that. The colors seem good and I'll eventually play with the settings to see how to adjust it. But the colors are vivid without being blown out. And I haven't noticed any edge distortion so it's really nice to watch.

Overall, I'm very happy with this TV. Mostly for the ease of set up. The remote takes getting used to but that's not a big deal. We could always buy a different one that has all the main functions we need. So, for this price, I definitely approve. And I've had good luck with LG TVs lasting a long time so we plan on keeping this as our main TV for many years.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I purchased this TV to replace the one in my bedroom that died, which was a Samsung. I've been team Samsung for years, but my brother convinced me to get an LG and I'm very pleased with this purchase. I was able to adjust the picture exactly as I wanted it, and the blacks are really black (this can be adjusted if it's too dark or too light). The remote takes some getting used to, but it's not bad. The sound from the speakers is also pretty decent, but I do use a sound bar. If you are looking for a good LG TV on a budget, I would definitely recommend buying this one.

reviewList.review: So, when connecting an Xbox and setting it to 1080p you can get 120fps. The game mode on the TV also saw it as 120 fps, now that surprised me since this TV is only supposed to do 60hz maximum. I was pretty happy, but sadly anything else is stuck to 60hz. I use it mainly for Xbox and PC with colors and clarity being top notch. It's bright, vibrant, speakers are ehh. Control is nice I haven't accidentally pressed anything on it so far. I have no complaints it is an excellent tv.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture, clunky remote, and cluttered interface
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
Overall, if you are someone who likes to edit lots of the system settings and prefer image quality over simplification, this would be a good upper middle tier TV for you. However, I prefer convenience.

Unboxing:
-This was easy to take out of the box with just 1 person.
-The legs attached easily, and I appreciated the cable organizer that comes with it to add on the back.

Setup:
-Overall the setup of the TV was straightforward and you can easily follow the on-screen prompts. It started with a voice prompt setup that you can turn off, which spoke incredibly fast but it was intended for visually impaired individuals, which you can turn off.
-It’s easy to sign in to apps using either the tv, your phone, or a laptop.
-I did run into a problem during the initial bootup where I got a spinning circle of death. After waiting 25 minutes, I rebooted the TV and had to restart the setup from the beginning. Overall, including logging in all my apps, it probably took about 30 minutes.

Remote:
-They tried to do too much with the remote causing a lot of daily frustration.
-My main concern is the “enter” or “ok” button in the middle of the arrows. It also acts as a scrolling ball, but many times when you push down for “ok” it ends up scrolling to another part of the page. It is very sensitive.
-The remote has a motion control function which acts like a mouse and pointer but the arrow on the tv lingers too long after use and I find it to be distracting on the screen until it disappears by itself.
-I also found the remote to be too old school with numbers for channels and buttons for almost everything you can imagine. I prefer the minimal and sleek remotes that come with many new TVs. This LG remote is about double the size and requires AA batteries instead of AAA.

Homepage:
-I am used to a very simplified homepage with roku where almost everything can be modified. This has all the bells and whistles, which provides plenty of options, but looks crowded and congested. Half the screen of the homepage is a giant ad for a streaming service I don’t use.

Screen quality:
-I had a 5 year old 55 inch TCL tv that I got for about $350. In my opinion, the picture quality of this LG TV is just slightly better. It has bright colors and people look a bit sharper in movies, but I wouldn’t say it’s worth the price difference from my old tv.
-The screen has a standard amount of glare. I have a window on the opposite wall of the tv which reflects light in the morning. The window reflection is very visible especially when the screen is dark.

Gaming:
-I have a nintendo switch I use to play games. The TV immediately suggests a gaming mode for best results. It has an easy to use gaming features to adjust setting quickly specifically for gaming.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was repairing my room to replace my old plasma tv with this one. Once it got delivered I took down my old TV and set up this one with my TV mounts that fit perfectly and mounted it. When I tired to turn it on nothing happened. I figured maybe I didn't plug in the power cable in correctly. After several attempts the TV turned on but the screen showed a bunch of lines across the entire screen before flickering in and out and then never powered on again.

I tried reaching to Amazon to see if maybe I got a broken and malfunction unit but according to them because it's a large electrical item they would need to send a technician out to verify if it can be repaired or replaced. I haven't heard anything from them since and put up my old TV and threw this in the trash.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviewList.review: This TV is so great to look at- the picture and video quality is gorgeous, you just need to have the right settings. This is perfect if you’re looking for a budget TV slightly higher than base models for casual viewing such as netflix, and light single player games since you don’t really need a 120hz TV if you’re not into competitive gaming so even though this can only run at 60hz, this is already good enough and enjoyable. LG is a very reputable brand, thus not just giving high quality TV, but also a manageable webOS. I wouldn’t say it’s blazing fast, but more in like ok for most people. As for the sound quality, it’s fine for normal circumstances but if you want the best cinema experience, then you need to get an external speaker. The package also came with very minor damage underneath the TV but I don’t really mind since you can barely notice it and it doesn’t affect the functionality. The price also was very competitive, much cheaper than in stores, so I’m very happy with my purchase since I also prefer LG TV’s over other brands.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review: First and foremost , the picture really is excellent ! Bright colors and crisp lines are had with the factory default settings . The settings interface is far different than anything I've been used to but once you figure things out , they're fine . The sound is average for a TV , but with a picture this good a sound bar really is in order . My only complaint is the remote . It isn't back-lit and the buttons have little to no tactile feel . I just about need a light on to use it . It does fit my hand nicely . The cursor is somewhat unique but a little hard to use at first . It has a setting to slow it down and that helped a lot . The cursor does make most operations faster than the also included , standard , four position cursor ring . Overall , I just love this TV after using it for the last month .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review:
First off, this TV looks and sounds amazing. I bought the 43" and it is perfect. The sound quality is amazing and the picture is crisp. Obviously a sound bar would enhance the audio, but it works very well without it.

I'll add that I looked up a lot of reviews before purchasing this. Television reviews are wild and people are very nit picky. One thing I read that since this was an IPS panel, it'd look bad or be glaring. I currently have Christmas lights around the ceiling of my room and I can see them on the tv, but it's not going to ruin your viewing experience unless your watching a very dark movie. There is very little/almost no backlight bleeding as well.

The only thing I disliked is installing the legs. But that was my own fault because I was using a screw driver that was ever so slightly too small which made trying to screw the legs in difficult. Other than that this is an amazing TV and I full recommend this to anyone looking for a new television.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviewList.review: Our last 55" TV was an LG smart TV and was so easy to use. After 15 years it had to be replaced, so we thought we'd go with another lg. This unit had very good reviews and was the size we needed. It was very easy to set up and has a good picture, but that's that's where the pros end. As I had read, the magic wand rollerball is overly sensitive at times, them doesn't work at all. The interface is mind numbingly chaotic. The onscreen menus go on forever and there seems to be no easy way to maneuver through the options. LG also seems to have over 900 "LG stations", but they're all useless. Sorting through all the options takes forever, to the point that we're so frustrated we just give up. The basic picture technology is comparable to any other brand, but its the quality of the interface that makes this unit such poor choice.

reviewList.review: This is a smart TV, maybe too smart for me. Wife now thinks she would have been better off with her dumb TV and a firestick or similar. TV starts with its interface, rather than the last place you left it (directtv). BD/DVD player connected easily enough, and it recognized it, but that did not stop it from displaying a banner ever 3 seconds trying to get me to synch it to the BD player - no instructions for that, so the BD player is now unplugged - will have to figure that out. Software interface is not easy/intuitive to maneuver.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review: I don’t know why there’s not more reviews about the sound quality on this tv. It’s sounds like everyone is speaking into a tin can. There are several sound modes but none get rid of the tinny sound. But the picture quality is great. Very clear and vivid. They also should provide a way to disable the annoying curser.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
As a previous geek squad home theatre installer. I was familiar with what i’d be getting buying this. Everyone either loves or hates the LG remote. I personally love it and the out of the box experience you get with LG tv’s. LG’s home menu isn’t the most user friendly but it’s easily usable and isn’t clunky. Things seem to load just fine and have had no issues with it. If you aren’t a fan of the remote or the home menu, which most people aren’t. I would highly suggest going with a similar samsung/sony tv.

Overall, i’d give the tv an 8 out of 10. Picture quality is great and have had no complaints watching older movies, and content that is upscale to 4k. Obviously an OLED will have better image quality but for this price point i think it’s an amazing purchase.

I can’t speak to much on the sound as i’m using this TV with a Sonos surround audio setup. That works great and no issues there.

reviewList.review:
Great at first, although the internet was glitchy. Then one day, in the middle of a streaming show, it just quit and refused to connect to the internet. No help at all from LG, who suggested power-cycling my router despite literally every other smart device in my house being connected just fine. I tried power-cycling the TV off and back on, and also re-connecting it to the internet - it then just refused to connect to the internet.
I can’t recommend this pee oh ess TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviewList.review: This Lg smart tv is easy to set up and it’s in 4K, it has clear picture quality and also Alexa built in. It has all the apps built in and it also sounds great!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Easiest TV to set up, very clear picture
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is an amazing TV for this price. First off, it was the easiest TV EVER to set up. Seriously, talk about plug-and-play. You just plug in the power and boom, you have a smart TV. Sign in to any streaming channels you have and you're set. LG has their own smart TV software but it's very easy to figure out. It would be nice if they would get rid of the ads, but sometimes you just have to deal with that. Better than having to buy a separate smart TV player. The remote is a bit odd with the weird scroll button in the middle. I prefer the arrow keys but I'm getting used to this. It does have several buttons to take you right to the most popular streaming channels, but that's subjective as we aren't into Disney and I think Sling is an odd one to choose. I'd add in Max before that. It's a bit different to use than other remotes because you have to point it to the screen and there's a small laser light that works as a cursor when you are selecting something on the screen. This should be fun if I set this up to play streaming games. The volume and everything else work great so you just have the one remote. Still trying to figure out all the buttons but it was easy to use the basic functions right away.

As far as apps go, they had all the ones we subscribe to. I'm sure there are some missing but I haven't found any yet that I want that aren't here.

The picture is the next great thing. At this price, it's really quite good. It's very clear and I didn't have to make any adjustments for it to just look good right out of the box. And just super sharp. Almost too realistic at times, but I grew up with movies being a bit softened so the sharpness of new TVs still gets to me. I haven't noticed any blurring on things like action movies, but I don't tend to notice that. The colors seem good and I'll eventually play with the settings to see how to adjust it. But the colors are vivid without being blown out. And I haven't noticed any edge distortion so it's really nice to watch.

Overall, I'm very happy with this TV. Mostly for the ease of set up. The remote takes getting used to but that's not a big deal. We could always buy a different one that has all the main functions we need. So, for this price, I definitely approve. And I've had good luck with LG TVs lasting a long time so we plan on keeping this as our main TV for many years.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
As a previous geek squad home theatre installer. I was familiar with what i’d be getting buying this. Everyone either loves or hates the LG remote. I personally love it and the out of the box experience you get with LG tv’s. LG’s home menu isn’t the most user friendly but it’s easily usable and isn’t clunky. Things seem to load just fine and have had no issues with it. If you aren’t a fan of the remote or the home menu, which most people aren’t. I would highly suggest going with a similar samsung/sony tv.

Overall, i’d give the tv an 8 out of 10. Picture quality is great and have had no complaints watching older movies, and content that is upscale to 4k. Obviously an OLED will have better image quality but for this price point i think it’s an amazing purchase.

I can’t speak to much on the sound as i’m using this TV with a Sonos surround audio setup. That works great and no issues there.

Great at first, although the internet was glitchy. Then one day, in the middle of a streaming show, it just quit and refused to connect to the internet.
