reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviewList.review: This Lg smart tv is easy to set up and it’s in 4K, it has clear picture quality and also Alexa built in. It has all the apps built in and it also sounds great!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Easiest TV to set up, very clear picture
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is an amazing TV for this price. First off, it was the easiest TV EVER to set up. Seriously, talk about plug-and-play. You just plug in the power and boom, you have a smart TV. Sign in to any streaming channels you have and you're set. LG has their own smart TV software but it's very easy to figure out. It would be nice if they would get rid of the ads, but sometimes you just have to deal with that. Better than having to buy a separate smart TV player. The remote is a bit odd with the weird scroll button in the middle. I prefer the arrow keys but I'm getting used to this. It does have several buttons to take you right to the most popular streaming channels, but that's subjective as we aren't into Disney and I think Sling is an odd one to choose. I'd add in Max before that. It's a bit different to use than other remotes because you have to point it to the screen and there's a small laser light that works as a cursor when you are selecting something on the screen. This should be fun if I set this up to play streaming games. The volume and everything else work great so you just have the one remote. Still trying to figure out all the buttons but it was easy to use the basic functions right away.

As far as apps go, they had all the ones we subscribe to. I'm sure there are some missing but I haven't found any yet that I want that aren't here.

The picture is the next great thing. At this price, it's really quite good. It's very clear and I didn't have to make any adjustments for it to just look good right out of the box. And just super sharp. Almost too realistic at times, but I grew up with movies being a bit softened so the sharpness of new TVs still gets to me. I haven't noticed any blurring on things like action movies, but I don't tend to notice that. The colors seem good and I'll eventually play with the settings to see how to adjust it. But the colors are vivid without being blown out. And I haven't noticed any edge distortion so it's really nice to watch.

Overall, I'm very happy with this TV. Mostly for the ease of set up. The remote takes getting used to but that's not a big deal. We could always buy a different one that has all the main functions we need. So, for this price, I definitely approve. And I've had good luck with LG TVs lasting a long time so we plan on keeping this as our main TV for many years.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I purchased this TV to replace the one in my bedroom that died, which was a Samsung. I've been team Samsung for years, but my brother convinced me to get an LG and I'm very pleased with this purchase. I was able to adjust the picture exactly as I wanted it, and the blacks are really black (this can be adjusted if it's too dark or too light). The remote takes some getting used to, but it's not bad. The sound from the speakers is also pretty decent, but I do use a sound bar. If you are looking for a good LG TV on a budget, I would definitely recommend buying this one.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviewList.review: So, when connecting an Xbox and setting it to 1080p you can get 120fps. The game mode on the TV also saw it as 120 fps, now that surprised me since this TV is only supposed to do 60hz maximum. I was pretty happy, but sadly anything else is stuck to 60hz. I use it mainly for Xbox and PC with colors and clarity being top notch. It's bright, vibrant, speakers are ehh. Control is nice I haven't accidentally pressed anything on it so far. I have no complaints it is an excellent tv.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviewList.review: I really love this television. It fit perfectly in my living room. The quality of the picture is beautiful. It’s shows very clear. And was also easy to set up. It does recommend mounting but also came with stands to hold up the television. Set up was very easy. It was easy to set up all the applications for the television. I really love this. The sound quality is great. Really high quality. Definitely recommend.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture, clunky remote, and cluttered interface
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
Overall, if you are someone who likes to edit lots of the system settings and prefer image quality over simplification, this would be a good upper middle tier TV for you. However, I prefer convenience.

Unboxing:
-This was easy to take out of the box with just 1 person.
-The legs attached easily, and I appreciated the cable organizer that comes with it to add on the back.

Setup:
-Overall the setup of the TV was straightforward and you can easily follow the on-screen prompts. It started with a voice prompt setup that you can turn off, which spoke incredibly fast but it was intended for visually impaired individuals, which you can turn off.
-It’s easy to sign in to apps using either the tv, your phone, or a laptop.
-I did run into a problem during the initial bootup where I got a spinning circle of death. After waiting 25 minutes, I rebooted the TV and had to restart the setup from the beginning. Overall, including logging in all my apps, it probably took about 30 minutes.

Remote:
-They tried to do too much with the remote causing a lot of daily frustration.
-My main concern is the “enter” or “ok” button in the middle of the arrows. It also acts as a scrolling ball, but many times when you push down for “ok” it ends up scrolling to another part of the page. It is very sensitive.
-The remote has a motion control function which acts like a mouse and pointer but the arrow on the tv lingers too long after use and I find it to be distracting on the screen until it disappears by itself.
-I also found the remote to be too old school with numbers for channels and buttons for almost everything you can imagine. I prefer the minimal and sleek remotes that come with many new TVs. This LG remote is about double the size and requires AA batteries instead of AAA.

Homepage:
-I am used to a very simplified homepage with roku where almost everything can be modified. This has all the bells and whistles, which provides plenty of options, but looks crowded and congested. Half the screen of the homepage is a giant ad for a streaming service I don’t use.

Screen quality:
-I had a 5 year old 55 inch TCL tv that I got for about $350. In my opinion, the picture quality of this LG TV is just slightly better. It has bright colors and people look a bit sharper in movies, but I wouldn’t say it’s worth the price difference from my old tv.
-The screen has a standard amount of glare. I have a window on the opposite wall of the tv which reflects light in the morning. The window reflection is very visible especially when the screen is dark.

Gaming:
-I have a nintendo switch I use to play games. The TV immediately suggests a gaming mode for best results. It has an easy to use gaming features to adjust setting quickly specifically for gaming.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was repairing my room to replace my old plasma tv with this one. Once it got delivered I took down my old TV and set up this one with my TV mounts that fit perfectly and mounted it. When I tired to turn it on nothing happened. I figured maybe I didn't plug in the power cable in correctly. After several attempts the TV turned on but the screen showed a bunch of lines across the entire screen before flickering in and out and then never powered on again.

I tried reaching to Amazon to see if maybe I got a broken and malfunction unit but according to them because it's a large electrical item they would need to send a technician out to verify if it can be repaired or replaced. I haven't heard anything from them since and put up my old TV and threw this in the trash.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviewList.review: This TV is so great to look at- the picture and video quality is gorgeous, you just need to have the right settings. This is perfect if you’re looking for a budget TV slightly higher than base models for casual viewing such as netflix, and light single player games since you don’t really need a 120hz TV if you’re not into competitive gaming so even though this can only run at 60hz, this is already good enough and enjoyable. LG is a very reputable brand, thus not just giving high quality TV, but also a manageable webOS. I wouldn’t say it’s blazing fast, but more in like ok for most people. As for the sound quality, it’s fine for normal circumstances but if you want the best cinema experience, then you need to get an external speaker. The package also came with very minor damage underneath the TV but I don’t really mind since you can barely notice it and it doesn’t affect the functionality. The price also was very competitive, much cheaper than in stores, so I’m very happy with my purchase since I also prefer LG TV’s over other brands.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review: First and foremost , the picture really is excellent ! Bright colors and crisp lines are had with the factory default settings . The settings interface is far different than anything I've been used to but once you figure things out , they're fine . The sound is average for a TV , but with a picture this good a sound bar really is in order . My only complaint is the remote . It isn't back-lit and the buttons have little to no tactile feel . I just about need a light on to use it . It does fit my hand nicely . The cursor is somewhat unique but a little hard to use at first . It has a setting to slow it down and that helped a lot . The cursor does make most operations faster than the also included , standard , four position cursor ring . Overall , I just love this TV after using it for the last month .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review:
First off, this TV looks and sounds amazing. I bought the 43" and it is perfect. The sound quality is amazing and the picture is crisp. Obviously a sound bar would enhance the audio, but it works very well without it.

I'll add that I looked up a lot of reviews before purchasing this. Television reviews are wild and people are very nit picky. One thing I read that since this was an IPS panel, it'd look bad or be glaring. I currently have Christmas lights around the ceiling of my room and I can see them on the tv, but it's not going to ruin your viewing experience unless your watching a very dark movie. There is very little/almost no backlight bleeding as well.

The only thing I disliked is installing the legs. But that was my own fault because I was using a screw driver that was ever so slightly too small which made trying to screw the legs in difficult. Other than that this is an amazing TV and I full recommend this to anyone looking for a new television.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviewList.review: Our last 55" TV was an LG smart TV and was so easy to use. After 15 years it had to be replaced, so we thought we'd go with another lg. This unit had very good reviews and was the size we needed. It was very easy to set up and has a good picture, but that's that's where the pros end. As I had read, the magic wand rollerball is overly sensitive at times, them doesn't work at all. The interface is mind numbingly chaotic. The onscreen menus go on forever and there seems to be no easy way to maneuver through the options. LG also seems to have over 900 "LG stations", but they're all useless. Sorting through all the options takes forever, to the point that we're so frustrated we just give up. The basic picture technology is comparable to any other brand, but its the quality of the interface that makes this unit such poor choice.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review: First and foremost , the picture really is excellent ! Bright colors and crisp lines are had with the factory default settings . The settings interface is far different than anything I've been used to but once you figure things out , they're fine . The sound is average for a TV , but with a picture this good a sound bar really is in order . My only complaint is the remote . It isn't back-lit and the buttons have little to no tactile feel . I just about need a light on to use it . It does fit my hand nicely . The cursor is somewhat unique but a little hard to use at first . It has a setting to slow it down and that helped a lot . The cursor does make most operations faster than the also included , standard , four position cursor ring . Overall , I just love this TV after using it for the last month .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this television because it advertised 2 HDMI 2.1 ports. I wanted that for my 2 game consoles. When I got the TV I found out the expensive way that it most definitely DOES NOT have HDMI 2.1 Its a good TV besides that fact, just don't purchase it if you were wanting a TV with the 2 1 ports.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Lasted 2 whole years. That’s $190 per year.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
Great at first, although the internet was glitchy. Then one day, in the middle of a streaming show, it just quit and refused to connect to the internet. No help at all from LG, who suggested power-cycling my router despite literally every other smart device in my house being connected just fine. I tried power-cycling the TV off and back on, and also re-connecting it to the internet - it then just refused to connect to the internet.
I can’t recommend this pee oh ess TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviewList.review: This Lg smart tv is easy to set up and it’s in 4K, it has clear picture quality and also Alexa built in. It has all the apps built in and it also sounds great!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Easiest TV to set up, very clear picture
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviewList.review:
This is an amazing TV for this price. First off, it was the easiest TV EVER to set up. Seriously, talk about plug-and-play. You just plug in the power and boom, you have a smart TV. Sign in to any streaming channels you have and you're set. LG has their own smart TV software but it's very easy to figure out. It would be nice if they would get rid of the ads, but sometimes you just have to deal with that. Better than having to buy a separate smart TV player. The remote is a bit odd with the weird scroll button in the middle. I prefer the arrow keys but I'm getting used to this. It does have several buttons to take you right to the most popular streaming channels, but that's subjective as we aren't into Disney and I think Sling is an odd one to choose. I'd add in Max before that. It's a bit different to use than other remotes because you have to point it to the screen and there's a small laser light that works as a cursor when you are selecting something on the screen. This should be fun if I set this up to play streaming games. The volume and everything else work great so you just have the one remote. Still trying to figure out all the buttons but it was easy to use the basic functions right away.

As far as apps go, they had all the ones we subscribe to. I'm sure there are some missing but I haven't found any yet that I want that aren't here.

The picture is the next great thing. At this price, it's really quite good. It's very clear and I didn't have to make any adjustments for it to just look good right out of the box. And just super sharp. Almost too realistic at times, but I grew up with movies being a bit softened so the sharpness of new TVs still gets to me. I haven't noticed any blurring on things like action movies, but I don't tend to notice that. The colors seem good and I'll eventually play with the settings to see how to adjust it. But the colors are vivid without being blown out. And I haven't noticed any edge distortion so it's really nice to watch.

Overall, I'm very happy with this TV. Mostly for the ease of set up. The remote takes getting used to but that's not a big deal. We could always buy a different one that has all the main functions we need. So, for this price, I definitely approve. And I've had good luck with LG TVs lasting a long time so we plan on keeping this as our main TV for many years.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I purchased this TV to replace the one in my bedroom that died, which was a Samsung. I've been team Samsung for years, but my brother convinced me to get an LG and I'm very pleased with this purchase. I was able to adjust the picture exactly as I wanted it, and the blacks are really black (this can be adjusted if it's too dark or too light). The remote takes some getting used to, but it's not bad. The sound from the speakers is also pretty decent, but I do use a sound bar. If you are looking for a good LG TV on a budget, I would definitely recommend buying this one.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviewList.review: So, when connecting an Xbox and setting it to 1080p you can get 120fps. The game mode on the TV also saw it as 120 fps, now that surprised me since this TV is only supposed to do 60hz maximum. I was pretty happy, but sadly anything else is stuck to 60hz. I use it mainly for Xbox and PC with colors and clarity being top notch. It's bright, vibrant, speakers are ehh. Control is nice I haven't accidentally pressed anything on it so far. I have no complaints it is an excellent tv.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviewList.review: I really love this television. It fit perfectly in my living room. The quality of the picture is beautiful. It’s shows very clear. And was also easy to set up. It does recommend mounting but also came with stands to hold up the television. Set up was very easy. It was easy to set up all the applications for the television. I really love this. The sound quality is great. Really high quality. Definitely recommend.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture, clunky remote, and cluttered interface
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
Overall, if you are someone who likes to edit lots of the system settings and prefer image quality over simplification, this would be a good upper middle tier TV for you. However, I prefer convenience.

Unboxing:
-This was easy to take out of the box with just 1 person.
-The legs attached easily, and I appreciated the cable organizer that comes with it to add on the back.

Setup:
-Overall the setup of the TV was straightforward and you can easily follow the on-screen prompts. It started with a voice prompt setup that you can turn off, which spoke incredibly fast but it was intended for visually impaired individuals, which you can turn off.
-It’s easy to sign in to apps using either the tv, your phone, or a laptop.
-I did run into a problem during the initial bootup where I got a spinning circle of death. After waiting 25 minutes, I rebooted the TV and had to restart the setup from the beginning. Overall, including logging in all my apps, it probably took about 30 minutes.

Remote:
-They tried to do too much with the remote causing a lot of daily frustration.
-My main concern is the “enter” or “ok” button in the middle of the arrows. It also acts as a scrolling ball, but many times when you push down for “ok” it ends up scrolling to another part of the page. It is very sensitive.
-The remote has a motion control function which acts like a mouse and pointer but the arrow on the tv lingers too long after use and I find it to be distracting on the screen until it disappears by itself.
-I also found the remote to be too old school with numbers for channels and buttons for almost everything you can imagine. I prefer the minimal and sleek remotes that come with many new TVs. This LG remote is about double the size and requires AA batteries instead of AAA.

Homepage:
-I am used to a very simplified homepage with roku where almost everything can be modified. This has all the bells and whistles, which provides plenty of options, but looks crowded and congested. Half the screen of the homepage is a giant ad for a streaming service I don’t use.

Screen quality:
-I had a 5 year old 55 inch TCL tv that I got for about $350. In my opinion, the picture quality of this LG TV is just slightly better. It has bright colors and people look a bit sharper in movies, but I wouldn’t say it’s worth the price difference from my old tv.
-The screen has a standard amount of glare. I have a window on the opposite wall of the tv which reflects light in the morning. The window reflection is very visible especially when the screen is dark.

Gaming:
-I have a nintendo switch I use to play games. The TV immediately suggests a gaming mode for best results. It has an easy to use gaming features to adjust setting quickly specifically for gaming.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was repairing my room to replace my old plasma tv with this one. Once it got delivered I took down my old TV and set up this one with my TV mounts that fit perfectly and mounted it. When I tired to turn it on nothing happened. I figured maybe I didn't plug in the power cable in correctly. After several attempts the TV turned on but the screen showed a bunch of lines across the entire screen before flickering in and out and then never powered on again.

I tried reaching to Amazon to see if maybe I got a broken and malfunction unit but according to them because it's a large electrical item they would need to send a technician out to verify if it can be repaired or replaced. I haven't heard anything from them since and put up my old TV and threw this in the trash.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviewList.review: This TV is so great to look at- the picture and video quality is gorgeous, you just need to have the right settings. This is perfect if you’re looking for a budget TV slightly higher than base models for casual viewing such as netflix, and light single player games since you don’t really need a 120hz TV if you’re not into competitive gaming so even though this can only run at 60hz, this is already good enough and enjoyable. LG is a very reputable brand, thus not just giving high quality TV, but also a manageable webOS. I wouldn’t say it’s blazing fast, but more in like ok for most people. As for the sound quality, it’s fine for normal circumstances but if you want the best cinema experience, then you need to get an external speaker. The package also came with very minor damage underneath the TV but I don’t really mind since you can barely notice it and it doesn’t affect the functionality. The price also was very competitive, much cheaper than in stores, so I’m very happy with my purchase since I also prefer LG TV’s over other brands.

Picture quality is great here. For the price point, this 4KUHD is a great option. Glad I purchased it. The interface is fine but I use the fire stick so I’ll stick with that. reviewList.review: I am very partial to LG televisions. I just never have issues when I buy them and this TV is no exception. I bought this for my bedroom. The picture is great and the TV looks very nice. Setup was easy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
I have 5 other LG tv's of various size and age. They all have a great picture as well as good sound. I even have a 65" like the one I just purchased, but several years old.
Picture quality is fine, but the sound is not good at all. Sounds tinny and hollow, unlike all of my other LG's that sound great even without a sound bar.
I broke down and purchased a LG 3.1 soundbar which makes it better but still not what it should be or as good as the older ones I have.
Overall, I like the TV and the picture is fine, remote is a little marginal, but the sound is poor in comparison.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this TV for my wife's home office. She uses the set in a moderately bright room, and the television image is never washed out because of ambient light The picture is bright and clear, and the operating system functions smoothly. I have an LG QNED 90 in my living room, and this set comes very close to that set's mini-LED picture quality. The TV upscales SD content very well. I recommend this set over some of the less expensive offerings from other brands.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviewList.review:
I have my own smart devices I use externally (like a windows pc for media stuff, roku, etc). I'm not using any of the built in "smart" features.

When I first got it I looked around the menus and yeah, they are slow/sluggish (os issue?). But using it as a "dumb" tv (with wifi disabled), works great. Powers on very fast, powers off just as fast. Looks beautiful.

The little built in speakers sound about how you'd expect, so get a sound bar with it if you want fuller/louder sound.

Overall very happy with this, and the price is very fair.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Wait for the price to drop!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviewList.review:
I've barely gotten it out of the box and it is now listed here for $30 less than I paid for it. I overpaid - you shouldn't!

The TV itself feels about average for this size. The picture is good, but not insanely great. The remote is unnecessarily complex - it has a point-to-move-the-cursor feature that works for some things and not others, even within LG's operating system functions, but the only "OK" button is also the wheel that activates the cursor. The OTA tuner picks up 10% fewer channels than the cheap Insignia it is replacing. The audio is tinny so I'll have to find a way to wedge in some kind of sound bar.

The box and the TV itself all have "New for 2023" language on them but I really can't find a practical difference between this and the older model.

Overall, meh, but I overpaid for meh!

reviewList.review:
My LG UH[some digits I don't remember right now] 55" 2016 tv got a line earlier this year (but it feels prepandemic) so I got this in 65".

When things are tragic you just need a magic...remote. I love the remote. The pointer also works with every USB mouse I tried. User tip: user your wrist not elbows and shoulders to operate it best. It's a want. You can do it Harry.

I notice and appreciate the step up in size and im satisfied with the picture quality but Im not a turtle. The responsiveness of the user interface is frustratingly slo... but it also does more things to be fair. Here is the "w" you were waiting for.

The simple home popup in 2016 I preferred. The new full screen home takes long to open (2- 5 seconds) AND apps will not be where you left off when you to return them. They use to.

The screen off feature doesn't work in some aps. It use to.

My room is dark and I watch more tv than report to work.

reviewList.review:
At the time of purchaseing this tv there was only 1 review, and at a lower price, but after extensive research and owning the slightly smaller 75in version of this LG smart tv that I've been completely satisfied with and is only a yesr old. I decided this 86in would fit my needs then would use the 75in in another room in the house..
Let's start from delivery to unboxing then set up where flawless, can't believe the negative reviews or being damaged apon deliverey. I personally can't say anything bad about this tv its packed with features and a good detailed clear picture just go into settings and fine tune the picture settings ect. And you won't be disappointed.. also when watching the LG channels the movies are super clear and detailed just as expected... oh yeah did I mention football games look great too just make sure the settings for sports are tailored to your liking. Like smooth motion mode works great for sports.. just make sure you have good cables when connecting this tv so you get the most from it.. I currently have good HDMI cables and running FIBER OPTIC from the tv through my klipsch home theater system. Even Bluetooth/ wifi work with no problems.. bottom line don't cheap out when hooking your tv up... Updated with a short video showing just how good the picture is! Go steelers 😃
Update a month after having time to enjoy this tv its better than expected! At the time of the first review there where only1 review now there's 26, alot of broken apon deliverey and others having issues.. so far no issues here and can't stress how good this tv is really is ! It's a shame there are so many broken or unhappy people out there! When buying anything on Amazon i always check out the reviews before I decide on purchasing, but when it comes to this monster of a tv trust the positive reviews! It definitely has a stunning 4k quality picture like I said in the beginning use quality cables or fiber optics..
FYI: having only an antenna when watching your local stations actually
Brodcast clear as streaming movies through wifi or Bluetooth!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviewList.review: I love this TV, it's like being in a movie theater. It has wonderful sound and picture.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
reviewList.review: Light bleeding and shadows on the screen make it impossible to view anything. Got this at Bestbuy and they refused to help me. Contacted LG for service and they too refused to help. LG referred me to a local service center only to find out that service center also refused to help by saying they did not have the man power to handle this TV size. I was given the ru around every time by everyone. I will stay away from LG products from now on. Samsung is best.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
reviewList.review: Great tv. Was kinda hard to mount on the wall but with 3 people we got it done. Only had it a few days but so far so good

reviewList.reviewTitle: Wow this is a amazing tv!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
reviewList.review: We got this in an 86 inch and mounted it on the wall and it looks AMAZING! Great price, beautiful picture. Amazon delivered it quickly and this tv has it all! Alexa, Bluetooth and many other awesome features

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great picture, great size, great function great TV!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2022
reviewList.review: I’ve had this TV about a week and it works perfect. It arrived much sooner than expected and was delivered right into my garage by straight truck delivery in perfect condition. This thing is massive, has great picture quality and the 120hz refesh rate is a very noticeable improvement compared to my previous 60hz Vizio. It’s a heavy, sturdy and well made tv. The remote seems on the cheaper side but works fine. The smart features are adequate, fast and what I expected any new smart tv to have. I paid $1000 for it and it’s worth every Penny. If any problems occur or my opinion changes in the next couple years I will update this review accordingly. Enjoy because I know I will!!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2022
reviewList.review:
Purchased to upgrade an aging LG 65" TV that we moved to another room. Looked at a 75" and 86" TV before selecting the LG 86". We are extremely happy with the size and quality! We sit approximately 10 feet front front and have chairs up to 45 degree angle off each side. All seats have a good viewing angle. Room has a lot of light from big windows. During day there is reflection from sun. Picture powers through the sun and we can still watch just fine. Every TV on the market would get a similar glare in our home. We can still watch TV.

Our family does not use the TV for gaming or sports. The 120hz true motion is excellent on action movies. Colors are beautiful. Blacks are not grey; black and white backgrounds look good.

At 100 pounds you need two people to install the TV on a wall. Recommend two for unboxing and placing on a table mount if not wall hanging.

We do not use built-in LG TV smart features. Our use involves a roku, bluray, and over the air antenna. We stream through roku and love the experience. Also added a soundbar to fill room with sound that provided a theater experience. Highly recommend a soundbar with subwoofer. Rear speakers are a nice touch, although not required for a good sound experience.

TV is highly recommended. Put in place, connect sound system, warm a bowl of popcorn, turn out the lights and enjoy a movie...

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2022
reviewList.review: Only have had it for a few days, but its quality is great. totally worth $999.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review:
I did not really think TV picture could get "better". This one as soon as I hooked it up at first the picture seemed "off", like fake. Don't know how to describe it. After a few I realized what was going on was it seemed more like I was watching things going on through a window they looked so "real". That's why at first it seemed "off". I was going to let Wife pic out a sound bar next. We will get a Surround Sound at some time but the built in has options to make it also sound amazing. Shockingly nice for so little money all the way around.
Remote is kind of "odd", but I had already ordered a better one made for this TV. Just put batteries in it and it is already programed to the TV.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Nice TV for an unbeatable price.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review: The shipping took about a week but the company that delivered it handled it with care and consideration. It came ready to go out of the box and fit nicely on our universal tv mount. This model does not come with the remote wand and my husband constantly has trouble with the back button being right next to one of the arrow buttons and hates it. But really that’s just a personal problem. LG throws in 100+ preloaded free channels on top of the AI settings and amazing picture quality. This TV is a great choice for your next upgrade.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
TV is great quality and user friendly, image great very clear, sound is really good however a I added a small sound bar to it, the size was perfect for my bedroom it easy to mount on the wall as TV is not that heavy, the only thing I don’t like from it, it’s the remote control that comes with it, it is very simple and cheaply made, the tv WebOS is modern but in order to get the best of it, it is advisable to get the LG magic remote to get the best of it, with the magic remote you are able to control all the devices with just that remote, including external sound bar and cable box, regardless of the way it is connected to the TV, wheeler be thru HDMI or digital out, overall this a decent, good and affordable Tav to upgrade your bedroom, or kids TV, you won’t be disappointed.

CJ,

reviewList.review: It doesn't have the fastest processor but it has unbeatable image quality in this price range. I suggest playing around with settings, default ones might not be the best for most people. I have anything and everything I want to have on a smart TV.

Amazon refused to take it back or replace it to contact the seller. I contact LG they say I have to talk to Amazon. They won’t even provide warranty support. Beware LG!!!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Glorious, too big for a desk
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviewList.review: so it's heavy, if you are going to wall mount it, bring a friend; I managed to wall mount it by getting one of the brackets hooked, and then lifting the TV onto the other bracket. quality is TOPS, image is perfect, I am using it as a computer monitor. I warn that this is too big for a desktop, the viewing angle at just two feet is not ideal, I see some darkness in the edges and corners, if I step away, the image becomes perfect. There is an awesome audio setting that bumps up voices in movies, I was watching Underworld and all the voices are soft and the action is loud, chose this setting and all the voice levels were corrected! Have to say I love it

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviewList.review: Picture is good, price is good, but as an owner of a higher model LG, I am very disappointed in the speed of the TV OS. Button presses are delayed and it seems like the TV is always catching up to my navigation. Once I'm watching something it's not an issue but often aggravating to wait on the delays.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024

I’ve been playing with the setting for two days. I like the video quality and colors, audio quality, its functions, and the size. It had a video delay in streaming videos, but I found a function in settings to match the video and audio.
I reckon the quality of the product is in accordance with the price.

The remote that came with it was both poorly laid out, hard to use and didn't have any ability for voice control. I spent an extra $35 for an upgraded remote control.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review:
So everyone complains about sound on a led flat screen. Let’s be honest if you get any flat screen tv for the sound you’re not too smart of a consumer. They are meant for picture. Sound here is actually decent. But let’s be real. Get a sound bar set up. I got the Vizio 5.1 surround sound unit with wireless subwoofer and it works perfectly with this tv.
Picture quality is great here. For the price point, this 4KUHD is a great option. Glad I purchased it. The interface is fine but I use the fire stick so I’ll stick with that. No issues with refresh rate in sports, wrestling, movies or games. Now a SONY 4k tv was what I wanted, but at the same size Sony wanted 300-$400 more and I just didn’t see the need to spend that. Especially when this one was a 4K tv at a price that made more sense. I purchased the 50 inch

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviewList.review: Easy setup and installation. Good color and picture for the price.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviewList.review: I am very partial to LG televisions. I just never have issues when I buy them and this TV is no exception. I bought this for my bedroom. The picture is great and the TV looks very nice. Setup was easy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
I have 5 other LG tv's of various size and age. They all have a great picture as well as good sound. I even have a 65" like the one I just purchased, but several years old.
Picture quality is fine, but the sound is not good at all. Sounds tinny and hollow, unlike all of my other LG's that sound great even without a sound bar.
I broke down and purchased a LG 3.1 soundbar which makes it better but still not what it should be or as good as the older ones I have.
Overall, I like the TV and the picture is fine, remote is a little marginal, but the sound is poor in comparison.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this TV for my wife's home office. She uses the set in a moderately bright room, and the television image is never washed out because of ambient light The picture is bright and clear, and the operating system functions smoothly. I have an LG QNED 90 in my living room, and this set comes very close to that set's mini-LED picture quality. The TV upscales SD content very well. I recommend this set over some of the less expensive offerings from other brands.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviewList.review:
I have my own smart devices I use externally (like a windows pc for media stuff, roku, etc). I'm not using any of the built in "smart" features.

When I first got it I looked around the menus and yeah, they are slow/sluggish (os issue?). But using it as a "dumb" tv (with wifi disabled), works great. Powers on very fast, powers off just as fast. Looks beautiful.

The little built in speakers sound about how you'd expect, so get a sound bar with it if you want fuller/louder sound.

Overall very happy with this, and the price is very fair.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Wait for the price to drop!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviewList.review:
I've barely gotten it out of the box and it is now listed here for $30 less than I paid for it. I overpaid - you shouldn't!

The TV itself feels about average for this size. The picture is good, but not insanely great. The remote is unnecessarily complex - it has a point-to-move-the-cursor feature that works for some things and not others, even within LG's operating system functions, but the only "OK" button is also the wheel that activates the cursor. The OTA tuner picks up 10% fewer channels than the cheap Insignia it is replacing. The audio is tinny so I'll have to find a way to wedge in some kind of sound bar.

The box and the TV itself all have "New for 2023" language on them but I really can't find a practical difference between this and the older model.

Overall, meh, but I overpaid for meh!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviewList.review: Great TV, easy for one person to put the legs on thanks to thoughtful packaging.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review: slight amount of damage to outer box, but everything inside was ok. delivery driver still not able to put items on front covered porch. what is so hard about this. can they not follow instructions, or just cant read, or are lazy. when weather is bad items get wet

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
My LG UH[some digits I don't remember right now] 55" 2016 tv got a line earlier this year (but it feels prepandemic) so I got this in 65".

When things are tragic you just need a magic...remote. I love the remote. The pointer also works with every USB mouse I tried. User tip: user your wrist not elbows and shoulders to operate it best. It's a want. You can do it Harry.

I notice and appreciate the step up in size and im satisfied with the picture quality but Im not a turtle. The responsiveness of the user interface is frustratingly slo... but it also does more things to be fair. Here is the "w" you were waiting for.

The simple home popup in 2016 I preferred. The new full screen home takes long to open (2- 5 seconds) AND apps will not be where you left off when you to return them. They use to.

The screen off feature doesn't work in some aps. It use to.

My room is dark and I watch more tv than report to work.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviewList.review:
So everyone complains about sound on a led flat screen. Let’s be honest if you get any flat screen tv for the sound you’re not too smart of a consumer. They are meant for picture. Sound here is actually decent. But let’s be real. Get a sound bar set up. I got the Vizio 5.1 surround sound unit with wireless subwoofer and it works perfectly with this tv.
Picture quality is great here. For the price point, this 4KUHD is a great option. Glad I purchased it. The interface is fine but I use the fire stick so I’ll stick with that. No issues with refresh rate in sports, wrestling, movies or games. Now a SONY 4k tv was what I wanted, but at the same size Sony wanted 300-$400 more and I just didn’t see the need to spend that. Especially when this one was a 4K tv at a price that made more sense. I purchased the 50 inch

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviewList.review: Easy setup and installation. Good color and picture for the price.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviewList.review: I am very partial to LG televisions. I just never have issues when I buy them and this TV is no exception. I bought this for my bedroom. The picture is great and the TV looks very nice. Setup was easy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviewList.review:
I have 5 other LG tv's of various size and age. They all have a great picture as well as good sound. I even have a 65" like the one I just purchased, but several years old.
Picture quality is fine, but the sound is not good at all. Sounds tinny and hollow, unlike all of my other LG's that sound great even without a sound bar.
I broke down and purchased a LG 3.1 soundbar which makes it better but still not what it should be or as good as the older ones I have.
Overall, I like the TV and the picture is fine, remote is a little marginal, but the sound is poor in comparison.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I bought this TV for my wife's home office. She uses the set in a moderately bright room, and the television image is never washed out because of ambient light The picture is bright and clear, and the operating system functions smoothly. I have an LG QNED 90 in my living room, and this set comes very close to that set's mini-LED picture quality. The TV upscales SD content very well. I recommend this set over some of the less expensive offerings from other brands.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviewList.review:
I have my own smart devices I use externally (like a windows pc for media stuff, roku, etc). I'm not using any of the built in "smart" features.

When I first got it I looked around the menus and yeah, they are slow/sluggish (os issue?). But using it as a "dumb" tv (with wifi disabled), works great. Powers on very fast, powers off just as fast. Looks beautiful.

The little built in speakers sound about how you'd expect, so get a sound bar with it if you want fuller/louder sound.

Overall very happy with this, and the price is very fair.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Wait for the price to drop!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviewList.review:
I've barely gotten it out of the box and it is now listed here for $30 less than I paid for it. I overpaid - you shouldn't!

The TV itself feels about average for this size. The picture is good, but not insanely great. The remote is unnecessarily complex - it has a point-to-move-the-cursor feature that works for some things and not others, even within LG's operating system functions, but the only "OK" button is also the wheel that activates the cursor. The OTA tuner picks up 10% fewer channels than the cheap Insignia it is replacing. The audio is tinny so I'll have to find a way to wedge in some kind of sound bar.

The box and the TV itself all have "New for 2023" language on them but I really can't find a practical difference between this and the older model.

Overall, meh, but I overpaid for meh!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviewList.review: Great TV, easy for one person to put the legs on thanks to thoughtful packaging.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review: slight amount of damage to outer box, but everything inside was ok. delivery driver still not able to put items on front covered porch. what is so hard about this. can they not follow instructions, or just cant read, or are lazy. when weather is bad items get wet

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
My LG UH[some digits I don't remember right now] 55" 2016 tv got a line earlier this year (but it feels prepandemic) so I got this in 65".

When things are tragic you just need a magic...remote. I love the remote. The pointer also works with every USB mouse I tried. User tip: user your wrist not elbows and shoulders to operate it best. It's a want. You can do it Harry.

I notice and appreciate the step up in size and im satisfied with the picture quality but Im not a turtle. The responsiveness of the user interface is frustratingly slo... but it also does more things to be fair. Here is the "w" you were waiting for.

The simple home popup in 2016 I preferred. The new full screen home takes long to open (2- 5 seconds) AND apps will not be where you left off when you to return them. They use to.

The screen off feature doesn't work in some aps. It use to.

My room is dark and I watch more tv than report to work.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Beautiful picture and excellent smart features
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviewList.review: New upstairs TV. A perfect 43 “ inch TV

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviewList.review: While there are options out there for a much more advanced and sophisticated viewing experience. You cannot beat the size for the price of this smart TV. Easy installation and set up. Really happy with this buy.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviewList.review:
Unfortunately our TV arrived with screen damage. The reseller, Modia, located in Texas, responded right away. It was late in the evening but they responded quickly in letting us know what we needed to do to get a return started with Amazon.
The 98 inch Samsung TV is a huge TV and weighs in at over 150 pounds. Modia arranged a pickup with sufficient manpower to handle the TV.
We did wind up buying the TV again. The picture is stunning compared to the previous DLP TV we had. We would definitely buy again from Modia. They provided awesome service every step of the way.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great TV and was delivered on time.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review: I liked that it came on time and is a great TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviewList.review: Pulled it out of the box using 3 people to ensure safety of the T.V. Plugged it in before doing anything else and the power indicator turns red so the TV has power, but no picture would display on the screen and it would stay black/blank. I tried everything in the book, unplugging appliances, plugging it in a new outlet, tested the original outlet where the TV would go, used an extension cord, tried all the troubleshooting steps, checking the circuit breakers, you name it. Super frustrating waiting a week and planning a time to be home to sign for the TV just for it to not work 1 hour of it arriving to my home. Sat on the phone with amazon for 47 minutes to be put on hold for 40 of those minutes and then get hung up on. I call a second time and again, I get put on hold for 32 minutes and then finally get routed to a person that was able to help me. The replacement will take another week to get here so I’ll update this review if the next TV works.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewList.review: First, I highly recommend you plug in this tv and turn it on before installing the stand and moving it to where you want it to live. The first tv we received had an extremely damaged screen. We plugged it in, it came on, and the screen looked shattered once turned on. We couldn’t see anything. You couldn’t see this until the tv was turned on as the actual physical screen looked perfect. Something was wrong inside. We had to repackage the huge tv and take it to the UPS store to return it. Had a replacement sent. We plugged this one in first and thankfully it came on perfectly. This is the largest tv we have ever owned, and it’s amazing how we can see details we never could before on our smaller tv. While it’s not the largest tv, it’s quite large for us. Plenty large. Makes things easier to see for my nearsighted eyes. Very pleased so far. Easy to add all of our streaming apps. It keeps asking us to connect to our wifi, and our old tv never did that, so hopefully that won’t be an ongoing issue. Overall, this is a super nice tv!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Picture quality no so great, but loaded with features
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was replacing a 12 year old 65" LG Plasma TV which had THX certified Cinema Mode. I expected this TV to have better picture quality since technology has improved since, but was disappointed. The default colors were quite light and I had to play around with the color/picture controls manually to make them better. Brightness was also too high by default.

Unless you sign up for a Samsung account, calibration capabilities with a mobile phone are not available. So finally I signed up for a Samsung account and then tried to calibrate with an S23 mobile phone. The result was a better picture, but not as good as the older plasma one.

Of course there are quite a number of other features that comes with the TV, like apps, webcam addition, using your mobile phone camera, fireTV remote emulation, 4K streaming, embedded manuals and such... These are appreciated, but the primary use case is picture quality, where it did not quite meet the THX Cinema quality of the earlier plasma model.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviewList.review: Excellent picture quality and very easy to set up.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
Wow! This is an incredible television. Amazon Delivery made this day even more special with an above and beyond delivery. Downside, it took 4 resets to get all features to work properly.. First reset, could not get close caption to reset, second reset, no sound, third reset, YouTube tv not working, forth and final reset, could not get Peacocktv to download.
Learning curve, MAYBE!
What would have made it program easier would have been a step.by.step guide.
When all programmed and done, just perfect.
Suggest turning intelligent mode off to select desired picture display. Dynamic setting worked best for us. Display had to auto adjust to room lighting.
Overall, a magical day!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is nice, but don't turn it off. I turn it off when I go up to bed, every morning it wont turn on. It will eventually turn. Found these steps to try
- Unplug for 30 seconds (if this doesnt work then...)
- Unplug and hold the reset button for a minute under the Samsung insignia on bottom of tv
This probably wont work on first try but keep repeating the steps and youll probably get lucky after 3 or 4 tries.

A real headache!!!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Menu options say not available but don’t tell you why…
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviewList.review: TV is great so far but I find some of the features a bit overwhelming to set. It reports some features are not currently available but doesn’t say why. I read the use manual for example on how to adjust the video screen setting for screen size but the screen size change option is still grayed out. I even tried some tricks found on YouTube and it didn’t work. Spending to much time trying to get the screen to full-size gives this product a 4. This day and age I should not be dealing with this menu option this long and hard.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Measure Twice! Great TV paired with Sanus Tilt Mount for 110"
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is great.

I paired it with the Sanus tilt mount, but dont make the same mistake I did and assume the mounting screws are centered vertically on the TV. I think they are offset by 3 inches, which by the grace of god still allowed me to mount this monster with millimeters of clearance.

Also for the Sanus mount I ended up having to use the 25mm M8 screws with a 5mm stand off as well as the included washer. So dont assume the 16mm M8 screws in the Sanus kit will fit, they were too short for me.

Samsung is a solid brand with app features to boot. If you dont care about built in app support, I suppose you could go even cheaper with the TCL 98" but for the extra grand it was worth it to me to get Samsung. I was between this and the Sony 100" which gets you 2 inches extra diagonal and Dolby Vision but it was also 3k more. Wasnt worth it to me.

If i were to splurge I'd go for the QN 90A 98" by Samsung. Unlimited cash I'd go with the 110" LG OLED.

The box is enormous. I had to unpack and get a friend to safely get it into the basement after removing the hand rails. So be mindful of delivery because if you're moving this to anywhere beyond a direct entryway, you may find yourself stuck.

The picture is what you would expect from an LED. There's a considerable difference with blooming/bleed in high contrast scenes, but I'm comparing to LG OLED, which is insanely better but also much more costly. Also the OLED suffers from screen burn. I have a roughly 7 year old LG 65" OLED that's been performing wonderfully to this day but now is showing signs of wear on images with a noticable split down the middle on darker images.

Over all Im happy with my purchase. If you have the extra cash go with the QN, otherwise this is a solis contender.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviewList.review:
All we have in our home are Samsung TVs. All different sizes and the one thing that irritates me the most is where the place power plug. This is another TV where it is on the OPPOSITE side from where all the other cords go. The power cord is short, which complicates putting it on the wall. Being on the opposite side of all the other cords, complicates putting them all behind the wall. The TV is incredible, but the power cord is ridiculously small and not in a good spot on the back.

I have 2 Samsung TV in my room. The other is a 52”. I prefer using it as my computer monitor. A top rated sci-fi movie just became available for purchase, so we got it to watch on the new TV, and it was incredible. The sound was EXCELLENT. The picture was BEAUTIFUL, CLEAR, and VIVID(See pictures). I like how the remote doesn’t require batteries but is solar-powered. It’s about time someone thought of that. The “SmartThings” app is an excellent idea, especially with having to sign in to all the streaming services. The app makes setting up the TV less frustrating.

The PRICE for this 55” inch OLED is in the usual range. It’s exactly as advertised.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2023
reviewList.review:
Easy set up, the picture is fantastic!!!

Attaching the base took a little to figure out. I prefer instructions w/words not pics!!

Otherwise, seamless setup connected to my over-the-air antenna & wifi easily. Added all my streaming Apps in a matter of minutes.

Big, clear picture with a setting that auto adjusts for the room lighting. Gorgeous hi-def display is unbeatable.
The sound is also amazing. I did not realize how much audio I was missing out on until I heard the speakers on this TV.

Really great TV for the price

Definitely recommend!!12/10

reviewList.reviewTitle: SAMSUNG 55-Inch Class QLED 4K Q80C Series Quantum HDR+, Dolby
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviewList.review: This TV was easy to set up and install all my accounts on. It has a great picture quality and a very large viewing screen. We are very happy with this TV

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
I replaced a 15 year old TV with this one. The difference in picture quality is tremendous. Set-up was super easy. I wall-mounted it using the same mount from the old set. I still like the app selection better from a Roku (this doesn't have the NCAA March Madness app, for example) so will still use my Roku with this TV.

I also use an antenna for local channels. I love the channel guide that shows my channels and what is playing on each channel.

One other thing that I love is that you can do a split screen and have two inputs show at the same time. So I could use my Roku to watch one game on March Madness and another screen to watch another game on my antenna! You can do picture-in-picture or side-by-side and chose the size of the main screen.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviewList.review: Amazing TV. Was really easy to set up and get started. Picture and color quality is top tier.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviewList.review: We ordered this tv to replace a 49" one we had hanging in our living room. The tv is very well packaged and was easy to remove. It comes with a stand, however we wanted to reuse our old mount. The mount fit, however the screws didnt so we had to buy a pack of different size and lengths of M8 screws and find a size that fit. The cord for the TV is really nice and small so it is easy to fit on our power strip. The remote is so cool! It is solar powered and really high tech. We're still figuring this tv out even though it is very user friendly, there is just so much do do on it! Quality is out of this world amazing, like you will see pimples and gross skin daily good lol.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviewList.review: Comes with amazing apps, awesome picture quality and very easy to set up and use. Highly recommended

reviewList.reviewTitle: Sleek profile, 4, 2.1 hdmi inputs great picture !
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2023
reviewList.review: Love the sleek profile , both bezeless, and thin. Bright images and rich color. Lots of speaker power and good volume. Works with multiple smart assistants, has ambient mode, and a solar powered remote. Great adjustments for picture and sound. Good smart features, just wish AirPlay settings were easier to get to ok the fly. Shipping was fast and easy . No complaints overall and a solid buy .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewList.review: The Samsung QLED 55 inch television certainly lives up to its name. The picture is sharp and the colors are brilliant. I don't think you can find a more extraordinary television. The set up is simple and very easy to do. It is not over weight so it's easy to handle. It goes above and beyond my wildest expectations.

Now the police gave me a ticket because the TV does not shut off after Sunset and I'm bothering the turtles on the beach! What is the use of having a smart house when it's so dumb?
