reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviewList.review:
Unfortunately our TV arrived with screen damage. The reseller, Modia, located in Texas, responded right away. It was late in the evening but they responded quickly in letting us know what we needed to do to get a return started with Amazon.
The 98 inch Samsung TV is a huge TV and weighs in at over 150 pounds. Modia arranged a pickup with sufficient manpower to handle the TV.
We did wind up buying the TV again. The picture is stunning compared to the previous DLP TV we had. We would definitely buy again from Modia. They provided awesome service every step of the way.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great TV and was delivered on time.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review: I liked that it came on time and is a great TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviewList.review: Pulled it out of the box using 3 people to ensure safety of the T.V. Plugged it in before doing anything else and the power indicator turns red so the TV has power, but no picture would display on the screen and it would stay black/blank. I tried everything in the book, unplugging appliances, plugging it in a new outlet, tested the original outlet where the TV would go, used an extension cord, tried all the troubleshooting steps, checking the circuit breakers, you name it. Super frustrating waiting a week and planning a time to be home to sign for the TV just for it to not work 1 hour of it arriving to my home. Sat on the phone with amazon for 47 minutes to be put on hold for 40 of those minutes and then get hung up on. I call a second time and again, I get put on hold for 32 minutes and then finally get routed to a person that was able to help me. The replacement will take another week to get here so I’ll update this review if the next TV works.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewList.review: First, I highly recommend you plug in this tv and turn it on before installing the stand and moving it to where you want it to live. The first tv we received had an extremely damaged screen. We plugged it in, it came on, and the screen looked shattered once turned on. We couldn’t see anything. You couldn’t see this until the tv was turned on as the actual physical screen looked perfect. Something was wrong inside. We had to repackage the huge tv and take it to the UPS store to return it. Had a replacement sent. We plugged this one in first and thankfully it came on perfectly. This is the largest tv we have ever owned, and it’s amazing how we can see details we never could before on our smaller tv. While it’s not the largest tv, it’s quite large for us. Plenty large. Makes things easier to see for my nearsighted eyes. Very pleased so far. Easy to add all of our streaming apps. It keeps asking us to connect to our wifi, and our old tv never did that, so hopefully that won’t be an ongoing issue. Overall, this is a super nice tv!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Picture quality no so great, but loaded with features
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was replacing a 12 year old 65" LG Plasma TV which had THX certified Cinema Mode. I expected this TV to have better picture quality since technology has improved since, but was disappointed. The default colors were quite light and I had to play around with the color/picture controls manually to make them better. Brightness was also too high by default.

Unless you sign up for a Samsung account, calibration capabilities with a mobile phone are not available. So finally I signed up for a Samsung account and then tried to calibrate with an S23 mobile phone. The result was a better picture, but not as good as the older plasma one.

Of course there are quite a number of other features that comes with the TV, like apps, webcam addition, using your mobile phone camera, fireTV remote emulation, 4K streaming, embedded manuals and such... These are appreciated, but the primary use case is picture quality, where it did not quite meet the THX Cinema quality of the earlier plasma model.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviewList.review: Excellent picture quality and very easy to set up.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
Wow! This is an incredible television. Amazon Delivery made this day even more special with an above and beyond delivery. Downside, it took 4 resets to get all features to work properly.. First reset, could not get close caption to reset, second reset, no sound, third reset, YouTube tv not working, forth and final reset, could not get Peacocktv to download.
Learning curve, MAYBE!
What would have made it program easier would have been a step.by.step guide.
When all programmed and done, just perfect.
Suggest turning intelligent mode off to select desired picture display. Dynamic setting worked best for us. Display had to auto adjust to room lighting.
Overall, a magical day!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is nice, but don't turn it off. I turn it off when I go up to bed, every morning it wont turn on. It will eventually turn. Found these steps to try
- Unplug for 30 seconds (if this doesnt work then...)
- Unplug and hold the reset button for a minute under the Samsung insignia on bottom of tv
This probably wont work on first try but keep repeating the steps and youll probably get lucky after 3 or 4 tries.

A real headache!!!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Menu options say not available but don’t tell you why…
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviewList.review: TV is great so far but I find some of the features a bit overwhelming to set. It reports some features are not currently available but doesn’t say why. I read the use manual for example on how to adjust the video screen setting for screen size but the screen size change option is still grayed out. I even tried some tricks found on YouTube and it didn’t work. Spending to much time trying to get the screen to full-size gives this product a 4. This day and age I should not be dealing with this menu option this long and hard.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Measure Twice! Great TV paired with Sanus Tilt Mount for 110"
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is great.

I paired it with the Sanus tilt mount, but dont make the same mistake I did and assume the mounting screws are centered vertically on the TV. I think they are offset by 3 inches, which by the grace of god still allowed me to mount this monster with millimeters of clearance.

Also for the Sanus mount I ended up having to use the 25mm M8 screws with a 5mm stand off as well as the included washer. So dont assume the 16mm M8 screws in the Sanus kit will fit, they were too short for me.

Samsung is a solid brand with app features to boot. If you dont care about built in app support, I suppose you could go even cheaper with the TCL 98" but for the extra grand it was worth it to me to get Samsung. I was between this and the Sony 100" which gets you 2 inches extra diagonal and Dolby Vision but it was also 3k more. Wasnt worth it to me.

If i were to splurge I'd go for the QN 90A 98" by Samsung. Unlimited cash I'd go with the 110" LG OLED.

The box is enormous. I had to unpack and get a friend to safely get it into the basement after removing the hand rails. So be mindful of delivery because if you're moving this to anywhere beyond a direct entryway, you may find yourself stuck.

The picture is what you would expect from an LED. There's a considerable difference with blooming/bleed in high contrast scenes, but I'm comparing to LG OLED, which is insanely better but also much more costly. Also the OLED suffers from screen burn. I have a roughly 7 year old LG 65" OLED that's been performing wonderfully to this day but now is showing signs of wear on images with a noticable split down the middle on darker images.

Over all Im happy with my purchase. If you have the extra cash go with the QN, otherwise this is a solis contender.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Packed With Many Features, it's like a Swiss Army Knife For Your Entertainment Center.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviewList.review:
Samsung has always been one of the leading names in the electronics industry, and their latest offering, the Samsung 55-Inch Class QLED 4K Q80C Series modrl, is no exception. This television is an exceptional piece of technology, and I was lucky enough to get my hands on one to review. Not only is it packed with top-of-the-line features, but it also manages to be incredibly beautiful. In this review, I’ll be taking a closer look at the Samsung Q80C and telling you all about its features and the clever way they’ve been implemented.

//Design:

Let’s start with the design. The Samsung Q80C is an absolute stunner. It has a sleek, modern design that would look great in any living room. The television is very slim, and the bezels are almost nonexistent. This means that you get an almost edge-to-edge display, which is perfect for a more immersive viewing experience.

But the best part about the design is the way it’s been implemented with the Q80C’s Smart TV features. The television’s design is so sleek and seamless that it feels like the entire TV is one big Smart Hub. The Q80C’s Smart TV features are so intuitive that you’ll never want to go back to a regular remote. The remote is even designed to look like a gaming controller, which is a hilarious nod to the fact that this TV is great for gaming.

//Display:

Moving on to the display, the Samsung Q80C features a 55-inch QLED display with a resolution of 4K. This means that you’re getting an incredibly sharp and detailed picture. The colors are vivid and bright, and the blacks are deep and dark. The QLED technology also means that the TV has a very high contrast ratio, which is great for watching movies and TV shows with a lot of dark scenes.

But what really sets the Samsung Q80C apart from other televisions is the Quantum HDR+ technology. This technology uses a combination of HDR10+ and HLG (Hybrid Log-Gamma) to produce an even wider range of colors and brightness levels. This means that the TV is able to display more realistic colors, which is especially noticeable in nature documentaries and other shows with lots of bright colors. And once again, Samsung manages to inject humor into their technology by making the Q80C’s picture so vivid that it’s almost like you’re actually there.

//Sound:

The sound on the Samsung Q80C is also something special. The TV features Dolby Atmos Object Tracking Sound Lite, which is a mouthful to say but basically means that the TV is able to produce a more immersive and directional sound experience. This is especially noticeable when watching action movies or playing video games, where the sound can help you locate enemies or explosions.

But Samsung doesn’t stop there. They’ve also included Q-Symphony 3.0, which is a feature that allows the TV to work in sync with your soundbar or home theater system. This means that you can get even better sound quality without having to worry about syncing issues.

And once again, Samsung is injecting so much data into their technology by making the Q80C’s sound so immersive that it’s like you’re actually in the action. But they take it a step further by including a feature called “Object Tracking Sound Lite,” which sounds like something out of a science fiction movie.

//Gaming:

The Samsung Q80C is also great for gaming. The TV has a Game Mode, which reduces input lag and optimizes the picture fora better gaming experience. This means that you can play your favorite games without having to worry about lag or any visual issues.

But what really sets the Samsung Q80C apart for gamers is the Gaming Hub. This feature is a one-stop-shop for all your gaming needs. It allows you to access all your favorite gaming apps, like Twitch and Discord, without having to switch inputs or navigate through menus. This is a game-changer for gamers, as it makes it much easier to access everything you need to get your gaming fix.

The Q80C’s Game Mode so good that you’ll forget you’re not actually in the game. And the Gaming Hub is so convenient that you’ll never want to leave your couch.

//Smart TV Features:

The Samsung Q80C is also packed with Smart TV features. It has Alexa built-in, which means that you can control your TV with your voice. This is especially convenient for when you can’t find the remote or when you’re too lazy to get up off the couch.

But Samsung takes it a step further by making the Q80C’s Smart TV features so intuitive that you’ll feel like you’re living in the future. The TV’s Smart Hub allows you to easily access all your favorite apps and streaming services, and the OneRemote allows you to control all your devices with just one remote. Samsung’s Smart TV features are so seamless that you’ll never want to go back to a regular TV.

//Conclusion:

In conclusion, the Samsung 55-Inch Class QLED 4K Q80C Series, is an exceptional piece of technology. It’s packed with top-of-the-line features that make it great for everything from watching movies to playing video games. But what really sets the Q80C apart is the way that Samsung injects humor into their technology. They manage to make their features both informative and funny, which makes using the TV a joy.

The Q80C’s design is sleek and modern, and the display is incredibly sharp and vivid. The sound is immersive and directional, and the TV is great for gaming. The Smart TV features are intuitive and convenient, and Alexa built-in makes controlling your TV a breeze.

//Overall, the Q80C Series is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a great TV. It's got everything you could want in a TV, and it's sure to impress your friends and family.

----------------

If you made it this far through my review, then here's a funny story about the TV:

I was watching a movie on the TV, and I got so engrossed in the story that I forgot to turn on the subtitles. I didn't realize this until I heard a character say something that I didn't understand. I looked down at the TV and saw that the subtitles were turned off. I laughed out loud and said to myself, "I'm such an idiot."

I turned on the subtitles and continued watching the movie. I was able to understand everything that was being said, and I enjoyed the movie even more.

Moral of the story: Always turn on the subtitles when you're watching a movie on a TV. It will make your viewing experience much more enjoyable.. If you’re in the market for a new TV, I highly recommend checking out the Samsung Q80C, a television that's so packed with features, it's like a Swiss army knife for your entertainment center. You won’t be disappointed.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
Update:

The TV was delivered on March 27th, and on April 30th I noticed that the brightness of the screen started flickering while watching a BluRay.. Then, I went to bed and turned the TV off, got up the next morning and found that the TV would turn on, but I would get no screen.. I only use the TV about 12 hours a day at the most.. Some days, it may not even get turned on.. If I shined a flashlight onto the screen, I could make out the picture in the background, but it was like the light in the back of the TV went out.. I ended up getting help and they had me hold the power button down on the remote for a few seconds until the TV rebooted.. After I did, which took something like 5 or so seconds, the TV did reboot and is now working fine.. I guess it is because it gets a build up of static on the inside, and rebooting it discharges all that static.. I have never had a TV do this before, so this is a first for me.. If you have this problem too, then try this before you do anything else..

Original post: (with a few minor updates)

My first complaint, which I do not understand why it happened, but I tried to change channels once and when I did, it just came up with a big box in the middle of the screen that said scanning or something.. I had been using it for a while, so this was not just installed when it did this.. But it did this a couple of times in a row.. I went to the home menu screen, and then back, and it has never done that again.. Glitch?? I think I was on OTA TV at the time.. I never had the problem again after that (a month later)..

The picture viewing is good from all angles.. Some TV's the picture is not very good from the side, like not being able to view the screen at all, or the colors being really off.. This screen does not have any of those problems..

I think it would have been nice if there was more than 4 HDMI ports.. Me, surveillance system, Roku, Blu-ray player... That is 3 already.. Add in game systems, etc, and you can easily go up to over 4.. Especially when you consider that they took away all RCA, VGA, etc plugs.. You would think that they could put more HDMI on it..

I did notice that you can not use 2 HDMI ports at the same time.. What I mean by this is.. They have a split screen option, or picture in picture.. I have my surveillance system on one HDMI port, and my Blu-ray player on another.. If I tried to watch a Blu-ray while having the cameras going on the PIP, the screen and sound for the Blu-ray just go blank, but the surveillance will work fine.. But if I have OTA or Samsung+ TV going on the first screen, it will plat the Blu-ray or surveillance on the second picture or screen with no problem.. So using PIP is very limited..

Upon using it, to get to the Samsung menu, it is different between OTA TV and Samsung Plus internet channels.. You can get to the channel list by pressing straight down on the up/down button on the remote, no matter what channel you are watching.. But, you have to change the channel to one of the 1000+ channels to get to the Samsung plus menu.. Once you get to one of those internet channels, just hit the down button on the round button to get to this menu, and it will come up with "Live" or "Discover", and then hit down again.. Live will bring you to the same menu that you get by pressing straight down on the channel up/down button.. But if you move it over to Discover, it gives you a list of free movies and stuff that you can watch..

They should have this integrated so that you get this menu with all OTA channels along with the internet ones, just like how they have them both integrated into the menu list..

On the home screen, they automatically put anything new you add to the app list to the end of the line.. To move these icons to the front of the line, you have to hold the round button down on the remote for a couple of seconds.. It took me a little time to figure this out because I kept trying to go into the area that says "apps" to try and change the order.. I did not find anything in there about how to move the menu app icons around.. It would have been nice if at least, at first boot up, they gave you a little pop up menu top tell you this, or something.. Maybe have a section in the "Apps" area to move the icons order would have been OK too.. But nothing on either end made me waist a lot of time tying to figure out how to move the icons so what I wanted, the newly added ones, were not at the end of the line, but at the front.

On the internet samsung plus channels (1000+ channels), there is no way to tell what resolution that anything is in.. On the OTA channels, if you hit the round button it will tell you if it is SD or HD, and if you hold that same button down for a couple of seconds, it will tell you about the show and also tell you what resolution it is in.. 480i is usual for SD and either 720P or 1080i for HD.. But there is nothing for the 1000+ channels.. Why no consistency? Just to note.. Here, there is no OTA TV channels over 1080, so for just free OTA, if that is all you are watching, you probably will not notice any difference between a standard HD TV and a 4k TV.

I have not used the voice part at all, so no comment there. I also had did some changes, like to have it automatically start where I last left off..

Overall, it is a very nice TV, but it does have its little things that could be made better.. With the problem of the screen going on in just one month, and now knowing that this might be a constant, every so often problem, I am dropping the rating down to 3 stars for this reason.

reviewList.review: Pulled it out of the box using 3 people to ensure safety of the T.V. Plugged it in before doing anything else and the power indicator turns red so the TV has power, but no picture would display on the screen and it would stay black/blank. I tried everything in the book, unplugging appliances, plugging it in a new outlet, tested the original outlet where the TV would go, used an extension cord, tried all the troubleshooting steps, checking the circuit breakers, you name it. Super frustrating waiting a week and planning a time to be home to sign for the TV just for it to not work 1 hour of it arriving to my home. Sat on the phone with amazon for 47 minutes to be put on hold for 40 of those minutes and then get hung up on. I call a second time and again, I get put on hold for 32 minutes and then finally get routed to a person that was able to help me. The replacement will take another week to get here so I’ll update this review if the next TV works.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewList.review: First, I highly recommend you plug in this tv and turn it on before installing the stand and moving it to where you want it to live. The first tv we received had an extremely damaged screen. We plugged it in, it came on, and the screen looked shattered once turned on. We couldn’t see anything. You couldn’t see this until the tv was turned on as the actual physical screen looked perfect. Something was wrong inside. We had to repackage the huge tv and take it to the UPS store to return it. Had a replacement sent. We plugged this one in first and thankfully it came on perfectly. This is the largest tv we have ever owned, and it’s amazing how we can see details we never could before on our smaller tv. While it’s not the largest tv, it’s quite large for us. Plenty large. Makes things easier to see for my nearsighted eyes. Very pleased so far. Easy to add all of our streaming apps. It keeps asking us to connect to our wifi, and our old tv never did that, so hopefully that won’t be an ongoing issue. Overall, this is a super nice tv!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Picture quality no so great, but loaded with features
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was replacing a 12 year old 65" LG Plasma TV which had THX certified Cinema Mode. I expected this TV to have better picture quality since technology has improved since, but was disappointed. The default colors were quite light and I had to play around with the color/picture controls manually to make them better. Brightness was also too high by default.

Unless you sign up for a Samsung account, calibration capabilities with a mobile phone are not available. So finally I signed up for a Samsung account and then tried to calibrate with an S23 mobile phone. The result was a better picture, but not as good as the older plasma one.

Of course there are quite a number of other features that comes with the TV, like apps, webcam addition, using your mobile phone camera, fireTV remote emulation, 4K streaming, embedded manuals and such... These are appreciated, but the primary use case is picture quality, where it did not quite meet the THX Cinema quality of the earlier plasma model.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviewList.review: Excellent picture quality and very easy to set up.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
Wow! This is an incredible television. Amazon Delivery made this day even more special with an above and beyond delivery. Downside, it took 4 resets to get all features to work properly.. First reset, could not get close caption to reset, second reset, no sound, third reset, YouTube tv not working, forth and final reset, could not get Peacocktv to download.
Learning curve, MAYBE!
What would have made it program easier would have been a step.by.step guide.
When all programmed and done, just perfect.
Suggest turning intelligent mode off to select desired picture display. Dynamic setting worked best for us. Display had to auto adjust to room lighting.
Overall, a magical day!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is nice, but don't turn it off. I turn it off when I go up to bed, every morning it wont turn on. It will eventually turn. Found these steps to try
- Unplug for 30 seconds (if this doesnt work then...)
- Unplug and hold the reset button for a minute under the Samsung insignia on bottom of tv
This probably wont work on first try but keep repeating the steps and youll probably get lucky after 3 or 4 tries.

A real headache!!!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Menu options say not available but don’t tell you why…
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviewList.review: TV is great so far but I find some of the features a bit overwhelming to set. It reports some features are not currently available but doesn’t say why. I read the use manual for example on how to adjust the video screen setting for screen size but the screen size change option is still grayed out. I even tried some tricks found on YouTube and it didn’t work. Spending to much time trying to get the screen to full-size gives this product a 4. This day and age I should not be dealing with this menu option this long and hard.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Measure Twice! Great TV paired with Sanus Tilt Mount for 110"
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is great.

I paired it with the Sanus tilt mount, but dont make the same mistake I did and assume the mounting screws are centered vertically on the TV. I think they are offset by 3 inches, which by the grace of god still allowed me to mount this monster with millimeters of clearance.

Also for the Sanus mount I ended up having to use the 25mm M8 screws with a 5mm stand off as well as the included washer. So dont assume the 16mm M8 screws in the Sanus kit will fit, they were too short for me.

Samsung is a solid brand with app features to boot. If you dont care about built in app support, I suppose you could go even cheaper with the TCL 98" but for the extra grand it was worth it to me to get Samsung. I was between this and the Sony 100" which gets you 2 inches extra diagonal and Dolby Vision but it was also 3k more. Wasnt worth it to me.

If i were to splurge I'd go for the QN 90A 98" by Samsung. Unlimited cash I'd go with the 110" LG OLED.

The box is enormous. I had to unpack and get a friend to safely get it into the basement after removing the hand rails. So be mindful of delivery because if you're moving this to anywhere beyond a direct entryway, you may find yourself stuck.

The picture is what you would expect from an LED. There's a considerable difference with blooming/bleed in high contrast scenes, but I'm comparing to LG OLED, which is insanely better but also much more costly. Also the OLED suffers from screen burn. I have a roughly 7 year old LG 65" OLED that's been performing wonderfully to this day but now is showing signs of wear on images with a noticable split down the middle on darker images.

Over all Im happy with my purchase. If you have the extra cash go with the QN, otherwise this is a solis contender.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Packed With Many Features, it's like a Swiss Army Knife For Your Entertainment Center.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviewList.review:
Samsung has always been one of the leading names in the electronics industry, and their latest offering, the Samsung 55-Inch Class QLED 4K Q80C Series modrl, is no exception. This television is an exceptional piece of technology, and I was lucky enough to get my hands on one to review. Not only is it packed with top-of-the-line features, but it also manages to be incredibly beautiful. In this review, I’ll be taking a closer look at the Samsung Q80C and telling you all about its features and the clever way they’ve been implemented.

//Design:

Let’s start with the design. The Samsung Q80C is an absolute stunner. It has a sleek, modern design that would look great in any living room. The television is very slim, and the bezels are almost nonexistent. This means that you get an almost edge-to-edge display, which is perfect for a more immersive viewing experience.

But the best part about the design is the way it’s been implemented with the Q80C’s Smart TV features. The television’s design is so sleek and seamless that it feels like the entire TV is one big Smart Hub. The Q80C’s Smart TV features are so intuitive that you’ll never want to go back to a regular remote. The remote is even designed to look like a gaming controller, which is a hilarious nod to the fact that this TV is great for gaming.

//Display:

Moving on to the display, the Samsung Q80C features a 55-inch QLED display with a resolution of 4K. This means that you’re getting an incredibly sharp and detailed picture. The colors are vivid and bright, and the blacks are deep and dark. The QLED technology also means that the TV has a very high contrast ratio, which is great for watching movies and TV shows with a lot of dark scenes.

But what really sets the Samsung Q80C apart from other televisions is the Quantum HDR+ technology. This technology uses a combination of HDR10+ and HLG (Hybrid Log-Gamma) to produce an even wider range of colors and brightness levels. This means that the TV is able to display more realistic colors, which is especially noticeable in nature documentaries and other shows with lots of bright colors. And once again, Samsung manages to inject humor into their technology by making the Q80C’s picture so vivid that it’s almost like you’re actually there.

//Sound:

The sound on the Samsung Q80C is also something special. The TV features Dolby Atmos Object Tracking Sound Lite, which is a mouthful to say but basically means that the TV is able to produce a more immersive and directional sound experience. This is especially noticeable when watching action movies or playing video games, where the sound can help you locate enemies or explosions.

But Samsung doesn’t stop there. They’ve also included Q-Symphony 3.0, which is a feature that allows the TV to work in sync with your soundbar or home theater system. This means that you can get even better sound quality without having to worry about syncing issues.

And once again, Samsung is injecting so much data into their technology by making the Q80C’s sound so immersive that it’s like you’re actually in the action. But they take it a step further by including a feature called “Object Tracking Sound Lite,” which sounds like something out of a science fiction movie.

//Gaming:

The Samsung Q80C is also great for gaming. The TV has a Game Mode, which reduces input lag and optimizes the picture fora better gaming experience. This means that you can play your favorite games without having to worry about lag or any visual issues.

But what really sets the Samsung Q80C apart for gamers is the Gaming Hub. This feature is a one-stop-shop for all your gaming needs. It allows you to access all your favorite gaming apps, like Twitch and Discord, without having to switch inputs or navigate through menus. This is a game-changer for gamers, as it makes it much easier to access everything you need to get your gaming fix.

The Q80C’s Game Mode so good that you’ll forget you’re not actually in the game. And the Gaming Hub is so convenient that you’ll never want to leave your couch.

//Smart TV Features:

The Samsung Q80C is also packed with Smart TV features. It has Alexa built-in, which means that you can control your TV with your voice. This is especially convenient for when you can’t find the remote or when you’re too lazy to get up off the couch.

But Samsung takes it a step further by making the Q80C’s Smart TV features so intuitive that you’ll feel like you’re living in the future. The TV’s Smart Hub allows you to easily access all your favorite apps and streaming services, and the OneRemote allows you to control all your devices with just one remote. Samsung’s Smart TV features are so seamless that you’ll never want to go back to a regular TV.

//Conclusion:

In conclusion, the Samsung 55-Inch Class QLED 4K Q80C Series, is an exceptional piece of technology. It’s packed with top-of-the-line features that make it great for everything from watching movies to playing video games. But what really sets the Q80C apart is the way that Samsung injects humor into their technology. They manage to make their features both informative and funny, which makes using the TV a joy.

The Q80C’s design is sleek and modern, and the display is incredibly sharp and vivid. The sound is immersive and directional, and the TV is great for gaming. The Smart TV features are intuitive and convenient, and Alexa built-in makes controlling your TV a breeze.

//Overall, the Q80C Series is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a great TV. It's got everything you could want in a TV, and it's sure to impress your friends and family.

----------------

If you made it this far through my review, then here's a funny story about the TV:

I was watching a movie on the TV, and I got so engrossed in the story that I forgot to turn on the subtitles. I didn't realize this until I heard a character say something that I didn't understand. I looked down at the TV and saw that the subtitles were turned off. I laughed out loud and said to myself, "I'm such an idiot."

I turned on the subtitles and continued watching the movie. I was able to understand everything that was being said, and I enjoyed the movie even more.

Moral of the story: Always turn on the subtitles when you're watching a movie on a TV. It will make your viewing experience much more enjoyable.. If you’re in the market for a new TV, I highly recommend checking out the Samsung Q80C, a television that's so packed with features, it's like a Swiss army knife for your entertainment center. You won’t be disappointed.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
Update:

The TV was delivered on March 27th, and on April 30th I noticed that the brightness of the screen started flickering while watching a BluRay.. Then, I went to bed and turned the TV off, got up the next morning and found that the TV would turn on, but I would get no screen.. I only use the TV about 12 hours a day at the most.. Some days, it may not even get turned on.. If I shined a flashlight onto the screen, I could make out the picture in the background, but it was like the light in the back of the TV went out.. I ended up getting help and they had me hold the power button down on the remote for a few seconds until the TV rebooted.. After I did, which took something like 5 or so seconds, the TV did reboot and is now working fine.. I guess it is because it gets a build up of static on the inside, and rebooting it discharges all that static.. I have never had a TV do this before, so this is a first for me.. If you have this problem too, then try this before you do anything else..

Original post: (with a few minor updates)

My first complaint, which I do not understand why it happened, but I tried to change channels once and when I did, it just came up with a big box in the middle of the screen that said scanning or something.. I had been using it for a while, so this was not just installed when it did this.. But it did this a couple of times in a row.. I went to the home menu screen, and then back, and it has never done that again.. Glitch?? I think I was on OTA TV at the time.. I never had the problem again after that (a month later)..

The picture viewing is good from all angles.. Some TV's the picture is not very good from the side, like not being able to view the screen at all, or the colors being really off.. This screen does not have any of those problems..

I think it would have been nice if there was more than 4 HDMI ports.. Me, surveillance system, Roku, Blu-ray player... That is 3 already.. Add in game systems, etc, and you can easily go up to over 4.. Especially when you consider that they took away all RCA, VGA, etc plugs.. You would think that they could put more HDMI on it..

I did notice that you can not use 2 HDMI ports at the same time.. What I mean by this is.. They have a split screen option, or picture in picture.. I have my surveillance system on one HDMI port, and my Blu-ray player on another.. If I tried to watch a Blu-ray while having the cameras going on the PIP, the screen and sound for the Blu-ray just go blank, but the surveillance will work fine.. But if I have OTA or Samsung+ TV going on the first screen, it will plat the Blu-ray or surveillance on the second picture or screen with no problem.. So using PIP is very limited..

Upon using it, to get to the Samsung menu, it is different between OTA TV and Samsung Plus internet channels.. You can get to the channel list by pressing straight down on the up/down button on the remote, no matter what channel you are watching.. But, you have to change the channel to one of the 1000+ channels to get to the Samsung plus menu.. Once you get to one of those internet channels, just hit the down button on the round button to get to this menu, and it will come up with "Live" or "Discover", and then hit down again.. Live will bring you to the same menu that you get by pressing straight down on the channel up/down button.. But if you move it over to Discover, it gives you a list of free movies and stuff that you can watch..

They should have this integrated so that you get this menu with all OTA channels along with the internet ones, just like how they have them both integrated into the menu list..

On the home screen, they automatically put anything new you add to the app list to the end of the line.. To move these icons to the front of the line, you have to hold the round button down on the remote for a couple of seconds.. It took me a little time to figure this out because I kept trying to go into the area that says "apps" to try and change the order.. I did not find anything in there about how to move the menu app icons around.. It would have been nice if at least, at first boot up, they gave you a little pop up menu top tell you this, or something.. Maybe have a section in the "Apps" area to move the icons order would have been OK too.. But nothing on either end made me waist a lot of time tying to figure out how to move the icons so what I wanted, the newly added ones, were not at the end of the line, but at the front.

On the internet samsung plus channels (1000+ channels), there is no way to tell what resolution that anything is in.. On the OTA channels, if you hit the round button it will tell you if it is SD or HD, and if you hold that same button down for a couple of seconds, it will tell you about the show and also tell you what resolution it is in.. 480i is usual for SD and either 720P or 1080i for HD.. But there is nothing for the 1000+ channels.. Why no consistency? Just to note.. Here, there is no OTA TV channels over 1080, so for just free OTA, if that is all you are watching, you probably will not notice any difference between a standard HD TV and a 4k TV.

I have not used the voice part at all, so no comment there. I also had did some changes, like to have it automatically start where I last left off..

Overall, it is a very nice TV, but it does have its little things that could be made better.. With the problem of the screen going on in just one month, and now knowing that this might be a constant, every so often problem, I am dropping the rating down to 3 stars for this reason.

reviewList.review:
Unfortunately our TV arrived with screen damage. The reseller, Modia, located in Texas, responded right away. It was late in the evening but they responded quickly in letting us know what we needed to do to get a return started with Amazon.
The 98 inch Samsung TV is a huge TV and weighs in at over 150 pounds. Modia arranged a pickup with sufficient manpower to handle the TV.
We did wind up buying the TV again. The picture is stunning compared to the previous DLP TV we had. We would definitely buy again from Modia. They provided awesome service every step of the way.

The Q80C’s Smart TV features are so intuitive that you’ll never want to go back to a regular remote. The remote is even designed to look like a gaming controller, which is a hilarious nod to the fact that this TV is great for gaming.

//Display:

Moving on to the display, the Samsung Q80C features a 55-inch QLED display with a resolution of 4K. This means that you’re getting an incredibly sharp and detailed picture. The colors are vivid and bright, and the blacks are deep and dark. The QLED technology also means that the TV has a very high contrast ratio, which is great for watching movies and TV shows with a lot of dark scenes.

But what really sets the Samsung Q80C apart from other televisions is the Quantum HDR+ technology. This technology uses a combination of HDR10+ and HLG (Hybrid Log-Gamma) to produce an even wider range of colors and brightness levels. This means that the TV is able to display more realistic colors, which is especially noticeable in nature documentaries and other shows with lots of bright colors. And once again, Samsung manages to inject humor into their technology by making the Q80C’s picture so vivid that it’s almost like you’re actually there.

//Sound:

The sound on the Samsung Q80C is also something special. The TV features Dolby Atmos Object Tracking Sound Lite, which is a mouthful to say but basically means that the TV is able to produce a more immersive and directional sound experience. This is especially noticeable when watching action movies or playing video games, where the sound can help you locate enemies or explosions.

But Samsung doesn’t stop there. They’ve also included Q-Symphony 3.0, which is a feature that allows the TV to work in sync with your soundbar or home theater system. This means that you can get even better sound quality without having to worry about syncing issues.

And once again, Samsung is injecting so much data into their technology by making the Q80C’s sound so immersive that it’s like you’re actually in the action. But they take it a step further by including a feature called “Object Tracking Sound Lite,” which sounds like something out of a science fiction movie.

//Gaming:

The Samsung Q80C is also great for gaming. The TV has a Game Mode, which reduces input lag and optimizes the picture fora better gaming experience. This means that you can play your favorite games without having to worry about lag or any visual issues.

But what really sets the Samsung Q80C apart for gamers is the Gaming Hub. This feature is a one-stop-shop for all your gaming needs. It allows you to access all your favorite gaming apps, like Twitch and Discord, without having to switch inputs or navigate through menus. This is a game-changer for gamers, as it makes it much easier to access everything you need to get your gaming fix.

The Q80C’s Game Mode so good that you’ll forget you’re not actually in the game. And the Gaming Hub is so convenient that you’ll never want to leave your couch.

//Smart TV Features:

The Samsung Q80C is also packed with Smart TV features. It has Alexa built-in, which means that you can control your TV with your voice. This is especially convenient for when you can’t find the remote or when you’re too lazy to get up off the couch.

But Samsung takes it a step further by making the Q80C’s Smart TV features so intuitive that you’ll feel like you’re living in the future. The TV’s Smart Hub allows you to easily access all your favorite apps and streaming services, and the OneRemote allows you to control all your devices with just one remote. Samsung’s Smart TV features are so seamless that you’ll never want to go back to a regular TV.

//Conclusion:

In conclusion, the Samsung 55-Inch Class QLED 4K Q80C Series, is an exceptional piece of technology. It’s packed with top-of-the-line features that make it great for everything from watching movies to playing video games. But what really sets the Q80C apart is the way that Samsung injects humor into their technology. They manage to make their features both informative and funny, which makes using the TV a joy.

The Q80C’s design is sleek and modern, and the display is incredibly sharp and vivid. The sound is immersive and directional, and the TV is great for gaming. The Smart TV features are intuitive and convenient, and Alexa built-in makes controlling your TV a breeze.

//Overall, the Q80C Series is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a great TV. It's got everything you could want in a TV, and it's sure to impress your friends and family.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
Update:

The TV was delivered on March 27th, and on April 30th I noticed that the brightness of the screen started flickering while watching a BluRay.. Then, I went to bed and turned the TV off, got up the next morning and found that the TV would turn on, but I would get no screen.. I only use the TV about 12 hours a day at the most.. Some days, it may not even get turned on.. If I shined a flashlight onto the screen, I could make out the picture in the background, but it was like the light in the back of the TV went out.. I ended up getting help and they had me hold the power button down on the remote for a few seconds until the TV rebooted.. After I did, which took something like 5 or so seconds, the TV did reboot and is now working fine.. I guess it is because it gets a build up of static on the inside, and rebooting it discharges all that static.. I have never had a TV do this before, so this is a first for me.. If you have this problem too, then try this before you do anything else..

Original post: (with a few minor updates)

My first complaint, which I do not understand why it happened, but I tried to change channels once and when I did, it just came up with a big box in the middle of the screen that said scanning or something.. I had been using it for a while, so this was not just installed when it did this.. But it did this a couple of times in a row.. I went to the home menu screen, and then back, and it has never done that again.. Glitch?? I think I was on OTA TV at the time.. I never had the problem again after that (a month later)..

The picture viewing is good from all angles.. Some TV's the picture is not very good from the side, like not being able to view the screen at all, or the colors being really off.. This screen does not have any of those problems..

I think it would have been nice if there was more than 4 HDMI ports.. Me, surveillance system, Roku, Blu-ray player... That is 3 already.. Add in game systems, etc, and you can easily go up to over 4.. Especially when you consider that they took away all RCA, VGA, etc plugs.. You would think that they could put more HDMI on it..

I did notice that you can not use 2 HDMI ports at the same time.. What I mean by this is.. They have a split screen option, or picture in picture.. I have my surveillance system on one HDMI port, and my Blu-ray player on another.. If I tried to watch a Blu-ray while having the cameras going on the PIP, the screen and sound for the Blu-ray just go blank, but the surveillance will work fine.. But if I have OTA or Samsung+ TV going on the first screen, it will plat the Blu-ray or surveillance on the second picture or screen with no problem.. So using PIP is very limited..

Upon using it, to get to the Samsung menu, it is different between OTA TV and Samsung Plus internet channels.. You can get to the channel list by pressing straight down on the up/down button on the remote, no matter what channel you are watching.. But, you have to change the channel to one of the 1000+ channels to get to the Samsung plus menu.. Once you get to one of those internet channels, just hit the down button on the round button to get to this menu, and it will come up with "Live" or "Discover", and then hit down again.. Live will bring you to the same menu that you get by pressing straight down on the channel up/down button.. But if you move it over to Discover, it gives you a list of free movies and stuff that you can watch..

They should have this integrated so that you get this menu with all OTA channels along with the internet ones, just like how they have them both integrated into the menu list..

On the home screen, they automatically put anything new you add to the app list to the end of the line.. To move these icons to the front of the line, you have to hold the round button down on the remote for a couple of seconds.. It took me a little time to figure this out because I kept trying to go into the area that says "apps" to try and change the order.. I did not find anything in there about how to move the menu app icons around.. It would have been nice if at least, at first boot up, they gave you a little pop up menu top tell you this, or something.. Maybe have a section in the "Apps" area to move the icons order would have been OK too.. But nothing on either end made me waist a lot of time tying to figure out how to move the icons so what I wanted, the newly added ones, were not at the end of the line, but at the front.

On the internet samsung plus channels (1000+ channels), there is no way to tell what resolution that anything is in.. On the OTA channels, if you hit the round button it will tell you if it is SD or HD, and if you hold that same button down for a couple of seconds, it will tell you about the show and also tell you what resolution it is in.. 480i is usual for SD and either 720P or 1080i for HD.. But there is nothing for the 1000+ channels.. Why no consistency? Just to note.. Here, there is no OTA TV channels over 1080, so for just free OTA, if that is all you are watching, you probably will not notice any difference between a standard HD TV and a 4k TV.

I have not used the voice part at all, so no comment there. I also had did some changes, like to have it automatically start where I last left off..

Overall, it is a very nice TV, but it does have its little things that could be made better.. With the problem of the screen going on in just one month, and now knowing that this might be a constant, every so often problem, I am dropping the rating down to 3 stars for this reason.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviewList.review:
Unfortunately our TV arrived with screen damage. The reseller, Modia, located in Texas, responded right away. It was late in the evening but they responded quickly in letting us know what we needed to do to get a return started with Amazon.
The 98 inch Samsung TV is a huge TV and weighs in at over 150 pounds. Modia arranged a pickup with sufficient manpower to handle the TV.
We did wind up buying the TV again. The picture is stunning compared to the previous DLP TV we had. We would definitely buy again from Modia. They provided awesome service every step of the way.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Great TV and was delivered on time.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviewList.review: I liked that it came on time and is a great TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviewList.review: Pulled it out of the box using 3 people to ensure safety of the T.V. Plugged it in before doing anything else and the power indicator turns red so the TV has power, but no picture would display on the screen and it would stay black/blank. I tried everything in the book, unplugging appliances, plugging it in a new outlet, tested the original outlet where the TV would go, used an extension cord, tried all the troubleshooting steps, checking the circuit breakers, you name it. Super frustrating waiting a week and planning a time to be home to sign for the TV just for it to not work 1 hour of it arriving to my home. Sat on the phone with amazon for 47 minutes to be put on hold for 40 of those minutes and then get hung up on. I call a second time and again, I get put on hold for 32 minutes and then finally get routed to a person that was able to help me. The replacement will take another week to get here so I’ll update this review if the next TV works.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviewList.review: First, I highly recommend you plug in this tv and turn it on before installing the stand and moving it to where you want it to live. The first tv we received had an extremely damaged screen. We plugged it in, it came on, and the screen looked shattered once turned on. We couldn’t see anything. You couldn’t see this until the tv was turned on as the actual physical screen looked perfect. Something was wrong inside. We had to repackage the huge tv and take it to the UPS store to return it. Had a replacement sent. We plugged this one in first and thankfully it came on perfectly. This is the largest tv we have ever owned, and it’s amazing how we can see details we never could before on our smaller tv. While it’s not the largest tv, it’s quite large for us. Plenty large. Makes things easier to see for my nearsighted eyes. Very pleased so far. Easy to add all of our streaming apps. It keeps asking us to connect to our wifi, and our old tv never did that, so hopefully that won’t be an ongoing issue. Overall, this is a super nice tv!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Picture quality no so great, but loaded with features
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
I was replacing a 12 year old 65" LG Plasma TV which had THX certified Cinema Mode. I expected this TV to have better picture quality since technology has improved since, but was disappointed. The default colors were quite light and I had to play around with the color/picture controls manually to make them better. Brightness was also too high by default.

Unless you sign up for a Samsung account, calibration capabilities with a mobile phone are not available. So finally I signed up for a Samsung account and then tried to calibrate with an S23 mobile phone. The result was a better picture, but not as good as the older plasma one.

Of course there are quite a number of other features that comes with the TV, like apps, webcam addition, using your mobile phone camera, fireTV remote emulation, 4K streaming, embedded manuals and such... These are appreciated, but the primary use case is picture quality, where it did not quite meet the THX Cinema quality of the earlier plasma model.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviewList.review: Excellent picture quality and very easy to set up.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviewList.review:
Wow! This is an incredible television. Amazon Delivery made this day even more special with an above and beyond delivery. Downside, it took 4 resets to get all features to work properly.. First reset, could not get close caption to reset, second reset, no sound, third reset, YouTube tv not working, forth and final reset, could not get Peacocktv to download.
Learning curve, MAYBE!
What would have made it program easier would have been a step.by.step guide.
When all programmed and done, just perfect.
Suggest turning intelligent mode off to select desired picture display. Dynamic setting worked best for us. Display had to auto adjust to room lighting.
Overall, a magical day!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is nice, but don't turn it off. I turn it off when I go up to bed, every morning it wont turn on. It will eventually turn. Found these steps to try
- Unplug for 30 seconds (if this doesnt work then...)
- Unplug and hold the reset button for a minute under the Samsung insignia on bottom of tv
This probably wont work on first try but keep repeating the steps and youll probably get lucky after 3 or 4 tries.

A real headache!!!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Menu options say not available but don’t tell you why…
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviewList.review: TV is great so far but I find some of the features a bit overwhelming to set. It reports some features are not currently available but doesn’t say why. I read the use manual for example on how to adjust the video screen setting for screen size but the screen size change option is still grayed out. I even tried some tricks found on YouTube and it didn’t work. Spending to much time trying to get the screen to full-size gives this product a 4. This day and age I should not be dealing with this menu option this long and hard.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Measure Twice! Great TV paired with Sanus Tilt Mount for 110"
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviewList.review:
The TV is great.

I paired it with the Sanus tilt mount, but dont make the same mistake I did and assume the mounting screws are centered vertically on the TV. I think they are offset by 3 inches, which by the grace of god still allowed me to mount this monster with millimeters of clearance.

Also for the Sanus mount I ended up having to use the 25mm M8 screws with a 5mm stand off as well as the included washer. So dont assume the 16mm M8 screws in the Sanus kit will fit, they were too short for me.

Samsung is a solid brand with app features to boot. If you dont care about built in app support, I suppose you could go even cheaper with the TCL 98" but for the extra grand it was worth it to me to get Samsung. I was between this and the Sony 100" which gets you 2 inches extra diagonal and Dolby Vision but it was also 3k more. Wasnt worth it to me.

If i were to splurge I'd go for the QN 90A 98" by Samsung. Unlimited cash I'd go with the 110" LG OLED.

The box is enormous. I had to unpack and get a friend to safely get it into the basement after removing the hand rails. So be mindful of delivery because if you're moving this to anywhere beyond a direct entryway, you may find yourself stuck.

The picture is what you would expect from an LED. There's a considerable difference with blooming/bleed in high contrast scenes, but I'm comparing to LG OLED, which is insanely better but also much more costly. Also the OLED suffers from screen burn. I have a roughly 7 year old LG 65" OLED that's been performing wonderfully to this day but now is showing signs of wear on images with a noticable split down the middle on darker images.

Over all Im happy with my purchase. If you have the extra cash go with the QN, otherwise this is a solis contender.

I ended up getting help and they had me hold the power button down on the remote for a few seconds until the TV rebooted.. After I did, which took something like 5 or so seconds, the TV did reboot and is now working fine.. I guess it is because it gets a build up of static on the inside, and rebooting it discharges all that static.. I have never had a TV do this before, so this is a first for me.. If you have this problem too, then try this before you do anything else..

Original post: (with a few minor updates)

My first complaint, which I do not understand why it happened, but I tried to change channels once and when I did, it just came up with a big box in the middle of the screen that said scanning or something.. I had been using it for a while, so this was not just installed when it did this.. But it did this a couple of times in a row.. I went to the home menu screen, and then back, and it has never done that again.. Glitch?? I think I was on OTA TV at the time.. I never had the problem again after that (a month later)..

The picture viewing is good from all angles.. Some TV's the picture is not very good from the side, like not being able to view the screen at all, or the colors being really off.. This screen does not have any of those problems..

I think it would have been nice if there was more than 4 HDMI ports.. Me, surveillance system, Roku, Blu-ray player... That is 3 already.. Add in game systems, etc, and you can easily go up to over 4.. Especially when you consider that they took away all RCA, VGA, etc plugs.. You would think that they could put more HDMI on it..

I did notice that you can not use 2 HDMI ports at the same time.. What I mean by this is.. They have a split screen option, or picture in picture.. I have my surveillance system on one HDMI port, and my Blu-ray player on another.. If I tried to watch a Blu-ray while having the cameras going on the PIP, the screen and sound for the Blu-ray just go blank, but the surveillance will work fine.. But if I have OTA or Samsung+ TV going on the first screen, it will plat the Blu-ray or surveillance on the second picture or screen with no problem.. So using PIP is very limited..

Upon using it, to get to the Samsung menu, it is different between OTA TV and Samsung Plus internet channels.. You can get to the channel list by pressing straight down on the up/down button on the remote, no matter what channel you are watching.. But, you have to change the channel to one of the 1000+ channels to get to the Samsung plus menu.. Once you get to one of those internet channels, just hit the down button on the round button to get to this menu, and it will come up with "Live" or "Discover", and then hit down again.. Live will bring you to the same menu that you get by pressing straight down on the channel up/down button.. But if you move it over to Discover, it gives you a list of free movies and stuff that you can watch..

They should have this integrated so that you get this menu with all OTA channels along with the internet ones, just like how they have them both integrated into the menu list..

On the home screen, they automatically put anything new you add to the app list to the end of the line.. To move these icons to the front of the line, you have to hold the round button down on the remote for a couple of seconds.. It took me a little time to figure this out because I kept trying to go into the area that says "apps" to try and change the order.. I did not find anything in there about how to move the menu app icons around.. It would have been nice if at least, at first boot up, they gave you a little pop up menu top tell you this, or something.. Maybe have a section in the "Apps" area to move the icons order would have been OK too.. But nothing on either end made me waist a lot of time tying to figure out how to move the icons so what I wanted, the newly added ones, were not at the end of the line, but at the front.

On the internet samsung plus channels (1000+ channels), there is no way to tell what resolution that anything is in.. On the OTA channels, if you hit the round button it will tell you if it is SD or HD, and if you hold that same button down for a couple of seconds, it will tell you about the show and also tell you what resolution it is in.. 480i is usual for SD and either 720P or 1080i for HD.. But there is nothing for the 1000+ channels.. Why no consistency? Just to note.. Here, there is no OTA TV channels over 1080, so for just free OTA, if that is all you are watching, you probably will not notice any difference between a standard HD TV and a 4k TV.

I have not used the voice part at all, so no comment there. I also had did some changes, like to have it automatically start where I last left off..

Overall, it is a very nice TV, but it does have its little things that could be made better.. With the problem of the screen going on in just one month, and now knowing that this might be a constant, every so often problem, I am dropping the rating down to 3 stars for this reason.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Very pleased with the performance gain
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviewList.review: Never bought a TV from Amazon before, but this was a decently pleasant experience. The first TV we ordered had some visual noise/blurring after 2 weeks of use. Called support and they sent a replacement right away and I only had to box the 1st one and send it back in. It's been over a month now with the replacement and it's a phenomenal experience. 120hz refresh rate is a game changer when viewing movies as images are able to be viewed as intended. Picture quality is amazing and very crisp. I don't care for the HDR as we live in an apt. that has some seriously superb naturally lighting that is very difficult to evade with extreme countermeasures. My wife and I have a rewatched so many movies and shows already as it's a new experience vs. a 60 hz refresh rate TV. Very happy with this purchase and hope it holds well for at least 3 years.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviewList.review: Likes: easy to setup since I already had account with Samsung .Its much easier to connect with internet if you use Ethernet connection .The weight of TV was little surprising when I set the tv up myself ,much easier if you use two.Packing was outstanding for great protection and preservation in shipping .I used SMART THINGS APP of Samsung and calibrated tv with my IPhone and it was an outstanding and easy setup.Picture quality is beautiful ,sound I use Yamaha receiver and connectivity was flawless .DIRECTV 4K channels are so beautiful .Electronics of Samsung is a perfect choice you cannot go wrong .I highly recommend this Tv even though they say it’s mid range .Watching tv at a slight angle was unnoticeable of any flaws .Overall I give this Tv ease of assembly A+,Picture quality A+,Sound A,Remote you will lose because it is small if not careful but it serves its purpose .Amazon delivery was handled with care and excellent .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviewList.review: Had it a couple months now. Great television. Picture is excellent! Fantastic for movies 4k blueray's are phenomenal. I just wish I went for the 75" I have had no issues whatsoever. Hopefully it stays that way.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviewList.review: I ordered this 65” Samsung as part of Amazons Prime Days sale. The TV is great. Very modern and thin with several HDMI ports for accessories. The picture is great and the set up was pretty easy. It didn’t take long to go through the wizard and add all my apps and streaming services. We use DirectTV streaming and the app works great along with all the others. We also purchased a Samsung soundbar with subwoofer and the set up with the TV was super easy and paired immediately. Only giving 4 stars because the delivery was terrible. You set up the delivery date after purchase and it was a week, not Prime. That would have been fine but on my date of delivery (which I needed to work at home for) they didn’t show up and they didn’t even notify me. The next day no communication either! They finally acknowledged they didn’t show up and my next delivery date was almost 10 days later. Took 3 weeks for a Prime delivery, clearly they were just trying to sell TVs but anyway, the product is good. Recommend the Samsung soundbar and sub as well.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviewList.review: Picture quality is excellent, plenty bright. It comes with a solar powered remote control which I really like but I can't use it because I'm using the voice remote on my cable box. It's a very small remote, there are not enough buttons to manage all the features of my Verizon cable box.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Banding - Possible seller issue - SKG USA
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviewList.review:
I purchased the Samsung Q70C 85" TV from SKG USA, drawn by the promise of 'Used - Like New' condition and the assurance of a full manufacturer's warranty. The claim was that the box had suffered minor damage while the TV remained in perfect condition. No box damaged was noted on arrival. However, within the first 30 days, my expectations were met with disappointment.

During a dark room test, the TV, priced at $1700, revealed significant 'clouding' and 'banding' defects. These terms might sound technical, but they simply mean that the screen has uneven patches of brightness ('clouding') and visible lines across the display ('banding'), which are particularly noticeable in darker scenes. For a TV boasting QLED technology, known for its stellar picture quality, this is a surprising and unacceptable issue so early in its lifespan.

Despite the TV's impressive color accuracy, smart features, and design, these screen uniformity flaws are a major letdown, suggesting a potential defect that undermines the value of this high-end model. It's disheartening to encounter such problems on a device that's barely a month old and sold as near-perfect.

I am reaching out through this review in hopes that SKG USA will honor their sale and address these concerns promptly. I urge potential buyers to consider these quality control issues before making a purchase.

The response from the seller and the outcome of this situation will be monitored closely. I believe I would have rated this 5 stars if not for the issues presented in this review.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviewList.review: I bought this TV to replace a 50” TCL with a larger 65” option. This has been great. No issues with picture quality or refresh rate. Was very easy to set up. Only thing I’ll note is the TV is very thin so picking it up to mount it on a wall makes you feel nervous because you feel you might bend it too much. Definitely recommend this in this price range.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviewList.review: This tv with the sound bar makes a great combination! It has Alexa plus it’s a smart tv and the 75” works great for our family room. Very happy with it.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviewList.review: This is my short review of this TV, its my first time to own a 4K QLED, so from standard HDTV to a 4K QLED 65in is something new and upgrade version and of course this one is better and good picture than my old TV and since this is my first, I can't say this 4K is better than my older 4K, I like the screen thickness its very slim I think half an inch thick, slim bezel, so there is no bulky thick tv and using it on a stand is just right and this is also perfect for hanging it in the wall. Features are good, using its own OS is good runs Netflix, amazon with no complaint, I used an AppleTV 4K so I don't worry about the internal OS, the only thing not so impressive with this TV is the built-in speaker sound, maybe because the slim design so the speaker is also slim that affect the sound, Samsung must improve their design on their internal speaker sound but maybe they assume that all users prefer to have an external subwoofer-speaker system so they don't much give improvement on internal sound. I also don't mind the internal speaker cuz I prefer my old Sony speaker bar with subwoofer and I'm fine with it. All of us have different preferences, requirement and budget, this TV may met your standard or not, Overall recommend this QLED TV and try to shop around like bestbuy and see the actual picture/video quality vs if just looking any reviews from youtube. Additional info. it doesn't mean you will get a big TV its good for your room, check your sofa/bed distance from the TV to get a good quality view.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviewList.review: I love the tv but I wish I could delete all the unnecessary apps and adjust the brightness on it I had to lower it down cause it was hurting our eyes the ps5 looks amazing on it I haven't tried the xbox yet but the tv remote is extremely sensitive so if you sit or lay on it it could change the volume or channel depending how you hit it which sucks lol.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review: I unboxed my TV only to find several shoe prints on the back.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviewList.review: Menu is a non stop add

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviewList.review: It was a great tv with a nice picture but after using it for a few days it got pixel burns. Don’t waste your time with any Samsung Tv that isn’t in display in a best buy. This one isn’t for a reason.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviewList.review: Opened the tv and saw it cracked on the bottom. It also feels very flimsy and could use titanium/aluminum reenforcement. I’m concerned a stiff breeze might make it flap and blow away.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Screen all messed up when turned on for first time
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023

reviewList.reviewTitle: this tv WILL get burn-in...."it can stay on a display without worry of burn-in".No,it will.Beware.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviewList.review: The picture was very good.As advertized.Mainly bought it thinking it wouldn't get burn-in...it did.Within the first week of ownership...normal operation.VERY disappointed with this model.If it hadn't,I would be keeping it.Beware.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviewList.review: Very good picture, remote control is very easy to use and the built in Alexa is a great added bonus.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviewList.review: The implementation of Alexa on this TV really sucks. It’s slow to respond and is in constant conflict with the Echoes in my house. It also constantly drops off my network.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Brilliant TV Pic, Sound, and Overall Quality!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviewList.review:
This television was bought to replace one my wife and I had in our bedroom. We needed something with a crisper picture as both of us have had eye issues over the past couple years, but we also wanted something with a nicer picture overall than the older, 32" model we had been using for years.

After looking around we settled on this tv both for its size as well as some of the picture features mentioned above, specifically the clear color and contrast in different environments. This set does not disappoint!

The picture is super clear right out of the box! The refresh rate and quality of color are impeccable and with lots of use over the last couple months we've had no issues as far as image degradation or pixels going out. The shows we've been watching are clean and crisp, the subtitles when we need them are a good size and have different settings to looking cleaner depending on the situation or program, and the overall watchability of the TV is amazing!

Add to all of the above the smart TV functionality is wonderful! I was worried that the set might be slower since it's the furthest from our wifi hotspot in the house, but it's been incredible. Honestly, 4k shows take only seconds to begin playing and come through nice and crisp! Browsing all the apps is super simple, and the total setup time for the TV was only a few minutes with all of the apps being able to talk with my phone or be setup using QR codes in seconds. Seriously, this was the fastest I think I've ever setup a tv!

For the price point I truly believe this TV is excellent and one you should be looking to invest in if you're in the market! I know we couldn't be happier with ours and will definitely keep an eye on Samsung in the future when and if we need to upgrade another set.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviewList.review: Movies look crisp on the TV, as well as streaming, buggiey issue I have is the TV doesn't run android but Samsung's more limited OS
