reviewList.reviewTitle: Very pleased with the performance gain
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviewList.review: Never bought a TV from Amazon before, but this was a decently pleasant experience. The first TV we ordered had some visual noise/blurring after 2 weeks of use. Called support and they sent a replacement right away and I only had to box the 1st one and send it back in. It's been over a month now with the replacement and it's a phenomenal experience. 120hz refresh rate is a game changer when viewing movies as images are able to be viewed as intended. Picture quality is amazing and very crisp. I don't care for the HDR as we live in an apt. that has some seriously superb naturally lighting that is very difficult to evade with extreme countermeasures. My wife and I have a rewatched so many movies and shows already as it's a new experience vs. a 60 hz refresh rate TV. Very happy with this purchase and hope it holds well for at least 3 years.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviewList.review: Likes: easy to setup since I already had account with Samsung .Its much easier to connect with internet if you use Ethernet connection .The weight of TV was little surprising when I set the tv up myself ,much easier if you use two.Packing was outstanding for great protection and preservation in shipping .I used SMART THINGS APP of Samsung and calibrated tv with my IPhone and it was an outstanding and easy setup.Picture quality is beautiful ,sound I use Yamaha receiver and connectivity was flawless .DIRECTV 4K channels are so beautiful .Electronics of Samsung is a perfect choice you cannot go wrong .I highly recommend this Tv even though they say it’s mid range .Watching tv at a slight angle was unnoticeable of any flaws .Overall I give this Tv ease of assembly A+,Picture quality A+,Sound A,Remote you will lose because it is small if not careful but it serves its purpose .Amazon delivery was handled with care and excellent .

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviewList.review: Had it a couple months now. Great television. Picture is excellent! Fantastic for movies 4k blueray's are phenomenal. I just wish I went for the 75" I have had no issues whatsoever. Hopefully it stays that way.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviewList.review: I ordered this 65” Samsung as part of Amazons Prime Days sale. The TV is great. Very modern and thin with several HDMI ports for accessories. The picture is great and the set up was pretty easy. It didn’t take long to go through the wizard and add all my apps and streaming services. We use DirectTV streaming and the app works great along with all the others. We also purchased a Samsung soundbar with subwoofer and the set up with the TV was super easy and paired immediately. Only giving 4 stars because the delivery was terrible. You set up the delivery date after purchase and it was a week, not Prime. That would have been fine but on my date of delivery (which I needed to work at home for) they didn’t show up and they didn’t even notify me. The next day no communication either! They finally acknowledged they didn’t show up and my next delivery date was almost 10 days later. Took 3 weeks for a Prime delivery, clearly they were just trying to sell TVs but anyway, the product is good. Recommend the Samsung soundbar and sub as well.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviewList.review: Picture quality is excellent, plenty bright. It comes with a solar powered remote control which I really like but I can't use it because I'm using the voice remote on my cable box. It's a very small remote, there are not enough buttons to manage all the features of my Verizon cable box.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Banding - Possible seller issue - SKG USA
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviewList.review:
I purchased the Samsung Q70C 85" TV from SKG USA, drawn by the promise of 'Used - Like New' condition and the assurance of a full manufacturer's warranty. The claim was that the box had suffered minor damage while the TV remained in perfect condition. No box damaged was noted on arrival. However, within the first 30 days, my expectations were met with disappointment.

During a dark room test, the TV, priced at $1700, revealed significant 'clouding' and 'banding' defects. These terms might sound technical, but they simply mean that the screen has uneven patches of brightness ('clouding') and visible lines across the display ('banding'), which are particularly noticeable in darker scenes. For a TV boasting QLED technology, known for its stellar picture quality, this is a surprising and unacceptable issue so early in its lifespan.

Despite the TV's impressive color accuracy, smart features, and design, these screen uniformity flaws are a major letdown, suggesting a potential defect that undermines the value of this high-end model. It's disheartening to encounter such problems on a device that's barely a month old and sold as near-perfect.

I am reaching out through this review in hopes that SKG USA will honor their sale and address these concerns promptly. I urge potential buyers to consider these quality control issues before making a purchase.

The response from the seller and the outcome of this situation will be monitored closely. I believe I would have rated this 5 stars if not for the issues presented in this review.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviewList.review: I bought this TV to replace a 50” TCL with a larger 65” option. This has been great. No issues with picture quality or refresh rate. Was very easy to set up. Only thing I’ll note is the TV is very thin so picking it up to mount it on a wall makes you feel nervous because you feel you might bend it too much. Definitely recommend this in this price range.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviewList.review: This tv with the sound bar makes a great combination! It has Alexa plus it’s a smart tv and the 75” works great for our family room. Very happy with it.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviewList.review: This is my short review of this TV, its my first time to own a 4K QLED, so from standard HDTV to a 4K QLED 65in is something new and upgrade version and of course this one is better and good picture than my old TV and since this is my first, I can't say this 4K is better than my older 4K, I like the screen thickness its very slim I think half an inch thick, slim bezel, so there is no bulky thick tv and using it on a stand is just right and this is also perfect for hanging it in the wall. Features are good, using its own OS is good runs Netflix, amazon with no complaint, I used an AppleTV 4K so I don't worry about the internal OS, the only thing not so impressive with this TV is the built-in speaker sound, maybe because the slim design so the speaker is also slim that affect the sound, Samsung must improve their design on their internal speaker sound but maybe they assume that all users prefer to have an external subwoofer-speaker system so they don't much give improvement on internal sound. I also don't mind the internal speaker cuz I prefer my old Sony speaker bar with subwoofer and I'm fine with it. All of us have different preferences, requirement and budget, this TV may met your standard or not, Overall recommend this QLED TV and try to shop around like bestbuy and see the actual picture/video quality vs if just looking any reviews from youtube. Additional info. it doesn't mean you will get a big TV its good for your room, check your sofa/bed distance from the TV to get a good quality view.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Brilliant TV Pic, Sound, and Overall Quality!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviewList.review:
This television was bought to replace one my wife and I had in our bedroom. We needed something with a crisper picture as both of us have had eye issues over the past couple years, but we also wanted something with a nicer picture overall than the older, 32" model we had been using for years.

After looking around we settled on this tv both for its size as well as some of the picture features mentioned above, specifically the clear color and contrast in different environments. This set does not disappoint!

The picture is super clear right out of the box! The refresh rate and quality of color are impeccable and with lots of use over the last couple months we've had no issues as far as image degradation or pixels going out. The shows we've been watching are clean and crisp, the subtitles when we need them are a good size and have different settings to looking cleaner depending on the situation or program, and the overall watchability of the TV is amazing!

Add to all of the above the smart TV functionality is wonderful! I was worried that the set might be slower since it's the furthest from our wifi hotspot in the house, but it's been incredible. Honestly, 4k shows take only seconds to begin playing and come through nice and crisp! Browsing all the apps is super simple, and the total setup time for the TV was only a few minutes with all of the apps being able to talk with my phone or be setup using QR codes in seconds. Seriously, this was the fastest I think I've ever setup a tv!

For the price point I truly believe this TV is excellent and one you should be looking to invest in if you're in the market! I know we couldn't be happier with ours and will definitely keep an eye on Samsung in the future when and if we need to upgrade another set.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviewList.review:
I bought this 75" Samsung after my comparatively priced TCL 65" developed screen issues after just 13 months(Thanks Asurion for covering it) and I must say I'm happy with my purchase. I also had a 55" TCL go kaput after just 2 years. I doubt they've done long term tests on the TCL big screens as the reviews have been glowing, but my experience says steer clear.

If you're in the market for a reasonably price big screen tv for your living room then look no further as this is a great tv for your average person. This might not be a serious gamer or videophile set but the picture pops and to me the contrast is great which is important.

These are the pros that were important to me:

Pros:
Beautiful picture especially in higher resolution
Deeper blacks
Minimalist remote that works with my Vizio soundbar
Optical to work with my older soundbar
Nice design with very thin bezel
Rechargeable remote(USB C) with solar recharging also! No batteries to change!
Pleasing interface, easy to navigate
Samsung product. I've always had good luck with their tv's though I did buy the Asurion insurance just in case.
Sale price was reasonable

Cons:
I had an issue with VESA bolt holes when mounting but I got 'er done.

I'll update if I have any issues.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: This Samsung Qled TV offers an excellent picture and decent sound for a reasonable price ($597 for 55”). Granted the picture is not quite as good as high end Qled TV’s or OLED TV’s which are far more expensive, but for the price it is very good. The only minor downside is the small & confusing remote but for about $10 a full size remote can be purchased here on Amazon.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviewList.review: I needed to replace my "black screen" failed TV. After researching TV reviews, I chose this Samsung, and I am most pleased with it. Best picture detail and color quality I've ever had. Sound quality is great too. Using my home Wi-Fi service, the initial setup and software update was flawless and easy. This TV has the latest technology features, and with Internet updates I'll always have the latest future updates available. I'm thoroughly enjoying all TV programs, sports, and movies. Good value for the price.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Its a nice tv, but not great
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviewList.review: I replaced a 5-6 year old tv with this samsung. It has a lot of good features, the picture quality is great, the colors, brightness, sharpness are all things to be desired. Where this tv falls off a bit for me is the interface, it just looks cheap. Setting up all the apps can be really annoying aswell. Ive also had a few issues with random turn offs, or certain apps always having an issue, like netflix, and history channel. I was able to get this tv for such a good deal around black friday so for the value its a great tv. I just dont love the samsung software. All that said, its a solid tv for the price. Picture quality is the most important feature to me so im happy with the tv overall.

reviewList.review: Well-packaged, gorgeous picture, good sound even without our sound bar. Love the tiny remote. The picture is so good that someone said “it looks weird!” before we realized it was because we could see so much more detail.

the Samsung Q60c. Great price, picture quality and ease of use. Me as the Husband absolutley am glad with our continued love of Samsung products and support. Samsung sound bar works perfect. Connective abllity to my Dish provider took tv to another level.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviewList.review: I got it primarily for gaming. It has the Gamepass app and gaming hub built in, which is nice. The picture on games are fantastic. The sound isn't amazing, but certainly good enough. I may invest in a soundbar at some point. The remote however is pretty confusing at first with the buttons not specifying what they do. Once you figure it out, it's fine though. The solar power recharge feature is a nice touch. Overall I'm quite happy with this as a gaming teleivision. The movies I've tested on 4K Blu Ray look superb too.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviewList.review:
Samsung 85” TV review. Here’s how it went. First the packing is pitifully flimsy. One of the 4 plastic snaps that hold the ends of the cardboard box was pre-broken, thankfully the other 3 held. The segmented Styrofoam elements formed a chain around only the perimeter of the carton but provided no flex prevention to the carton. Little diagrams stamped along the bottom depicting opening procedures convened nothing instructive but we managed to carefully open the box. Once opened it was about the same size and the Sony 85” it was replacing. Good so far. The single double sides page of instructions were very colorful with tons of arrows, but may have equally been useful for launching jets off an aircraft carrier or construction a bridge beam girder. Only one single item was useful: mounting to a wall bracket requires 4 M8 bolts which were NOT included. Really Samsung? A dimes worth of bolts you can’t provide on a $2K tv? Strike one.

Now all connected and plugged in we reach for the remote to turn on the new tv. The remote is charged not by batteries but a solar window on the back or by USB port, the cable for that was also NOT provided. Luckily I had one that worked and charged the remote enough to begin. Strike two.

The tv came on in glorious super bright color! I'm talking lighthouse bright. No problem, I’ll tone down the output with settings. But first what’s with the 2” wide band of tiny vertical lines just off the right edge of the screen? Or the 1” band of squiggly bars of colored lines racing across the very bottom of the screen? No amount of scrolling thru endless steps of the limited buttons on the remote would remove or provide any insight of the errant lines on the screen. Strike 3.

A call to customer service was next. I won’t describe the events between dialing the number and finally talking to a person (in India? Pakistan? The Caribbean?) who was very nice and requested a photo of the lines on the screen, texted to a particular number, which I did. No response. We have spent almost 2 hours now and obviously this unit is faulted. Frustration and disappointment fill the room. Back to Amazon it goes. Having spent thousand of dollars on Amazon over the years, this is my first return, and I discover the return process will take up to 37 days to refund my $2200. Lesson learned: no more big expenditures with Amazon.

I have been a fan of Sony television since the Trinitron days. For the past 45 years, every TV I bought for myself or bought for my kids or gifted- was a Sony, including the last one: an 85 incher. Loved it. Then one day it wouldn’t come on. Died after 19 months. NINETEEN MONTHS for a $2300 TV? Disappointed beyond words. But I’m fortunate to have a helpful son (who favors Samsung) and just happens to know everything and rather than go another 10 rounds with him over which TV is best I just bought an 85” Samsung. This was a mistake. Maybe I just got a bad one or maybe the overworked handlers of Amazon weren’t as careful as they could have been, given the inadequate packaging. Possibly some disreputable seller unloaded some questionable name brand components to Amazon, who knows. But over all I prefer the Sony picture, remote and necessary devices included over the Samsung. There are no major electronics retailers within 60 miles of my location so I’ll stuff a sock on my sons mouth and order another Sony; from either Walmart or Circuit City.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Best 4k tv you'll ever get for this price!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review: I'm a die hard Samsung fan and I absolutely love this TV. I bought two of them! They aren't OLED as that style are still pretty pricey but the quality is far superior to other brands. Samsung is a world leading tech manufacturer that excells in innovation and development. They produce most of their own products including their QLED tv/monitor line and all of their AMOLED screens in their galaxy books and smartphones. For the price, this TV is amazing. Everything I watch now is rendered in 4k and it's a world of difference. Even movies from the 80's look completely different. I saw some reviews mentioning their packaging was sub par and they must just be unlucky. Both of my tvs were very secure in their boxes and wrapped and supported with foam to the max. I've honestly never seen anything of low quality from this company. I couldn't be happier. Samsung forever!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviewList.review: This is a great price for an above-average TV. But if Amazon photos are important to you, it's not compatible, although they offer Amazon Alexa and Music...weird. the remote is glitchy and inferior to the Firestick. The 'add apps' is especially frustrating, because there isn't even a space bar on the search. If the app you're looking for isn't offered in the 'suggestions' as you type a partial search....too bad and no way to search. That's goofy. Picture is very good, a soundbar is essential. All in all, worth the current price, but I wouldn't go over that.

reviewList.review: Seems to be a great TV with many features that I probably won’t use. Took a bit to get it to connect to my cumbersome internet service but finally got it. Remote is ok but prefer the simpler buttons on some of the older styles.

reviewList.reviewTitle: QLED is definitely a step up
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviewList.review: I live in a tiny house with about 140 sq ft of space. It’s quite difficult to get a small TV of quality. I was replacing a 36” Samsung TV with as close to the same as possible. My old Samsung TV was around 20 years old, and suddenly the picture was fading to black. My complaint? My TV was mounted and I figured I could just trade out TV’s. WRONG. I had to wait a few more days to get a special hardware kit from Samsung so I could mount the TV. I CRY FOUL!!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviewList.review: I love this TV! After reading many reviews I was not sure what to expect. The delivery was great. The TV arrived 12 hours earlier than expected. The delivery personnel were great. It was easy to install the TV stands and hook up my other devices. I always connect my stereo & speakers so I was concerned about how to attach them due to the TV not having that type of port. The Bluetooth feature on my stereo and the Bluetooth pairing feature on the TV made this an easy task. As for volume, in the TV settings menu, I changed the 'Sound Mode' to Amplify. Between this setting and my stereo system the sound is perfect and loud enough for me. In fact, even without my stereo turned on, the TV setting of Amplify makes the TV volume much louder. The remote can be charged either by solar or by attaching a Type C charging cord. As the instructions suggest, I agree using a Samsung Type C cord is best. I have small fingers so I do not mind the size of the remote or its features. I think Samsung is smart and consciousness about not being wasteful and using extra unnecessary materials. Lastly, my TV is facing my main large window. I was concerned about glare and TV brightness of the picture. During set up, I chose the feature which allows the TV to automatically adjust to light. I am also using 'Eco' mode for the brightness. It is perfect for me. I am so glad I bought this TV and will buy the same type from Samsung in the future when/if necessary.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewList.review: My 3 year old LG LED tv was ok. No issues, just decided to upgrade. I researched a lot and decided to spend a few hundred extra for a QLED. The Samsung Q60 model was always mentioned as a good tv. Well, it’s a great tv. Much better than a regular led. Really happy with this tv

reviewList.reviewTitle: nice quality for a great price.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviewList.review: Wanted to upgrade my TV and I've not been disappointed. Beautiful picture .I would definitely recommend this TV.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviewList.review:
I needed a modest-sized flatscreen for my kitchen and this Samsung worked out perfectly. The picture is great and the setup is simple. I mostly use it with an Apple TV and a TiVo Mini.

I've owned a few Samsung flatscreens and I've been really pleased with all of them.

reviewList.reviewTitle: The only 32” 4K TV on the market
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviewList.review: I only had room for a 32” TV, but I wanted a 4K screen. Enter the Samsung QLED 4K Q60C. This is a great TV with amazing picture quality. The remote control does not have number buttons, which I thought was weird. Then I realized I only stream TV and haven’t entered a channel number in over 7 years (there is a way to input numbers, there just aren’t any dedicated physical buttons). My only complaint is that I wish it had one more HDMI port and had an ATSC 3.0 tuner. That would have made the TV much more future-proof. If you don’t know what an ATSC tuner is, look it up. If you do, then you know that the 2024 model (maybe 2025) will probably have the 3.0 tuner, as they have been steadily adopted in higher-end TVs since 2020.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviewList.review: I purchased the 50 in tv, wonderful picture, but the volume is awful. So if you plan on purchasing this TV, be sure to buy a sound bar..

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviewList.review:
I bought this 75" Samsung after my comparatively priced TCL 65" developed screen issues after just 13 months(Thanks Asurion for covering it) and I must say I'm happy with my purchase. I also had a 55" TCL go kaput after just 2 years. I doubt they've done long term tests on the TCL big screens as the reviews have been glowing, but my experience says steer clear.

If you're in the market for a reasonably price big screen tv for your living room then look no further as this is a great tv for your average person. This might not be a serious gamer or videophile set but the picture pops and to me the contrast is great which is important.

These are the pros that were important to me:

Pros:
Beautiful picture especially in higher resolution
Deeper blacks
Minimalist remote that works with my Vizio soundbar
Optical to work with my older soundbar
Nice design with very thin bezel
Rechargeable remote(USB C) with solar recharging also! No batteries to change!
Pleasing interface, easy to navigate
Samsung product. I've always had good luck with their tv's though I did buy the Asurion insurance just in case.
Sale price was reasonable

Cons:
I had an issue with VESA bolt holes when mounting but I got 'er done.

I'll update if I have any issues.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: This Samsung Qled TV offers an excellent picture and decent sound for a reasonable price ($597 for 55”). Granted the picture is not quite as good as high end Qled TV’s or OLED TV’s which are far more expensive, but for the price it is very good. The only minor downside is the small & confusing remote but for about $10 a full size remote can be purchased here on Amazon.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviewList.review: I needed to replace my "black screen" failed TV. After researching TV reviews, I chose this Samsung, and I am most pleased with it. Best picture detail and color quality I've ever had. Sound quality is great too. Using my home Wi-Fi service, the initial setup and software update was flawless and easy. This TV has the latest technology features, and with Internet updates I'll always have the latest future updates available. I'm thoroughly enjoying all TV programs, sports, and movies. Good value for the price.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Its a nice tv, but not great
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviewList.review: I replaced a 5-6 year old tv with this samsung. It has a lot of good features, the picture quality is great, the colors, brightness, sharpness are all things to be desired. Where this tv falls off a bit for me is the interface, it just looks cheap. Setting up all the apps can be really annoying aswell. Ive also had a few issues with random turn offs, or certain apps always having an issue, like netflix, and history channel. I was able to get this tv for such a good deal around black friday so for the value its a great tv. I just dont love the samsung software. All that said, its a solid tv for the price. Picture quality is the most important feature to me so im happy with the tv overall.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviewList.review: Well-packaged, gorgeous picture, good sound even without our sound bar. Love the tiny remote. The picture is so good that someone said “it looks weird!” before we realized it was because we could see so much more detail.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review:
It took me quite a while to convince my Wife that we were due for an upgrade. SInce we got it she Love's
the Samsung Q60c. Great price, picture quality and ease of use. Me as the Husband absolutley am glad with our continued love of Samsung products and support. Samsung sound bar works perfect. Connective abllity to my Dish provider took tv to another level.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviewList.review: I got it primarily for gaming. It has the Gamepass app and gaming hub built in, which is nice. The picture on games are fantastic. The sound isn't amazing, but certainly good enough. I may invest in a soundbar at some point. The remote however is pretty confusing at first with the buttons not specifying what they do. Once you figure it out, it's fine though. The solar power recharge feature is a nice touch. Overall I'm quite happy with this as a gaming teleivision. The movies I've tested on 4K Blu Ray look superb too.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviewList.review:
Samsung 85” TV review. Here’s how it went. First the packing is pitifully flimsy. One of the 4 plastic snaps that hold the ends of the cardboard box was pre-broken, thankfully the other 3 held. The segmented Styrofoam elements formed a chain around only the perimeter of the carton but provided no flex prevention to the carton. Little diagrams stamped along the bottom depicting opening procedures convened nothing instructive but we managed to carefully open the box. Once opened it was about the same size and the Sony 85” it was replacing. Good so far. The single double sides page of instructions were very colorful with tons of arrows, but may have equally been useful for launching jets off an aircraft carrier or construction a bridge beam girder. Only one single item was useful: mounting to a wall bracket requires 4 M8 bolts which were NOT included. Really Samsung? A dimes worth of bolts you can’t provide on a $2K tv? Strike one.

Now all connected and plugged in we reach for the remote to turn on the new tv. The remote is charged not by batteries but a solar window on the back or by USB port, the cable for that was also NOT provided. Luckily I had one that worked and charged the remote enough to begin. Strike two.

The tv came on in glorious super bright color! I'm talking lighthouse bright. No problem, I’ll tone down the output with settings. But first what’s with the 2” wide band of tiny vertical lines just off the right edge of the screen? Or the 1” band of squiggly bars of colored lines racing across the very bottom of the screen? No amount of scrolling thru endless steps of the limited buttons on the remote would remove or provide any insight of the errant lines on the screen. Strike 3.

A call to customer service was next. I won’t describe the events between dialing the number and finally talking to a person (in India? Pakistan? The Caribbean?) who was very nice and requested a photo of the lines on the screen, texted to a particular number, which I did. No response. We have spent almost 2 hours now and obviously this unit is faulted. Frustration and disappointment fill the room. Back to Amazon it goes. Having spent thousand of dollars on Amazon over the years, this is my first return, and I discover the return process will take up to 37 days to refund my $2200. Lesson learned: no more big expenditures with Amazon.

I have been a fan of Sony television since the Trinitron days. For the past 45 years, every TV I bought for myself or bought for my kids or gifted- was a Sony, including the last one: an 85 incher. Loved it. Then one day it wouldn’t come on. Died after 19 months. NINETEEN MONTHS for a $2300 TV? Disappointed beyond words. But I’m fortunate to have a helpful son (who favors Samsung) and just happens to know everything and rather than go another 10 rounds with him over which TV is best I just bought an 85” Samsung. This was a mistake. Maybe I just got a bad one or maybe the overworked handlers of Amazon weren’t as careful as they could have been, given the inadequate packaging. Possibly some disreputable seller unloaded some questionable name brand components to Amazon, who knows. But over all I prefer the Sony picture, remote and necessary devices included over the Samsung. There are no major electronics retailers within 60 miles of my location so I’ll stuff a sock on my sons mouth and order another Sony; from either Walmart or Circuit City.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Best 4k tv you'll ever get for this price!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review: I'm a die hard Samsung fan and I absolutely love this TV. I bought two of them! They aren't OLED as that style are still pretty pricey but the quality is far superior to other brands. Samsung is a world leading tech manufacturer that excells in innovation and development. They produce most of their own products including their QLED tv/monitor line and all of their AMOLED screens in their galaxy books and smartphones. For the price, this TV is amazing. Everything I watch now is rendered in 4k and it's a world of difference. Even movies from the 80's look completely different. I saw some reviews mentioning their packaging was sub par and they must just be unlucky. Both of my tvs were very secure in their boxes and wrapped and supported with foam to the max. I've honestly never seen anything of low quality from this company. I couldn't be happier. Samsung forever!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviewList.review: This is a great price for an above-average TV. But if Amazon photos are important to you, it's not compatible, although they offer Amazon Alexa and Music...weird. the remote is glitchy and inferior to the Firestick. The 'add apps' is especially frustrating, because there isn't even a space bar on the search. If the app you're looking for isn't offered in the 'suggestions' as you type a partial search....too bad and no way to search. That's goofy. Picture is very good, a soundbar is essential. All in all, worth the current price, but I wouldn't go over that.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2023
reviewList.review:
Love the new TV, the setup was a breeze. The picture quality and sound quality is amazing. The TV has been mounted on the wall. And on the simpler side, I love the fact that the remote has a solar charge built into it and the remote integrates with some devices, XBOX One etc. etc.

The TV is fairly decent for gaming, however it wasn't purchase for that reason due to the low level Hz.

Note: Looking at the rear of the TV, the inputs are on the left and the power input is on the right. I would suggest getting HDMI angle adaptors to make connecting the cables easier without putting strain on the HDMI slots.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviewList.review: Tv came in perfect condition and works amazing.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviewList.review:
Play Video
 Bought this TV about a week ago, easy to assemble but heavy for mounting on the wall so make sure to get some friends to help. Picture is amazing! Responds fast, and remote works from all the way down the hall. Highly recommend!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviewList.review:
This was my first smart tv to buy at 55". The picture is amazing and great to game on. However, the streaming services have been abysmal. I have fiber internet so connection isn't the issue. Whenever I use live streaming apps for sports related content (ESPN, Paramount+, Fox Sports, Bally Sports), 10-15 minutes into the event the TV freezes. I have to hard reboot every time this happens. I've tried reinstalling apps, factory reset on the Samsung Smart Hub, and it still occurs. Samsung Service team came out to take a look, and of course it wouldn't freeze up when they were here so there was nothing they could do. Sure enough after they leave it starts freezing up. On some occasions that it doesn't freeze, it will auto swap to the cable antennae (which I don't have set up) or the Samsung Live TV channel.

It's a shame this is happening because I love the picture quality that it brings and all the settings you can give it, and it's preventing me from having people over to watch a big game knowing that I'll just be resetting my TV every 15 minutes. I was going to return it till I saw that this problem can be alleviated by using a 3rd party streaming device/stick. So I am currently using a ROKU 4k HDR streaming stick, so far no problems. It's a shame that I have to pay for an extra streaming device to properly use this TV, although from what I have researched, Samsung just has bad software in some of their TVs.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviewList.review: Easy to install. Picture is good, sound is just OK.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Solid TV. Full of features, and the only 4K 32inch TV there is.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviewList.review:
I wanted a smaller 4K TV for my computer/gaming space. You really can't find 4K TVs that are 40 inches or less. This TV has a great picture and comes packed with features. It has tons of streaming services right out of the box, so you don't need to connect it to satellite/cable. The gaming mode is awesome if you have an Xbox game pass or a Luna account, as you don't need to hook up your Xbox! I also like that when I turn on a gaming system, the TV automatically switches to gaming mode settings. Neat!

Of course, there are bugs. It was finicky with certain HDMI connections - mainly my HDMI switcher. This is kinda the norm with Samsung products, though, so I wasn't that surprised. It also really requires a Samsung Smartthings account and a phone/app. If you're one of those people who hate using your phone/apps to do things (yes, those people exist. I know some) this TV is not for you.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviewList.review: Bought this for my kitchen because I tend to watch evening programs there while my husband is watching other shows in the living room. My old TV didn't have very good sound quality, but I also have some ambient hearing loss. Easy setup and the picture and sound quality is really good for me. I didn't rate the TV's remote because I only use my Roku remote.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviewList.review: Unfortunately the sound is not clear -sounds muffled. We had to hook up external speaker.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviewList.review:
First, i will start by saying I love Samsung televisions, only brand i purchase! I set up the tv set about a week or so ago. Picture looks great and the sound quality is decent. My issue is with the remote control. Since the set up, i have had to pair my remote 5 different times. Not sure what is the issue here, the control is fully charged but when I turn the set off in the evening, the next morning it only turns the tv on and no other functions is working unless i pair again..

Is this normal??

F.Q.

The sound isn't amazing, but certainly good enough. I may invest in a soundbar at some point. The remote however is pretty confusing at first with the buttons not specifying what they do. Once you figure it out, it's fine though. The solar power recharge feature is a nice touch. Overall I'm quite happy with this as a gaming teleivision. The movies I've tested on 4K Blu Ray look superb too.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviewList.review:
Samsung 85” TV review. Here’s how it went. First the packing is pitifully flimsy. One of the 4 plastic snaps that hold the ends of the cardboard box was pre-broken, thankfully the other 3 held. The segmented Styrofoam elements formed a chain around only the perimeter of the carton but provided no flex prevention to the carton. Little diagrams stamped along the bottom depicting opening procedures convened nothing instructive but we managed to carefully open the box. Once opened it was about the same size and the Sony 85” it was replacing. Good so far. The single double sides page of instructions were very colorful with tons of arrows, but may have equally been useful for launching jets off an aircraft carrier or construction a bridge beam girder. Only one single item was useful: mounting to a wall bracket requires 4 M8 bolts which were NOT included. Really Samsung? A dimes worth of bolts you can’t provide on a $2K tv? Strike one.

Now all connected and plugged in we reach for the remote to turn on the new tv. The remote is charged not by batteries but a solar window on the back or by USB port, the cable for that was also NOT provided. Luckily I had one that worked and charged the remote enough to begin. Strike two.

The tv came on in glorious super bright color! I'm talking lighthouse bright. No problem, I’ll tone down the output with settings. But first what’s with the 2” wide band of tiny vertical lines just off the right edge of the screen? Or the 1” band of squiggly bars of colored lines racing across the very bottom of the screen? No amount of scrolling thru endless steps of the limited buttons on the remote would remove or provide any insight of the errant lines on the screen. Strike 3.

A call to customer service was next. I won’t describe the events between dialing the number and finally talking to a person (in India? Pakistan? The Caribbean?) who was very nice and requested a photo of the lines on the screen, texted to a particular number, which I did. No response. We have spent almost 2 hours now and obviously this unit is faulted. Frustration and disappointment fill the room. Back to Amazon it goes. Having spent thousand of dollars on Amazon over the years, this is my first return, and I discover the return process will take up to 37 days to refund my $2200. Lesson learned: no more big expenditures with Amazon.

I have been a fan of Sony television since the Trinitron days. For the past 45 years, every TV I bought for myself or bought for my kids or gifted- was a Sony, including the last one: an 85 incher. Loved it. Then one day it wouldn’t come on. Died after 19 months. NINETEEN MONTHS for a $2300 TV? Disappointed beyond words. But I’m fortunate to have a helpful son (who favors Samsung) and just happens to know everything and rather than go another 10 rounds with him over which TV is best I just bought an 85” Samsung. This was a mistake. Maybe I just got a bad one or maybe the overworked handlers of Amazon weren’t as careful as they could have been, given the inadequate packaging. Possibly some disreputable seller unloaded some questionable name brand components to Amazon, who knows. But over all I prefer the Sony picture, remote and necessary devices included over the Samsung. There are no major electronics retailers within 60 miles of my location so I’ll stuff a sock on my sons mouth and order another Sony; from either Walmart or Circuit City.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Best 4k tv you'll ever get for this price!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviewList.review: I'm a die hard Samsung fan and I absolutely love this TV. I bought two of them! They aren't OLED as that style are still pretty pricey but the quality is far superior to other brands. Samsung is a world leading tech manufacturer that excells in innovation and development. They produce most of their own products including their QLED tv/monitor line and all of their AMOLED screens in their galaxy books and smartphones. For the price, this TV is amazing. Everything I watch now is rendered in 4k and it's a world of difference. Even movies from the 80's look completely different. I saw some reviews mentioning their packaging was sub par and they must just be unlucky. Both of my tvs were very secure in their boxes and wrapped and supported with foam to the max. I've honestly never seen anything of low quality from this company. I couldn't be happier. Samsung forever!

All in all, worth the current price, but I wouldn't go over that.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviewList.review:
I bought this 75" Samsung after my comparatively priced TCL 65" developed screen issues after just 13 months(Thanks Asurion for covering it) and I must say I'm happy with my purchase. I also had a 55" TCL go kaput after just 2 years. I doubt they've done long term tests on the TCL big screens as the reviews have been glowing, but my experience says steer clear.

If you're in the market for a reasonably price big screen tv for your living room then look no further as this is a great tv for your average person. This might not be a serious gamer or videophile set but the picture pops and to me the contrast is great which is important.

These are the pros that were important to me:

Pros:
Beautiful picture especially in higher resolution
Deeper blacks
Minimalist remote that works with my Vizio soundbar
Optical to work with my older soundbar
Nice design with very thin bezel
Rechargeable remote(USB C) with solar recharging also! No batteries to change!
Pleasing interface, easy to navigate
Samsung product. I've always had good luck with their tv's though I did buy the Asurion insurance just in case.
Sale price was reasonable

Cons:
I had an issue with VESA bolt holes when mounting but I got 'er done.

I'll update if I have any issues.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviewList.review: This Samsung Qled TV offers an excellent picture and decent sound for a reasonable price ($597 for 55”). Granted the picture is not quite as good as high end Qled TV’s or OLED TV’s which are far more expensive, but for the price it is very good. The only minor downside is the small & confusing remote but for about $10 a full size remote can be purchased here on Amazon.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviewList.review: I needed to replace my "black screen" failed TV. After researching TV reviews, I chose this Samsung, and I am most pleased with it. Best picture detail and color quality I've ever had. Sound quality is great too. Using my home Wi-Fi service, the initial setup and software update was flawless and easy. This TV has the latest technology features, and with Internet updates I'll always have the latest future updates available. I'm thoroughly enjoying all TV programs, sports, and movies. Good value for the price.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Its a nice tv, but not great
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviewList.review: I replaced a 5-6 year old tv with this samsung. It has a lot of good features, the picture quality is great, the colors, brightness, sharpness are all things to be desired. Where this tv falls off a bit for me is the interface, it just looks cheap. Setting up all the apps can be really annoying aswell. Ive also had a few issues with random turn offs, or certain apps always having an issue, like netflix, and history channel. I was able to get this tv for such a good deal around black friday so for the value its a great tv. I just dont love the samsung software. All that said, its a solid tv for the price. Picture quality is the most important feature to me so im happy with the tv overall.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviewList.review:
This was my first smart tv to buy at 55". The picture is amazing and great to game on. However, the streaming services have been abysmal. I have fiber internet so connection isn't the issue. Whenever I use live streaming apps for sports related content (ESPN, Paramount+, Fox Sports, Bally Sports), 10-15 minutes into the event the TV freezes. I have to hard reboot every time this happens. I've tried reinstalling apps, factory reset on the Samsung Smart Hub, and it still occurs. Samsung Service team came out to take a look, and of course it wouldn't freeze up when they were here so there was nothing they could do. Sure enough after they leave it starts freezing up. On some occasions that it doesn't freeze, it will auto swap to the cable antennae (which I don't have set up) or the Samsung Live TV channel.

It's a shame this is happening because I love the picture quality that it brings and all the settings you can give it, and it's preventing me from having people over to watch a big game knowing that I'll just be resetting my TV every 15 minutes. I was going to return it till I saw that this problem can be alleviated by using a 3rd party streaming device/stick. So I am currently using a ROKU 4k HDR streaming stick, so far no problems. It's a shame that I have to pay for an extra streaming device to properly use this TV, although from what I have researched, Samsung just has bad software in some of their TVs.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviewList.review: Easy to install. Picture is good, sound is just OK.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Solid TV. Full of features, and the only 4K 32inch TV there is.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviewList.review:
I wanted a smaller 4K TV for my computer/gaming space. You really can't find 4K TVs that are 40 inches or less. This TV has a great picture and comes packed with features. It has tons of streaming services right out of the box, so you don't need to connect it to satellite/cable. The gaming mode is awesome if you have an Xbox game pass or a Luna account, as you don't need to hook up your Xbox! I also like that when I turn on a gaming system, the TV automatically switches to gaming mode settings. Neat!

Of course, there are bugs. It was finicky with certain HDMI connections - mainly my HDMI switcher. This is kinda the norm with Samsung products, though, so I wasn't that surprised. It also really requires a Samsung Smartthings account and a phone/app. If you're one of those people who hate using your phone/apps to do things (yes, those people exist. I know some) this TV is not for you.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviewList.review: Bought this for my kitchen because I tend to watch evening programs there while my husband is watching other shows in the living room. My old TV didn't have very good sound quality, but I also have some ambient hearing loss. Easy setup and the picture and sound quality is really good for me. I didn't rate the TV's remote because I only use my Roku remote.

My issue is with the remote control. Since the set up, i have had to pair my remote 5 different times. Not sure what is the issue here, the control is fully charged but when I turn the set off in the evening, the next morning it only turns the tv on and no other functions is working unless i pair again..

Is this normal??

F.Q.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviewList.review: Item came just as described. Nice and heavy duty! Came with several different sizes of screws and spacers. The mount was easy to hang and with lots of cutouts so that I could line up the mount perfectly onto the studs. Also had a paper layout that match’s the base so you could lay out where you want it and predrill your holes for the lag screws. To work for my application I flipped over the head where the tv actually mounts so that the swing arm was on the right side and the mount would still tilt in a downward direction. This was accomplished by removing 1 bolt and flipping it and reinstalling the bolt. Very easy. The other thing I like about it and one of the main reasons i bought this model was because it has a very long reach which will allow me or other users to “get it around obstacles”. As you can see in my pics it had to pull out enough to get around the cabinets for ones on the right side of the room to see. This model easily does that with length to spare!! The mounting bars also have several spaces so that you can find the perfect fit for most TVs. This one had 4 different spots that would allow my tv to mount. The way i chose let some of the bracket hang below the tv which will allow me to mount a board and attach a sound bar to it as well (this may not work for all tvs) however if you didn’t want to see the mounting bars they would have allowed me to mount them flush i just chose not to. Over all this mount is great! Seems to be very sturdy and should last for a long time. Very versatile and has so many mounting holes, tons of tvs should fit. My tv is a LG OLED 65’ C series so if you have one, this mount will work perfect! Only thing I would say and it’s not negative, is that it’s heavy and you will probably want some help holding it up as you lag screw it to the wall. Once hung, your good to go!!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Awesome Extendable TV Wall Mount! Good Price
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviewList.review:
I needed an extendable wall mount for my outside TV. It needed to extended at least three feet and be strong enough to support a 65 lb TV. After reading the specifications and reviews I settled on this mount. I’m glad I did!

Easy to install and VERY strong. It easily supports the TV and extends over 40 inches. I was concerned that it would be “flimsy” when fully extended. Not at all. This thing is robust and strong no mater what position you need it in. And it holds its places position. No wandering. I cannot recommend this extendable wall mount enough! It’s very well made and reasonably priced AND arrived when promised.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviewList.review: This is the best product I have purchased in a while!! The size is perfect, it moves with ease, very sturdy, and a snap to mount! Love the TV mount!

reviewList.reviewTitle: Very sturdy and super easy to install
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviewList.review: We have a 75-inch TV - this wall mount handles it with ease. I was concerned about how sturdy it would be, but it is perfect for what we have. It was very easy to install and it is easy to adjust the TV using the mount.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviewList.review: I have no idea what I was expecting, this mount is very sturdy and performs better than I could have expected. As a mounting tip I would suggest removing the wall plate from the arms and mounting it first. Once the plate is attached to the wall and level then install the two bolts Required to attach the arms then hang your TV. Very simple install and works very well. The last installation note I will give is to loosen the bolts at the pivot points if you find the TV hard to move. After slightly loosening the bolts the TV moves smoothly And with very little effort.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviewList.review: Perfect, tried another but returned it - just wasn't strong enough. I have a Samsung 85" QLED that weighs 93 lbs. It holds it with no problem. We placed ~140lbs on it fully extended - no issues at all. Great overall product design, documentation and features. It is Perfect.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviewList.review: I purchased this mount for my new Samsung 65” TV after researching and reading many reviews. As you can see I needed a mount that would let me place it in a corner. I highly recommend this product if you have a corner mount also. Installation was very easy and it came with various hardware for all sorts of variation in TV’s and mounting. It is one heavy duty mount and will extend out 40” and almost endless positioning for just that right sweet spot. I am sure it would hold the weight of 2 TV’s this size with ease. It was easy to level the Tv as well. I would definitely buy this again!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewList.review: Great mount, very sturdy! Easy to install. Would buy again. Love how far out it swings as it made it really easy to mount the TV once it was ready!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviewList.review:
I have a large multiuse room with a bed and exercise equipment in it. I needed a TV mount that I could swivel in all kinds of tilts and out swing directions. This mount fit perfectly for my application. Heavy steel construction with big lag bolts to screw into 2X4 studs. I mounted a 43 inch Sony Flat screen KD43X77L. If you are mounting a Sony you will have to use the mounting adapter screws PN: 502741401. These screws come with your TV so don't throw them out with the packing material. Amazon has adapter screws for about 17 USD.

https://www.amazon.com/500986102-500986101-Adapter-Attachment-85X8000H/dp/B0CPDYJ74K/ref=sr_1_6?crid=ZKYXSJZFLBW9&keywords=sony+tv+mount+screws&qid=1705505369&sprefix=sony+tv+mount+screws%2Caps%2C133&sr=8-6

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviewList.review: This mount was fairly easy to install with clear instructions! It worked out perfectly for what I needed. I mounted a 65” TV that needed an 18” extension from the wall. There were adequate spacers of different lengths to adapt the screws to mount the TV to the bracket. For the most part a one person job!

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
reviewList.review: Very strong easy to mount monitor stand.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Quality irem at a fair price.

reviewList.review: No.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviewList.review: 10/10. Sturdy, easy to install, flexible. A little tough to maneuver since my TV is so heavy. Excellent range of motion

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviewList.review: Nice piece.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Wow! Now this is Heavy Duty!
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021
reviewList.review: This mount is very heavy duty. It is in one piece so mounting it on the wall by yourself is almost impossible. That being said it is easy to install with 2 people. I mounted a 75" TV in the corner and it works perfect. No complaints what so ever. If you have a large TV this is the mount for you.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
reviewList.review: It's definitely sturdy... works great.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022
reviewList.review: Once you can adjust your viewing angle like you can with this mount you will wonder how you ever watched TV without it. I have an open concept living room, dinning room, and Kitchen I can adjust the TV to see no matter where I am.

reviewList.reviewTitle: Perfect for my application. Very sturdy.
reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021
reviewList.review:
Was originally sent the wrong mount. Returned it for a full refund and re-ordered the correct mount again.
I needed a mount that will allow viewing completely around the corner and it does just that. Like others I found the joints to be too tight so I took a couple of wrenches and loosened them a little. That solved the problem.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviewList.review: Does not disappoint.

reviewList.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2023
reviewList.review: Entirely too stiff. I've got a TV that only weighs 30lbs and I should be able to move it easily, but not with this mount. I feel like I have to be extremely careful and only move it using the actual arms themselves or it is going to rip right out of the wall. Forget trying to adjust it by holding and moving the TV if you don't want to break your TV. The manufacturer suggests oiling it, which I've tried, but it didn't seem to do much, if anything, to relieve the stiffness of the arms.

Take in a billion shades of unwavering color and enjoy vivid, lifelike color at any brightness level as Quantum Dot technology works to create every shade you see on screen—because even a clear blue sky can contain thousands of different colors.¹
productDetail.Quantum Processor Lite with 4K Upscaling: See your favorite shows and movies in a whole new light with 4K optimization. You'll enjoy enhanced clarity and depth in every scene as our Quantum Processor Lite with 4K Upscaling automatically transforms everything you watch.
productDetail.Dual LED: Don't call it temperamental. You'll enjoy beautifully balanced colors with dedicated warm and cool Dual LED backlights. Get stronger and accurate contrast with innovative technology that adapts automatically to match your content. Whether you're keeping up with live sports or your favorite reality TV shows, you'll get a natural, realistic picture and stronger, more accurate contrast with innovative technology that adapts automatically to match your content.
productDetail.Quantum HDR: Watch the details shine through with Quantum HDR that goes beyond leading standards to create deep blacks, impressive contrast, and picture quality that's analyzed and refined to match the creator's vison. There's no need to search for the perfect display settings, as this powerful technology works automatically to bring you beautifully optimized imagery no matter what you're watching.
productDetail.Motion Xcelerator: Stay cool in the driver's seat. Don't let the action pass by in a blur. Experience smooth motion and improved clarity with Motion Xcelerator. Now you can fuel your need for speed with high-intensity sports, movies, and games, and enjoy crisp and clear details at the same time. The picture on-screen moves smoothly as motion performance features make automatic adjustments so you don't miss a thing.
productDetail.Object Tracking Sound Lite: Get in the mix with Object Tracking Sound Lite. You'll hear 3D surround sound that follows the movement on screen using our incredible virtual top channel audio—putting you right in the middle of the car chase, stampede or party scene.
productDetail.Q-Symphony 3.0: Amp up your audio with the greatest duo of all time—Samsung TVs paired with a Samsung soundbar. With Q-Symphony, your TV speakers paired with Q-Series and S-Series soundbar operate as one. Together, they can optimize all the channels to bring you a masterfully orchestrated sound experience. It's a completely next-level experience that even works with Object Tracking Sound for an extra layer of depth.²
productDetail.Samsung Gaming Hub: Where gaming comes together. Stream your favorite games right from your TV. No console required.³
productDetail.AirSlim Design: Now you see it—now you don't. The AirSlim Design —so thin it practically blends into your wall.
